loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 20 years old and still single. He lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with his family. Kevin helps his family grow rice at their farm. He also raises ducks.

Kevin always wanted to have his own bakery. He said that he wants to start slowly and hopefully be able to reach his dream. Kevin now makes banana cakes that he sells to the people in his community. He works hard helping his family and growing his business.

This loan will be used to purchase bananas, flour and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, flour and sugar

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador muy hacendoso en sus labores, tiene 44 años D. edad y 3 hijos a su cargo que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Diego vive en L. zona rural del caserío C. del Medano, ubicado a 25 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Morrope –  Chiclayo.

Diego se gana L. vida desD. hace 6  años vendiendo animales menores, que él mismo cría en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Diego cuenta con un  ganado porcino y  ovino. Además gana algo D. dinero extra por brindar sus servicios en labores agrícolas.

Diego solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles, para ampliar su negocio, puesto que los gastos en L. educación D. sus hijos lo requieren. Específicamente Diego quiere invertir en L. compra D. aves menores para engorD. y en alimento balanceado para sus cerdos.  A pesar D. L. competencia que tiene este trabajo, Diego se siente confiado D. poder obtener ganancias porque existe un amplio sector donD. se pueD. comercializar.

Diego tiene experiencia con Edpyme Alternativa, es un cliente antigua que goza D. un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Diego is an enterprising and hardworking man who is very industrious with his work. He is 44 years old and he has 3 school-aged children in his care. Diego lives in the rural community of C. del Medano, located at 25 minutes from the city of Morrope, Chiclayo.

For the past 6 years, Diego has earned a living by selling small livestock that he raises himself in corrals located in the rear section of his property. Diego has pigs and sheep. He also earns extra money by providing his services in agricultural projects. 

Diego requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to expand his business especially because his children's educational expenses require it. Specifically, Diego wants to invest in the purchase of poultry to raise and to purchase balanced feed for his pigs. Despite the competition in his field of work, Diego feels confident in obtaining a profit because there is a large market to which he can sell. 

Diego has had experience with Edpyme Alternativa, being a long time client, and he enjoys a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and livestock feed.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un cliente D. 37 años D. edad, está casado y vive en L. zona rural del distrito D. Túcume- Lambayeque. L. comunidad donD. vive Martin es una comunidad principalmente ganadera y agricultora.

Martin se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales, actualmente cuenta con un ganado ovino que una vez alcanzado  tamaño y peso ideal, comercializa en el mercado Modelo, el mercado con mayor afluencia del distrito D. Chiclayo.

Martin es un hombre con muchos deseos D. superación y  desea expandir su negocio. Este es el motivo por el cual solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles, con el que comprará animales y alimento balanceado. Así incrementará sus ventas y podrá mejorar su calidad D. vid, que es algo que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Martin is 37, married and lives in a rural area of the Tucume district of Lambayeque.  Martin's community is primarily engaged in agriculture and livestock production.  

Martin has a business raising and selling animals.  He now has a cow that is reaching its idea size and weight which he will sell in the Modelo market, the most affluent market in the Chiclayo district.

Martin is a man who has a strong desire to succeed, and he wants to expand his business.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles, which he will use to buy animals and animal feed.  In this way, he can increase his sales and be able to improve his quality of life, which is something that he really wants to do.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally balanced animal feed

loans.name: Eder

texts.es: Eder es un joven de 25 años de edad, que tiene un negocio llamado “E Internet “en el centro del municipio de Puerto Colombia, población ubicada al noroccidente del departamento del Atlántico, que colinda al norte con las costas del mar Caribe.   Eder es  un publicista gráfico y estudiante de ingeniería electrónica, que desde hace dos años decidió dar curso libre a su capacidad emprendedora,  mediante la apertura de un café internet con el fin de fortalecer sus ingreso personales y lograr la meta de estudiar  una carrera profesional. En su negocio ofrece servicios de llamadas telefónicas, fax, fotocopiaje,internet y articulos de papelería,  entre los vecinos de su comunidad y en colegios cercanos que son sus principales clientes actuales.  Eder más adelante planea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo en calidad de arrendamiento el local contiguo,  para diversificar su oferta y ampliar sus servicios. Eder se siente muy satisfecho  con su actividad, pero tiene el gran desafío de la competencia a la que responde entregando a sus clientes un servicio de excelencia y adicionándole muy buenos precios. Mientras construye su sueño de incrementar su margen de utilidad, que en la actualidad es no menor del 35%, continua trabajando con mucho esmero y entusiasmado, con el crecimiento de su clientela. Este es el primer financiamiento que Eder hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará artículos de papelería,  para responder a un contrato de suministros,  que tiene con una organización gubernamental del municipio y con este nuevo ingreso,  aumentaría sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Eder is a young man of 25 who has a business called "E Internet" (And Internet) in the center of Puerto Colombia, a town which is located in the North-west of Atlántico department and borders with the Caribbean coast to the north.  Eder is a graphic publicist and an electronic engineering student.  Two years ago, he decided to give free reign to his entrepreneurial capacity by opening an Internet café, with the aim of strengthening his personal income and achieving his goal of studying for a professional degree.

In his business, Eder offers telephone, fax, photocopying and Internet services.  He also sells stationery products to his neighbors and to nearby schools who are his main customers.  In the future, Eder plans to expand his business, renting the adjacent business premises so that he can diversify his offerings and expand his services.

Eder feels very satisfied with his business activity but he faces a great challenge from the competition to which he responds by providing his customers with an excellent service for very good prices.  While he builds his dream of increasing his profit margin, which is currently no less than 35%, he continues working with a lot of care and enthusiasm as he grows his customer base.

This is Eder's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy stationery products in order to respond to a supply contract that he has with a governmental organization in the town.  With this new income, he will increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy stationery products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 5, 4 and 2. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She sells items like noodles, canned sardines and tuna. She also provides prepaid mobile credit loads to the people in her community. 

Gemma plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and biscuits.

In the future, Gemma hopes to have a piggery and a fishing business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and biscuits.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome makes and sells bags to earn a living.  She has been in this business for two years. Being a single mother of one, she works hard in her business in order to provide for her child. Salome has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been educated on business management and this has helped her to grow her business. Salome's dream is to open up a training school for tailors and to provide employment to several people. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and more fabric

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja vive en su tierra natal con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de su familia. Tiene 15 años de experiencia compartida con su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, cultivan primordialmente papa, trigo y cebada, junto con su esposo  comparten estas arduas tareas tanto en la época de siembra y cosecha. De esta manera  cuando se recoge la cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias  sin intermediarios que por lo general  pagan un precio que no compensa el gran esfuerzo. Maruja  y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas por lo que aumentaran su  producción viendo las posibilidades de adquirir terrenos propios y arrendados que les servirá para expandir su siembra. Se admira del tiempo de permanencia del trabajo con MFP, que a través de su banco comunal ya suman 10 oportunidades de crédito en las cuales ha mantenido su integridad  de puntualidad en sus pagos e inculca esta misma actitud a los demás miembros de su grupo. Con el dinero comprará semillas y será una cuota del pago de un terreno que esta comprando.
texts.en:
Maruja lives in her birthplace together with her husband and her children in a family home. She shares her 15 years' experience in agricultural work with her husband. Basically they cultivate potatoes, wheat, and barley. She shares this arduous work with her husband both during the planting state and during the harvest. this way when the harvest is collected from their cultivation it is sold directly to the merchants in the central market of the city. This is how they earn better earnings without middlemen who generally pay a price that is not commensurate with the great effort. Maruja and her husband wish to continue with their work. They will increase their production When they see the opportunity to acquire their own land and rent other land with an expanded plantation.

She is impressed with the time she has been with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). It was through her communal bank that she has had 10 past opportunities to access a loan. She has maintained her payment history with integrity and she inspires the same attitude in the other members of the group. With these funds she will purchase seeds and she will make one payment on a plot of land she is in the process of buying.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to make the first payment of a plot of agricultural land that she is buying.

loans.name: Eugenio Leonel

texts.es:
Eugenio Leonel, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Eugenio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Eugenio Leonel is 21 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Eugenio is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys his supplies at Briones Agrochemicals and then sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan for growing corn. He will buy composts and supplies for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in his farming activities. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). His dream is to buy a farm.

Eugenio enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Osman, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) in order to invest in his businesses. 

Osman is a wholesale businessman. He sells palm oil and peppers on a wholesale basis. He has been a professional businessman for more than 11 years now. Mr. Osman is a husband and father of six children – three in primary school and three in secondary school. Osman has requested this loan in order to buy bags of peppers for resale.

loans.use: to buy bags of peppers for resale.

loans.name: Nyakabungo Bakyara Tukore Group

texts.en:
He is a product of an environment where people lay great store on the values of diligence. In Ntungamo, where he plies his animal sales business of principally goat herding and sales from it, people pull out all the stops and explore all avenues to succeed or to alleviate themselves of their narrow circumstances. Diligence here is like a legacy handed down. Most youth who hail from Ntungamo are well-known sticklers for unwavering hard work.

The referenced person above goes by the name of Benon, a 44-year-old father of six who, on the face of it, radiates nothing but warmth, humor and confidence. It's now 13 years in this enterprise.

By and large, his business successes outweigh his shortcomings but making the best out of bad bargains is a philosophy he was taught and still reckons up to now.

His auxiliary business is farming. Farming was literally his maiden business.

Weekly, this business's gross sales revenue is to the sum of Uganda shillings 100,000.

For Benon, this is his second loan cycle. Some other members in his group are in their fourth cycle and some on their first cycle. The repayment record for the group has been up to the mark. Benon intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.name: Gregori Pizza Group

texts.es:
Gregori Pizza está conformado por tres personas los cuales son: 1 hombre y 2 mujeres, grupo del cual Byron es el presidente.

Byron tiene 31 años es separado vive solo en tabacundo a una hora de otavalo; Byron se describe como una persona tranquila, emprendedor y sin miedo a los retos.

Trabaja en su Pizzeria por un tiempo de 1 año y medio. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de los ingredientes para hacer las pizzas que va a vender en su negocio.

Con el crédito su negocio crecerá considerablemente porque aumenta su producción y mejorará sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener una cadena de comidas rápidas (pizzerias) para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Gregori Pizza group is made up of three people; one man and two women. Byron is the president.

Byron is 31 and separated. He lives alone in Tabacundo, an hour away from Otavalo. Byron describes himself as a laid-back person, an entrepreneur unafraid of challenges.

He has worked in his Pizzeria for a year and a half. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from FODEMI, and he will use it for the purchase of the ingredients for making the pizzas that he will sell in his business.

With this loan, his business will grow considerably because it will increase his production and his income. His dream is to have a fast food chain (pizzerias) to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the pizzas.

loans.name: Askia Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe  ASKIA  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames dans  la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame  ADISSA, qui  fait le commerce de parures et d’habillements dans ce groupe de femmes  est debout au milieu, en châle rouge.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pièces de bazin riche, 10 paires de boucles d’oreilles garanties et un carton de vernis pour ongles au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et à Bamako.   Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the ASKIA  group are essentially married women with an average age of 30 and on average four children. They mostly live in monogamous families in the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.  

They are on their third loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. The previous loans were correctly reimbursed. 

Madame  ADISSA, who sells costume jewelry and clothing is standing in the middle wearing a red shawl. She intends to use her share of the loan to buy 15 lengths of "rich" (high quality) damask, 10 pairs of earrings with guarantee, and a carton of nail polish at the big open-air market of Sikasso and in Bamako. She resells the goods in a stall in the big market of Sikasso or within her family, to a clientele composed mostly of women, for cash. 

She expects to make a monthly average profit of 30,000 F CFA of which part will be used to repay the loan and her interest, and another part for savings.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un hombre de 30 años. Vive con su esposa Isama y sus dos hijos pequeños de 5 y 2 años de edad en "San Rafael" una comunidad rural de "Otavalo".

San Luis de Otavalo o simplemente Otavalo es una localidad de la provincia de Imbabura, en Ecuador; situada a 110 kilómetros al norte de la ciudad de Quito. Otavalo es el municipio de mayoría indígena más rico de la República de Ecuador. Es sede del mercado artesanal indígena más grande de Sudamérica y sus productos pueden encontrarse por todo el mundo, es una zona turística muy visitada por personas de todo el mundo y de esta manera dan a conocer sus artesanías que llaman mucho la atención de quienes la visita, de igual forma prevalece la raza étnica que ellos la constituyeron y se esfuerzan para que prevalezca tanto en la ciudad como en el extranjero.

José tiene una pequeña plantación de frutilla, trabaja junto a su esposa desde hace 7 años. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus antecesores ya que en este sector desde hace miles de años la agricultura es una de las actividades principales. Él quiere arreglar su vivienda por lo que ha solicitado a Fundación Alternativa un crédito el cual le permitirá terminar un poco más su casa.

Su sueño es terminar algún día completamente su casa para darles mayor comodidad a su esposa e hijos; también nos cuenta que trabaja con mucho empreño para poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación ya que para José el no haber tenido educación formal ha sido un gran obstáculo.
texts.en:
José Manuel is a 30-year-old gentleman. He lives with his wife Isama and their two small children (ages 5 and 2) in the rural community of Otavalo in San Rafael.

San Luis de Otavalo, or simply Otavalo, is a town in the Ecuadorian province of Imbabura. It is situated 110 kilometers to the north of the city of Quito. Otavalo is the town that has the largest indigenous population within the Republic of Ecuador. It is also the home of the largest indigenous handicraft market in South America and its products can be found all over the world. Otavalo is also a tourist area that is frequently visited by people from every part of the globe. As a result, the local handicrafts receive plenty of attention from the people who come to visit. In equal fashion, the racial ethnicity of the people who live here has a strong influence over the city as well as abroad.

José has a small strawberry plantation where he and his wife have worked together for seven years. He learned this trade from his predecessors since this type of farming has taken place for thousands of years and is one of the main business activities within the area. José wants to repair his home, so he is requesting a loan from Fundación Alternativa to finish a little more work on his house.

His dream is to someday completely finish his house so that he can provide the greatest comfort for his wife and children. He also wants to work with great effort to provide his children a good education. José did not obtain a formal education for himself, which has been a great obstacle.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated. 
Severina has a shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Severina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Severina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Yeni sigue con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Yeni con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Yeni requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 
 
Yeni se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yeni continues to participate in the Communal Bank “San Isidro de Compone”, which is part of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco. She continues with her business of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. Yeni did very well with her previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason, she wants another loan to help with her business.

Yeni is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es: Nilsa, de 47 años, es una mujer amable y muy sencilla. Ella convive con su pareja, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Ellos ya son mayores y tienen familia, solo uno aún vive en su casa que es propia. EL trabajo de Nilsa consiste en la venta de comida y la venta de chupetes (Helados a base de frutas regionales), desde entonces se va muy temprano a un almacén de procesamiento de maíz de la ciudad, ahí tiene un pequeño puesto de comida y desde donde expende su comida a los trabajadores que trabajan en dicha industria. Ahí mismo vende bebidas heladas y sus deliciosos chupetes hechos a base de pura fruta y con delicioso sabor. Lleva trabajando ahí ya por tres años, lo hace sola aunque en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, quien trabaja como empleado en esa fabrica. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que cocinar ya que esta actividad fue siempre su pasión, le esta yendo bien en su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la elaboración de comida, además comprará algunas mesas y sillas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilsa, 47, is a nice and very modest woman.  She lives with her partner, with whom she has five children.  They are all grown already and have families; only one still lives with them in their home, which is their own.

Nilsa's job is selling food and frozen pops (ice cream made from regional fruits).  Since then she goes very early to a corn-processing plant in the city where she has a little food stall from where she sells her food to the workers who work in that industry.  Right there she sells ice-cold beverages and her delicious frozen pops made from pure fruit with delicious flavor.  She has worked there for three years already.  She works alone, although sometimes she receives help from her partner, who works as an employee in that factory.

What she likes about her job is that she has to cook.  Since this was always her passion, it's going well for her in her job because it generates good profits for her.

This will be her first loan with the MFP institution, for which she hopes for the support of each one of you.

With the requested loan she will buy ingredients and supplies to continue making food; she also will buy some tables and chairs to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 72 years old and he runs a dairy farming business. He has had the business for the past ten years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family.  He is married to Lucy, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with nine children.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will boost the farming business for his wife. His hopes and dreams are to open a milk bar.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her small farm, which does poultry keeping. 

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for resale, and will help Sumaya to generate greater profits and pay for medical expenses. Sumaya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sumaya's future prospects by helping her with money that has increased the capital of her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 45, resident of GMA, Cavite, the Philippines.  Her husband is Pablito, a farmer, and father to her four children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a twenty-one-year-old entrepreneur from Western Kenya. He and his wife, Janet, have no children.

Rafael operates a motorcycle transport business in his local area and has been doing this for the last three years. He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle to supplement the current one.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

Rafael's dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, just outside of Amman.
Wanting to help her husband and participate in handling the household expenses, Alia started a small project sewing on buttons and repairing clothes for her family, friends and neighbors. Then she bought a sewing machine and started a small clothes repair shop just beside her house where she repairs clothes in addition to customizing outfits and such like. 
Alia is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine to increase her productivity and increase her profits by serving more customers. In this way, she will be able to help her family to improve its lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Angela Fernanda

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer soltera de 29 años. Tras la muerte de su madre, se quedó sola y vive en la parroquia de Eloy Alfaro de Latacunga que es una ciudad de Ecuador, capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi y cabecera cantonal del cantón homónimo. Se encuentra en la Sierra centro del país, en las estribaciones de la cordillera de los Andes en Ecuador. Se encuentra a 2750 metros sobre el nivel del mar y tiene una temperatura promedio de 12 grados centígrados.

Es una ciudad que en la primera y segunda década del siglo XXI  ha demostrado un desarrollo sostenido que la ha colocado entre las ciudades más importantes de la sierra ecuatoriana en la actualidad. Todos los atributos históricos, arquitectónicos y culturales que posee Latacunga le han permitido ser considerada como Ciudad Patrimonial de la Nación.


Tras la muerte de su madre, Ángela tomó la posta en el negocio al que ella se dedicaba que es el de venta de caramelos y confites dentro de una universidad de la ciudad. El negocio ya tiene 17 años de funcionamiento. Ángela quiere invertir comprando lotes de productos y así obtener mejores precios de sus proveedores y así tener mayores ganancias. Por esta razón Ángela necesita un crédito con el cual podrá hacer realidad su inversión.

Esta mujer es estilista de profesión sin embargo no la ejerce. Ella quisiera en un futuro tener su propio "salón de belleza". Esperamos que tras esta inversión ella pueda estar más cerca de sus sueños y anhelos
texts.en:
Ángela is a 29 year old single woman. Since the death of her mother she has been on her own and lives in the Eloy Alfaro parish of Latacunga, which is a city in Ecuador. The capital of Cotopaxi Province and administrative center for Homónimo Cantón, it is in the mountainous center of the country, the foothills of the Andes in Ecuador. The city is 2750 meters above sea level and has an average temperature of 12 degrees Centigrade. In the last twenty years the city has shown sustained development which has placed it among the most important cities of the equatorial mountains today. Its historical, architectural, and cultural attributes have led to Latacunga being recognized as a National Heritage City.

After the death of her mother, Ángela took over her post in the business she runs, which is selling candies and sweets at a university in the city. The business has been in operation for 17 years. Ángela wants to invest in bulk product purchases so she can get better prices from her sources and so make a larger profit. For this reason, Ángela needs a loan with which she can make this investment a reality. 

This woman is a stylist by profession, however she does not practice this. In the future she would like to have her own beauty salon. She hopes that with this investment she can move closer to her dreams and aspirations.

loans.use: to purchase sweets in bulk at a better price

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 29 years old.  She has one child who is two and a half years old.  Her husband works in the government as a tax collector. 

She has run a business of canteen for the last 3 years.  She has requested the loan to add more items for her canteen business. She says that the profits will be used for making savings and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more canteen items to sell.

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a single 19 year old woman from Al Hashimi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy accessories, bags and clothes that she will be selling at the market. She hopes later to be able to open her own permanent shop to sell the products. She hopes to increase her social economic status. Since Enas is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. 

*Enas prefers not to have her photo on the internet thus the above photo is of her brother

loans.use: to pay for accessories, bags and clothes that she will sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 56 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a commune council who earns about $4 each day. Two of her children are employed in super market and earns about $7 each day. Sokha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase dirt to fill up her farmland. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to expand her business and help her child earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her farmland

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty and the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her children are some of the reasons that made Alice start practicing mixed farming. Alice is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. She is based in Chematany, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is mursik, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk.

Alice has been selling eggs and milk and this has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Alice passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She wakes up every morning to milk her cows. While this humble mom has been making a profit by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Alice is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions. You can help Alice to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: At 64 years old, Juliana sees her dreams becoming a reality. Her dream is to be an independent person and to be competitive dairy farmer in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Juliana is an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. Juliana passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Juliana is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Madam Akossiwa A. was born in 1955 in Tsévié in the Prefecture of Zio. She is the mother of five (05) children. Very dynamic and hardworking, she undertook early the trade of wood charcoal and cereals, two activities which are flourishing very well currently. The charcoal is bought by households for cooking, and cereals constitute the main basic food in Togo. She has shown many times her good management ability and demonstrated hard work. Considering the success implemented in her activities and significant increased demand, she needs greater financial means in order to respond to the market. The offer of this $450 credit will allow her to rent a store and assure a permanent stock for her activities and profitability.

Mme A. Akossiwa est née en 1955 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle est mère de cinq enfants. Très dynamique et audacieuse, elle a très tôt entrepris le commerce du charbon de bois et des céréales, deux activités qui lui fleurissent aujourd’hui très bien ; le charbon étant très sollicité dans les ménages pour le chauffage et les céréales constituant l’essentiel de l’alimentation de base au Togo. Elle a démontré à plusieurs reprises sa capacité de bonne gestionnaire et sa rigueur au travail. Vu le succès qu’elle réalise dans ses activités et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir répondre aux exigences du marché. L’octroi de ce crédit des $ 450 lui permettra de louer un emplacement et d’assurer un stock permanent pour la pérennité et une rentabilité de ses activités.

loans.use: To rent a location and make important storage of charcoal

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has an 8-year-old son. His father, elder brother and father-in-law are all taxi drivers so he decided to follow in their footsteps and become a taxi driver as well. His transportation business is the only source of income for his family. Vladimir is very responsible and modest and has a good reputation among other taxi drivers. He has promptly repaid each of the 11 loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. The loans have enabled him to change his vehicle 9 times in the 10-year period that he has been in business. He purchased his first car for $3,000. The last car he purchased cost $15,000. He uses an economical, diesel vehicle for his taxi and after fuel costs, he is able to bring in around $40-$50 in daily profit. Having a flexible schedule and being willing to provide transportation services all over Ukraine and to other parts of Europe have helped Vladimir get many loyal clients. Vladimir is requesting a loan of $800 to help purchase a more comfortable and reliable car. He is planning to sell his current vehicle and buy a newer Mercedes 124/300 D that is highly rated for comfort, reliability, performance, and value. A newer car will give Vladimir the opportunity to travel to other destinations, change some of his regular itineraries and expand his business. Not only will this help his business but it will also give his family a better quality of life.

Володимир – одружений, в нього є 8-річний син. Його батько, старший брат та тесть усі були водіями таксі. Отже, Володимир вирішив піти по їхніх кроках і також став таксистом. Його бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для родини. Володимир – дуже відповідальний та скромний. В нього дуже гарна репутація серед інших водіїв. Володимир вчасно сплатив усі 11 позик, які він отримав від «Надії України». Позики дали йому змогу змінити 9 транспортних засобів за 10 років, на протязі яких він займається цим бізнесом. Він купив своє перше авто за 3000 доларів. Останнє коштує 15000 доларів. Володимир використовує економічне авто з дизельним двигуном, завдяки чому йому вдається щоденно заробити 40-50 доларів чистого прибутку. Гнучкий розклад та готовність подорожувати в будь-якій частині України та країнах Європи допомогли Володимиру зберегти багато відданих клієнтів. Володимир просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб придбати більш комфортабельне та надійне авто. Він планує продати своє попереднє авто та купити новіший мерседес 124/300 D, який цінується за зручність, надійність та легкість у використанні. Новіше авто надасть Володимиру можливість подорожувати в інших напрямках, змінити деякі постійні маршрути та розширити власний бізнес. До того ж це не тільки допоможе його бізнесу, але й забезпечить кращий рівень життя для його рідних.

loans.use: To buy a new comfortable Mercedes

loans.name: Catalina Beltres

texts.en: Catalina Beltres E., age 71, has been a member of Esperanza's program for almost ten years. Her first business was a fruit stand, which she started with a loan of $90. In September 1998, hurricane George caused massive devastation to the Dominican Republic and surrounding Caribbean countries. Catalina lost her husband and her business. After several loans, Catalina demonstrated her resiliance and has since started a new clothing business. This loan of $450 will allow Catalina to increase  her inventory and branch out into new styles. Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to expand her inventory

loans.name: Elia Yaneth

texts.es:
Elia is a very hard worker. She is separated from her husband and has five children that depend completely on her. Her children are one, five, eight, twelve, and fourteen years old. Previously she worked as an employee in an assembly plant, but her children were growing and the salary that she received was becoming more and more inadequate. So she decided to begin her own business four years ago. Now she makes the uniforms for various schools, and thanks to her efforts and the quality of service that she offers, she has succeeded in growing as a small entrepeneur.

In order to meet her demands, Elia is requesting a loan of $200 dollars that she will invest in the raw materials for making school uniforms. Now she greatly needs this capital because there is very little time before school classes start again. Elia promises to repay this loan in three months. With your help, she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. They greatly appreciate your trust and support. Decide today to help Elia.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Elia es muy trabajadora, ella esta separada y tiene cinco hijos que dependen solamente de ella, de 1, 5, 8, 12 y 14 años de edad. Anteriormente ella laboraba en una maquiladora pero sus hijos fueron creciendo y el salario que ella recibía fue haciéndose cada vez más insuficiente, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 4 años, ahora elabora los uniformes de varias escuelas y gracias a su esfuerzo y al servicio de calidad que ofrece ha logrado crecer como microempresaria.

Para poder cubrir su demanda, Elia está solicitando un préstamo de $200 dólares que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los uniformes escolares, ahora necesita mucho de este capital porque falta poco para el inicio de clases, Elia se compromete a regresar este crédito en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo, decídete a ayudar a Elia.

loans.use: To buy materials to sew school uniforms

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung (65) sells sweet tofu soup at a street stall.  Her husband Hai (73) is too old and weak to work.  The tofu stand is their only source of income.  Before receiving a loan from Mekong Plus, Dung was only able sell her sweet tofu soup in the mornings because she only had a small amount of ingredients.  With the money she earned, she could only buy rice to eat.  She has borrowed twice from Mekong Plus, and Kiva funded the most recent of those loans.  Now, Dung is able to sell all day, and she earns between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day.  She wishes to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva once again to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her tofu business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 35-year-old business woman, a resident of Vingunguti in Dar Es Salaam city. She owns a butcher shop in the Vingunguti area, Dar es Salaam’s animal (cows and goats) slaughter area. She gets the cows up-country, slaughters them and sells them to meat suppliers in Dar Es Salaam city, who then supply them to the smaller butchers. She is in need of USD 1200 to help her boost capital.

loans.use: Expand working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
I have more than 10 years of experience in my grocery business. This business, in which I work with my wife, has been the family's source of income during those 10 years. We want to invest in additional inventory for the business. We are requesting a loan of $1000 for the purchase of merchandise for our store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 10 años con mi negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio ha sido el ingreso de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertirle más en mercancía al negocio. Solicitamos un préstamo $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: Stock his grocery store with additional inventory

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
I am Suriya B.. I am married and the mother of three girls and one boy. My husband is a daily wage laborer building houses. I make traditional hair bands known as prandas, and now, I require a loan to buy thread and beads to make these bands in larger quantities.

I'm also requesting loans for my other group members who are:

Saleema B. who also manufactures the same hair bands as I do;

Shahnaz B. whose husband has a tea stall;

Latifa I. who requests a loan for her husband’s beetel-nut shop; and

Azra P. who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy thread and beads in bulk for my business making traditional hair bands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare-parts shop and buy a permanent container

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị L., 34, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. She is married and has 2 children: 1 son and 1 daughter, both go to school. She used to brew liquor and sell to restaurants and locals. Then she opened an internet cafe 2 years ago. Since the local economy is going well , people need communication so internet usage has increased. Her cafe is busy. Her monthly revenue is 180 USD. Her husband is a hard working farmer, he often helps her out with errants. She's requesting a L. of 950 USD to buy new computers thus increasing her income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị L., 34 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Hai con chị, 1 trai, 1 gái, đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây công việc chính của chị L. là nấu rượu cung cấp cho người dân và quán ăn trong vùng. Hai năm trở lại đây chị vay vốn kinh doanh dịch vụ internet. Kinh tế địa phương phát triển nhu cầu thông tin người dân cao nên cửa hàng thường xuyên có khách. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng từ cửa hàng là 180USD. Chồng chị L. là một người nông dân chịu khó và thường xuyên giúp đỡ vợ trong mọi công việc. Sắp tới chị muốn được vay thêm 950USD từ Quỹ Tình thương để mua thêm máy, tăng doanh thu cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Having a talent for cooking is a characteristic that has helped Maribel prepare her delicious tamales that she makes in bulk from home almost everyday. She starts during the early hours of the day so that the tamales can be ready for the women who come to buy them and sell them on the streets or in stands. This is quite an arduous task because it takes a lot of effort to make so many tamales. She would like to increase her capital with the aim of setting up a fruit business because she has seen a great demand in this field.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El tener un don para la cocina es una característica que ha ayudado a Maribel en la preparación de sus riquísimos tamales que elabora en casa en grandes cantidades todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para que las señoras que vienen a comprarlos los tengan ya listos para venderlos de manera ambulatoria en las bodegas de su ciudad.Esta es una tarea muy cansada debido a que demanda mucho esfuerzo por la cantidad de los mismos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de pronto instalar también un negocio de venta de frutas ya que ha observado la gran demanda de esta actividad.

loans.use: Increase capital to boost production

loans.name: Semilina

texts.es:
Semilina has belonged to the Communal Urubamba Bank for 4 years. Semilina comes from the Urubamba community located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Semilina is a 40-year-old single mother with one daughter. Semilina has a store in the Huaytara District, which is 4 hours away from the city of Ayacucho. She sells clothes and varied footwear, and also buys tara powder, leathers, and cochinilL. dye, which she sells to intermediaries in Ayacucho. Additionally, Semilina weaves skirts according to order.

Semilina requires a loan toward the purchase of pants, polo shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, tara powder and cochinilL. dye.

Semilina dreams of offering a good education to her daughter and hopes that her business prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Semilina pertenece al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 4 años. Semilina proviene D. L. comunidad D. Urubamba que esta ubicado a 30 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Semilina es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Semilina tiene una tienda en el distrito D. Huaytara que esta a 4 horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, donD. venD. ropa, calzados variados y también compra tara, cueros, cochinilL. que venD. a intermediarios en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Semilina teje chompas D. acuerdo al pedido.

Semilina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pantalones, polos, chompas, zapatos, zapatillas, tara y cochinilL..

Los sueños D. Semilina son brindar una buena educación a su hija y que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, polo shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, tara (a powder used in tanning) and cochinilla (a red dye)

loans.name: Porteñas Group

texts.es:
Very early, around 5:00 a.m. the “Porteñas” association begins their day, working on the preparation of lunches that are later distributed to construction workers and institutions that have placed orders. Most of the women are young but have large families; everyone helps with the business from food preparation until the lunches are distributed.

The “Porteñas” association would like to take on larger orders to obtain larger profits, currently they need a reinforcement in their labor capital in the form of additional helpers for this purpose they are requesting a larger loan. After reaching their sales targets, they are sure this will improve the current difficult economic situation they are facing and hence improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Muy temprano alrededor de la 5:00am. la asociación “Porteñas” comienza su día trabajando en la elaboración de almuerzos para luego distribuirlos a empleados de construcciones y/o instituciones que hayan realizado sus pedidos. La mayoria de ellas son jovenes pero con familias bastante numerosas, es así que todos ayudan en el negocio, desde la preparación de los alimentos, hasta la distribución de los almuerzos ya realizados.

La asociación Porteñas quiere recepcionar mayores pedidos para obtener mayores ganancias, de momento no es imposible porq necesitarían un refuerzo en su capital de trabajo además de contratar ayudantes, es por eso que ellas solicitan mayores créditos para este fin. Luego de llegar a sus objetivos de venta, están seguras que mejorarían la actual difícil situación económica que ellas están atravesando y por ende mejorar la vida de sus familias.

loans.use: Employ kitchen helpers and reinforce their capital.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
Remigia is thirty-nine years old. She is a single mother of a four-year-old girl. At present, she lives with her parents, who are under her care. Her four siblings had to travel to other countries in search of new opportunities because of the lack of work in their country. They were the main funders for Remigia; with the money that she received from them, Remigia could establish her grocery and could buy merchandise, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

She is a very sacrificing person and is always ready to continue fighting in order to achieve a better quality of life. She considers the loan to be a fundamental tool for her business.

She wants to continue expanding her business. It is now necessary for her to buy a freezer, which would allow her to sell frozen products, especially meat products.

Translated from Spanish by A.Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Remigia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años de edad; actualmente reside en la casa de sus padres quienes están bajo su cuidado. Sus cuatro hermanos tuvieron que viajar a otros países en busca de nuevos horizontes por la falta de empleo en nuestro país; ellos fueron los principales capitalistas para Remigia, ya que con el dinero que recibió de ellos, ella pudo montar su despensa y comprar mercaderías tales como arroz, azúcar, fideo etc.

Ella demuestra ser persona muy sacrificada, dispuesta siempre a seguir luchando para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida, y, considera al crédito como una herramienta fundamental para su negocio.

Ella desea seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio, para ello hoy día está necesitando comprar un congelador (freezer) que le permitirá vender productos congelados especialmente productos cárnicos.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 31 years,She is a married woman with 1 child aged 6. She became a maize seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro has had a soldering and locksmith workshop in his home for the past 25 years. He has various machines and two assistants. His clients are his neighbors and friends and he also makes house calls. Sporadically, he does jobs as an electrician. The loans that he has received have been invested in more materials for his workshop. Mauro would like to have a wider portfolio of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mauro tiene en su casa un taller de soldadura y cerrajería, desde hace 25 años. Él cuenta con varias máquinas y 2 ayudantes. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos. También trabaja a domicilio. Esporádicamente, hace trabajos como electricista. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en comprar más materiales para su taller. A Mauro le gustaría tener una cartera más amplia de clientes.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for his workshop

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with three kids. He owns a business selling car parts and accessories in the downtown Vasilyevka market. Vladimir is full of ideas. He has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. Vladimir sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. He has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, he has about $8,000 in merchandise. 

Vladimir would like to get a loan of 4000 Grivnas to increase his working capital. He believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding that real success and wealth take time. Vladimir is hoping to generate more profit and provide for his kids, who study in college now.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Amalia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: En  apoyo con  su esposo y   uno de sus hijos realiza  la actividad de lunes a domingo, inicio con un motor   moliendo masa de maíz.  Agradecida con un financiamiento de Adim logro comprarse otro motor con el que actualmente muele maíz tostado. Lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas, ofrece además carnes molidas al por mayor y al detalle a pulperías del departamento. Muy segura de su negocio, sueña con tener una pulpería  y ofrecer variedad de productos, así como comidas rápidas y refrescos entre .otros ya que la ubicación de su casa se lo permite.
texts.en:
Supported by her husband and one of her sons, she conducts her activities from Monday to Sunday, having started with an electric mill grinding cornflour dough. Thanks to financing from ADIM, she managed to buy herself another mill which she uses to grind toasted corn. What has also helped her to increase her sales is that she additionally offers ground meats at wholesale, as well as to general stores in the area at retail. Very secure in her business, she dreams of having her own store where she can offer a variety of products such as fast foods and refreshments, among other items, given that the location of her house would allow her to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Khursheedan Taqadus Hussain Group

texts.en:
Khursheedan baji is a wife of T. H.. T. is a delivery man; he delivers items from one place to another. Khursheedan baji is a mother of three children - two sons and one daughter. Her elder son earns daily wages as a laborer. Her younger son works in a factory. Her daughter is 15 years old. She stays at home and helps with household work.

Khursheedan baji earns money with her embroidery work and stitching clothing. She also teaches her daughter this art so that one day she can make dresses without her mother's help.

Khursheedan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to replace her old donkey with a new donkey and cart for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading goods. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy edible items like chips and biscuits wholesale to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Muyassara

texts.en: Muyassara K. was born in 1964 in the B. Gafurov region. She lives in the B. Gafurov region, but she works in the Khujand local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She has been in business for 10 years. She trades fruits (apples, grapes, bananas, and oranges) and salads that she makes herself. She brings the fruits from Russia and Uzbekistan. Mrs. K. applied to KIVA with the request of financial support for her existing business.  With a business development loan of 2,000 TJS for eight months, she plans to buy popular holiday fruits and increase her business turnover. She thanks KIVA for support.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for selling.

loans.name: Omosigho

texts.en: Omosigho O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She makes local soap, called soda in Nigeria. She also sells palm oil. Beside her in the picture are containers for giving the local soap a round shape. She is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more palm oil and materials for making the local soap. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and materials for making soap

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Antonio F. es padre de familia  con dos hijos en su deber de mantener y brindarles la alimentación que ellos requieren. Él se dedica hoy en día a la venta de gaseosas en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es visitado por sus clientes y además ofrece el producto abasteciendo otros negocios al por mayor.

Con mucha necesidad ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de gaseosas para su venta y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su negocio brindándole de igual manera mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio F. is the father of a family with two children. He is responsible for maintaining the family and providing all their food. He sells soft drinks at La Terminal Market in the city of León, where he sells to individual customers and also supplies other businesses with wholesale soft drinks. He came to Ceprodel in need of much help, and requested a loan that would allow him to purchase soft drinks for his business. He hopes that the loan will be granted to help him keep his business afloat and, at the same time, improve living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is a rice grower. She is 43-years old, and already a widow. She has three children who are in school. Since her husband's death, she is the sole manager of their small plot of land, the main source of her income. Her harvest also greatly helps to feed her family. She has a previous work experience as a payroll clerk in Notredame Hospital, found in Cotabato City in Mindanao. When she got married, she stopped working to help her husband with the farm. Now, she spends her spare time working as Brgy. Record Keeper in Brgy. hall. 

She is requesting a loan of to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. She is also hopes to open a small store. This loan will help her increase the yield on her farm and get her store started.

CEVI provides their client not just credit assistance. They also provide trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en:
Farkhad A. is 46 years old. He is married with two adorable sons. Farkhad is a vendor in the central local market. He sells dishes and plates of the Oriental style, along with electrical items such as irons, kettles, mixers, and so on. Farkhad has been in this business for eight years already, and his business is successful enough to enable him to support his family and his parents. Because his wife is currently unemployed, Farkhad's business generates the main income.

Now Farkhad is planning to increase his stock by purchasing dishes and plates wholesale. This products are very popular. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Farkhad thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase dishes and plates to sell

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
T. Nazokat is fifty-one years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her four children and to provide for their education. Nazokat has three years of experience in preparing and selling walnuts. She always makes very creative use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Nazokat requests $800 for the term of twelve months. She is going to spend the loan on the purchase of walnuts with the purpose of processing them in order to increase her volume of sales. Nazokat expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more walnuts to sell

loans.name: Ergashoy

texts.ru: Эргашой - женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 6-х детей. Они с мужем занимается производством и продажей детских колыбелек. Её муж мастерит колыбельки и поставляет их на рынок а Эргашой сидит на рынке и продаёт колыбельки. Их бизнес очень выгодный и сезонность круглый год. Её муж закупает сырье и мастерит колыбельки дома. Но у него мало денежных средств чтобы закупить достаточное количество сырья. Поэтому Эргашой хочет взять кредит и с мужем закупить нужное сырьё.
texts.en:
Ergashoy is a 56 year old woman. She is married and has 6 children. Together with her husband she manufactures and sells baby cribs. Her husband builds the cribs and transports them to the market where Ergashoy sits and sells the cribs. Their business is very profitable and is in season all year round. Her husband purchases the raw materials and builds the cribs at home, but he does not have enough financial resources to purchase an adequate quantity of raw materials. This is why Ergashoy would like to take out a loan and to purchase raw materials with her husband.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mimania

texts.en:
Mimania E. is 37 years old and married to a cattle keeper. She has two sons, who attend Usarat primary school. Mimania sells various types of green vegetables such as okra, cabbage and others, and is requesting a loan to open a small green vegetable farm on the river bank. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a small green vegetable farm

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Clarin. She is 40 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria raises livestock. Her business is raising pigs for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1999, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lucas António

texts.pt:
Lucas António R. de 39 anos nasceu no distrito de Inhassungue, Província de Inhambane, estudou até terceiro ano do ensino técnico e teve de parar por problemas de saúde - vista. Casado maritalmente com um filho menor, sustenta outra criança enteado.

Veio viver em Boane em 1987 e vive em casa própria junto com esposa e dois filhos. Comerciante de profissão e do dono do seu negocio, ainda sem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e adquiri os produtos nos armazéns locais, seu rendimento diário varia entre 500.00MT – 2,000.00MT.

É seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku, nunca teve crédito com outras instituições. Com o mesmo pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria e em simultâneo aumentar sua renda.

Seu sonho é de melhorar as condições do local onde exerce a actividade.
texts.en:
Lucas António R. is 39 years old and was born in the Inhassungue district, Inhambane Province. He studied through the third year of technical school and then had to stop because of problems with his eyesight. Married with one young child, he also raises a stepchild.

Lucas came to live in Boane in 1987 and lives in his own home together with his wife and children. He is a professional merchant and runs his business, without any employees. He sells basic necessities and gets the products from local warehouses. His daily income varies between 500 MT (meticais) and 2,000 MT.

This is Lucas's first loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner). He has never had a loan with another institution. With the loan, he intends to increase his volume of merchandise and simultaneously increase his revenue.

Lucas's dream is to improve the conditions of the place where he does business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
N. Dương Thị (327970809) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1997, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and as supplement income for the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Huth's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Huth H., age 52, has been selected to be the group leader by the other members. Huth H. has been a domestic fish catcher for eleven years. She also goes with her other neighbors who are fishermen to fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. She can fish over 5 kilos a day, for which she earns $1.50 per kilo. To help feed the family a little more, her husband drives a motor taxi. The family has seven children; one is married, and the others go to work and to school. Recently, Huth’s fishing operation has been declining due to a lack of tools. Because of this, she would like a loan to increase the quantity of her fishing equipment and to repair her broken tools.

About the other three borrowers who are jointly taking this loan:

H. will use her loan to buy a machine to connect to her existing boat for fishing. N., a local fish catcher, is looking for a loan to buy nets and traps. N. is applying for a loan to repair a portion of her broken house.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fishing equipment and to repair broken tools

loans.name: Ikponwonosa

texts.en:
Ikponwonosa is 44 years old and married with three children. She sells used clothes and has been in the business since 2000.

Ikponwonosa hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is the 32-year-old mother to two daughters. She is happily married to Jose Rio who is 35 years old and a jeepney (small bus) driver. She lives in the beautiful town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines.

Mary Grace is full of determination to get out from the spiral of poverty. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with hopes of having access to capital. Prior to her membership with ASHI, she was already engaged in her general store business but her project was dying for lack of rolling capital. Her previous loans were carefully invested in her general store as rolling capital.

Mary Grace’s business runs smoothly since her neighbors became her regular customers. Now on her third loan, she proposes a loan of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her general store. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for four sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, cigarettes, soft drinks and other groceries for the store and also to pay for transportation expenses.
