Mary Grace aspires to sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also dreams of expanding her business and improving it into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Approvisionner sa pharmacie

loans.name: Atiwassa Veronique

texts.fr: Cette femme vend des denrées alimentaires ou des produits d’alimentation générale comme activité génératrice de revenu. C’est en 2006  qu’elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce qui lui permet désormais d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle vend des œufs, des tomates en boîtes, du haricot et même des bonbons. Elle vend au bord d’un boulevard très fréquenté dans le quartier de Tokoin Wuiti à Lomé. En ce moment elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des articles manquants dans son stock ; ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 01 carton d’allumettes, 02 sacs de haricots, 10 plateaux d’œufs, 15 cartons de tomates et des boîtes de biscuits. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P., a farmer, never stops dreaming of achieving better living conditions for her family. She longs to have a comfortable house and enough rooms so that her children will have a good place to live and she will have a stable business so that her family can buy everything they need.

She would like to access the micro-financing services of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. When she gets a loan, it will be very easy for her to grow her crops and achieve an abundant harvest in her farm. The loan will immensely help her business grow.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en: Amorlina U. is from the village of Olingan. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Amorlina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Amorlina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Amorlina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora  FELICIANA E. D. V., tiene  56 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco D. la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE D. VIDA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 1ERO  D. primaria, refiere que ella quedo huérfana a la edad D. 7 años por lo cual empezó a trabajar desD. niña para poder ayudar a sus hermanos pequeños, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores quienes la apoyan eventualmente. La socia se dedica  a la venta D. cerveza en su domicilio Y con sus primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compro cajas D. cerveza al por mayor  y con su próximo crédito D. 3,000 nuevos soles comprará cajas D. cerveza al por mayor y también fertilizantes para arar sus chacras que tiene en la sierra para poder sembrar papas.
Feliciana sueña con tener una buena cosecha D. papas.
texts.en:
Mrs. FELICIANA E. D. V., is 56 years old, and lives in the Huanchaco District of the Province of Trujillo, La Libertad State – Perú. She's a member of the Communal Bank FUENTE D. VIDA (Fountain of Life). She attended school up to the first year of grammar school. She was orphaned at the age of 7, and from that time on she has worked, since childood to help her younger brothers and sisters. She has three grown children who will help her eventually. She sells beer in her home. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles she will buy a case of beer wholesale and with the next loan of 3,000 soles she will buy cases of beer wholesale, and also buy fertilizer to plough her farm on the mountain where she plans to plant potatoes. Feliciana dreams of having a good crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale beer and fertilizer

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 27 years old and is married with three children aged 2, 4 and 15. She lives in a region called Gatsata in the Gasabo district of Kigali Province, Rwanda.

Clementine owns a small shop that sells clothes. She has been in this business since 2006 and employs one person from her community. Before starting this business she was dependent on her husband but after becoming an entrepreneur she is able to contribute to her family since she earns 400,000 RWF per month (approximately 700 USD).

Clementine is requesting her first a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more clothes of various styles and colors. With this expansion she believes she will satisfy and attract more customers by offering them high quality clothes.

Through her business, Clementine hopes to earn more profits that will allow her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Carlota De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafale, la señora Carlota S. se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a trabajar para mantener su hogar y brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida a sus dos hijos. Ella es muy esforzada y siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo mantener su casa de habitación en buen estado. El motivo por el cuál hoy en día solicita un crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción y pintura para reparar y pintar su casa debido a que por mucho tiempo su hogar había estado en malas condiciones pero hoy en día ha iniciado a mejorar dichas condiciones y está componiendo sus paredes y puertas. 
Al comprar los materiales de construcción con el crédito, le permitirá reconstruir sus paredes y también pintarlas para darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y que estos se puedan desarrollar.
texts.en:
In the San Rafale municipality Carlota S. has worked for a long time to support her household and give her two children excellent living conditions. She is a very hard-worker, and she has always looked for the way to keep her house in good condition. That is the reason she is now asking for a loan to buy construction materials and paint to repair and paint her house. Her house has been in bad shape for a long time. She has started to make improvements, and she is repairing the walls and doors. Buying the construction materials with the loan will allow her to rebuild the walls and to paint them. This will give her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Geoconda Monserrate

texts.es:
Geoconda V. es socia activa del  Banco Comunal El Pedregal ubicado en la parroquia Picoaza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí.

Geoconda lleva catorce años de casada, es ama de casa pero también se dedica al negocio familiar de  venta de colas y jugos junto a su esposo desde hace diez años, nos comenta que sus niños aun son pequeños y tienen que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia, sus productos entrega al por mayor a las tiendas en algunos lugares de Portoviejo y lo hace por medio de pedidos, recorre dos veces por semana en su propio auto visitando a sus clientes y tomando los pedidos para luego entregárselos. 

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Geoconda comprará  mas jabas de colas y jugos y nos comenta  para que el negocio crezca tiene que invertir todo el crédito que la Fundación le entregará.

El sueño de Geoconda es poder terminar su casa que aún  le falta algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
Geoconda V. is an active member of the communal bank "El Pedregal," located in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. Geoconda has been married for 14 years; she is a housewife but also has a business selling colas (soft drinks) and juices along with her husband. They have had this business for 10 years. She tells us that her children are still small and they have to work hard to advance their family economically. They deliver their products wholesale to the stores in some places in Portoviejo and they run the business through orders. Two times a week they go to visit their customers in their own car, taking orders and then later delivering them. With this new loan Geoconda will buy more crates of colas and juices; she comments that in order for her business to grow she must the entire loan that the Foundation gives them. Geoconda's dream is to be able to be able to finish her house, which still needs some work done on it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy crates of colas and juices

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 53 años, vive con su pareja, Osvaldo de 54 años, y con sus dos hijos: Cristina (21) y Oscar (15). Juntos y con muchas ganas de progresar habitan en su casa propia ubicada en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 4 años tiene una tienda - bazar donde ofrece diversa mercadería entre productos comestibles, útiles de oficina y productos de belleza. Este negocio lo acondicionó en su vivienda, donde ocasionalmente tiene la ayuda de su hijo para la atención de los clientes, especialmente cuando ella debe salir.
A Alicia le gusta lo que hace porque tiene buenas ganancias, sobretodo en la venta de útiles de escritorio que compra en el centro de la ciudad a precios más bajos; lo que no le agrada es que a veces no tiene algún artículo que sus compradores están buscando, es por esta razón que desea surtir mejor su tienda. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, techarlo y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos comestibles y útiles, para que los clientes puedan obtener todo lo que necesitan.

Esta es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, porque es una persona muy responsable; además no quiere quedar mal con su grupo de trabajo que le han dado mucha confianza. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar mayor cantidad de útiles escolares, por la campaña, pues empiezan las clases y necesitará abastecerse de esta mercadería.
texts.en:
Alicia, 53, lives with her partner, Osvaldo, 54, and with their two children, Cristina (21) and Oscar (15). They live together, in their own home, in a densely populated neighborhood of Lima; they all share the desire to succeed in life. She has had a general store for the last 4 years where she sells a variety of items: food, office supplies, and beauty products. She set up the store in her home where her son occasionally helps her out with customers, especially when she needs to go out. Alicia enjoys her work because it produces good profits, especially in the area of office supplies, which she buys downtown at lower prices. What she doesn’t like so much is occasionally not having some item on hand that her customers want. For this reason, she would like to better stock her store. For the future, she is planning to improve her store’s installations, to roof it, and to offer a wider variety of food items and school supplies, so that her customers can obtain everything they need. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she is a very responsible person; besides, she doesn’t want to disappoint her fellow group members, who have placed so much trust in her. She will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of school supplies for the new school term that is about to start because she will need to be well-supplied of this kind of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Saitia

texts.en:
Saitia T. is 40 and married with 6 children (ages 4 - 20).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Saitia has 3 years of experience in this business.  Saitia needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Saitia joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Saitia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Saitia T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane P.  is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy first class clothes and bedsheet stock to sell. Jane is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy first class clothes and bedsheet stock to sell

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. María Esperanza G. R. trabaja como conserje en una fabrica de tabaco en el casco urbano del Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para costear los gastos medico de una operación que se realizara ella en la vista la cual es muy costosa y el seguro de donde ella trabaja no le cubre para este tipo de gastos médicos.

Ella empezó a trabaja en esta fabrica hace ocho años con la necesidad de tener un ingreso fijo mensualmente y así cubrir con sus gastos familiares, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, antes de dedicarse a este trabajo ella se dedicaba  a las labores domestica de su casa.

Ella espera que con esta operación que se realice en su vista mejorar su condición de salud la que no es adecuada y de esta  manera rendir más eficientemente en su trabajo y tener más tranquilidad personal así como su familia también.

María G. es una Sra. Soltera con 4 hijos los que ya son totalmente independientes y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Este es el crédito numero 14 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 7 años, mostrándose agradecida por el impacto positivos que dichos financiamientos han tenido en su vida personal ya que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar así como su salud.
texts.en:
María Esperanza G. R. works as a receptionist in a tobacco factory in the urban area of the Condega municipality. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to cover the costs of a medical operation that she needs to have. The operation is very costly and the insurance policy where she works doesn't cover her for these types of medical costs. María began working in this factory 8 years ago because of the need to have a fixed monthly income and cover her household costs. She works from Monday to Friday from 7 am until 5 pm. Before working there María worked around her house doing the domestic chores. María hopes that this operation will improve her health, namely her sight, and in this way make her more efficient at her work and give her and her family more peace. María G. is a single lady with 4 children who are all totally independent, and only one of whom lives with her. This is the 14th loan that María has had with Ceprodel during a 7 year period. She has demonstrated her thankfulness for the positive impact that these loans have had in her personal life, as they have helped her to improve her home's living conditions as well as her health.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical costs (vision operation)

loans.name: Alfa Omega Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Alfa Omega, fue iniciado el 15 D. marzo del 2010, con el objetivo D. solicitar un crédito mancomunado para el incremento D. capital que les permitan incrementar sus ventas y utilidades, como líderes en la organización del grupo se encuentra:

La Sra. Juana, una persona destacada en su zona por su transparencia y liderazgo, es así D. esta manera elegida como presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento. Ella cuenta con una tienda D. barrio, un Internet al servicio D. su zona es una persona responsable y trabajadora, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para su tienda como refrescos, dulces y abarrotes.

Como tesorera  se encuentra la Señora Alejandra la misma que tiene al cuidado 2 hijos pequeños, y cuenta con un negocio ambulante en la venta D. cosméticos y el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. cosmeticos que se encuentran en promosion para despues venderlos al precio original. 

Todas las integrantes son personas que buscan la generación D. ingresos a través D. negocios informales que les permitan ganar un poco D. dinero para mejorar su calidad D. vida, sin descuidar a sus familia, también que esperan responder positivamente ante este primer crédito con el fin D. ser reconocidas como buenas clientes y confiables para así continuar con nuestra organización. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Alfa Omega communal bank was established on 15 March 2010 to seek funds to increase their sales and profits. The group leaders are: Juana, a person who stands out in the area for her leadership and openness, is elected president. She has a neighborhood grocery store and an Internet access service. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for her store, like: soft-drinks, candy and groceries. Alejandra is treasurer. She has two, small children under her care. She sells cosmetics door-to-door. She will use the funds to buy discounted cosmetics for later sale at full price. All the group members are people who seek to earn income through their informal businesses so that they can improve their quality of life while not neglecting their families. They also hope to respond positively to this initial loan in order to be seen as being responsible and trustworthy clients able to continue associated with our organization. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Niluka

texts.en:
Niluka is a 32-year-old married woman with  two  children ages 13 and 4. She has one son and one daughter.  They are providing her with good help.  She lives in the town of Galle.  

Niluka has a business managing a small grocery shop, and she has lots of experience in this business.  She has been doing this business for two and a half years.

Niluka has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy items for her grocery business.  She is a very active, honest, enthusiastic and hard-working woman.  Niluka wants to be a self-sufficient woman. This will be her second loan from BRAC to supply food items for the grocery. She hopes to continue to see success.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Francisco Tito

texts.es:
Francisco S. de 59 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio (está situado al sur de Guayaquil y generalmente vive gente de clase baja) de Guayaquil. Su esposa es ama de casa, ellos tiene dos hijos de 29 y 20 años de edad. 

Francisco desde pequeño le llamo la atención las cámaras fotográficas, pero por la falta de dinero no pudo comprar una, al crecer  obtuvo su primer trabajo y su primer sueldo compro una cámara. Empezó a tomar fotos a sus vecinos y amigos, pero como necesitaba especializarse, comenzó a estudiar fotografía. 

Por haber estudiado fotografía obtuvo muchas amistades que le ayudaron a ser un fotógrafo profesional. Ahora esa es su actividad principal y así mantiene a su familia, revela las fotos en un cuarto que tiene en su casa, trabaja en eventos sociales y por contrato. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar rollos y pilas para sus cámaras y poder tener mas ingresos para asegurar la vejez de el y su esposa. En el futuro quiere un local propio para tener un estudio de fotografía.
texts.en:
Francisco S., 59, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio (located in south Guayaquil and generally inhabited by low-income people), Guayaquil. His wife is a housewife and they have two children who are 29 and 20 years of age. Since he was little he’s always been interested in cameras but due to lack of funds was never able to buy himself one. When he grew up and had his first job he used his first salary to buy a camera. He started to take pictures of his neighbors and friends but, because he needed to specialize, he started to study photography. Studying photography led to many friendships that helped him become a professional photographer. Now, this is his main economic activity and how he supports his family. He develops the film in a room in his house and works social events or by contract. He will use the loan to buy rolls of film and batteries for his cameras so that he will earn higher income to insure his and his wife’s old age. In the future, he’d like to have his own place to install his photography studio.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rolls of film and batteries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth has a business selling coconut oil in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem K., 61, is a traditional cake producer. She makes cakes and sells to buyers who then take them to retail in the market. Also, she is hired by villagers to make the cake for their wedding parties or ceremonies.

Chem K. normally relies on the income from her husband’s job, working in the construction sector. The older couple has five children: three are married and two are single. Almost all of them are employed at different occupations.

Chem K. has a small piece of land where she hopes to raise crops for extra income, but she has no capital. For this reason, she is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seed to begin planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed to begin planting

loans.name: Marice

texts.en:
Marice C. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia  City. She is 27 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Marice owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marice is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kigaaga Biruga Omututu, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Different genres of agricultural activities have made many Ugandan families have an improved lease on life. This story is connected to one K. Monica from Kigaaga, Ibanda district.

This married lady has subsisted on the profits from selling a variety of agricultural products, for the last ten years specializing in growing bananas. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected her plantations, she has managed to consolidate the gains she has made. As a result, her family of four children has enjoyed the benefits; principally, her children all now attend good institutions of learning. 

In a month, Monica reveals that she makes close to or even more than $90 out of selling her agricultural produce. She is very upbeat that with this loan she will be in a position to improve on the mulching and gardening aspects of her farm, and also to increase her stock of animals on the farm which will help her increase the produce and sales revenue.

Monica is the lady seated on the far left with her hand raised, and the others with hands raised are the secretary, treasurer and vice chairman for the group.

loans.use: purchasing mulches and fertilizers for the plantation

loans.name: Florymae

texts.en: Florymae A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Florymae has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Florymae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Florymae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Florymae is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
S. Nasiba is 46 years old. She is married. She uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and to provide for their education. Nasiba has 13 years of experience preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very good use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Nasiba is requesting $1500 USD. She is going to use the loan to purchase dried apricots so that she can process them, thereby increasing the range of her products. Nasiba expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 5, Brgy. Tumarbong, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  rice retailing and selling cashew nuts. Her husband, Arsenio Casing, who is 54 years old, earns his living as a driver, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between four years and 12 years old. 

Olivia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and to open a sari-sari (general) store. Olivia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 66 años, vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijas, Edith de 38 y Gisela de 20 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Pian. Todos los días sale temprano a trabajar como albañil y por las tardes ayuda a su esposa en casa,  ya que Gisela su hija menor no puede caminar producto de un accidente, sin embargo se da tiempo para poder sembrar flores en su chacra.  A él le gusta trabajar en el campo, “es el único momento que puedo estar con toda mi familia”, asegura. Por otro lado tiene que viajar constantemente a la capital, por que es ahí donde vende las flores que siembra, ya tiene 46 años dedicándose a esta actividad y con el tiempo desea construir una mejor casa para que su familia pueda vivir cómodamente. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y ya conoce todas las actividades y la forma de trabajo de su banco comunal, eso le entusiasma mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y fertilizantes para las flores que sembrará en estos meses.
texts.en:
Juan, age 66, lives with his wife and their two daughters. Edith is 38, and Gisela is 20. They live in their own house, which is located in the town of Pian. He leaves early everyday to work as a bricklayer. In the afternoons he helps his wife at home. His youngest daughter, Gisela, is not able to walk due to an accident. Nevertheless, it gives him time to be able to plant flowers on his farm. He likes working in the field. “It is the only time that I am able to be with my whole family,” he says. On the other hand, he has to constantly travel to the capital because that is where he sells the flowers that he grows. He has been doing this work for 46 years. In time he wishes to build a better house for his family to be able to live comfortably. This is his third loan with MFP. He knows all of the activities and the way to work with his communal bank, which fills him with much enthusiasm. He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy seeds and fertilizer for the flowers that he grows during these months.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Than Thi Le's Group

texts.en:
Than T. L., the group loan's head, is 50 years old with three children, two of whom are attending a vocational school. She is a farmer who grows rice, part of which she uses for her family and part to sell. She also raises 400 chickens for eggs. She used a loan from SEDA’s credit program in 2004 very effectively. Currently, Than is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

Other members of the group:

Tiep T. N. is 59 years old with three children. She is a farmer who is raising 200 chickens. She would like a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

N. T. N. is 33 years old with two children who are in secondary school. She is raising 400 chickens for their eggs. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to improve her chicken house.

Mai T. L. is 34 years old with two children who are attending secondary school. She runs a small grocery shop. She would like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more kinds of products to meet customer demand.

Trinh T. N. is 40 years old with two children. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigs for their meat. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: To buy feed  for chickens

loans.name: Islomidin

texts.en:
Islomidin S. is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. Islomidin has been in the business of selling cows for over eight years. He buys them from villagers and throughout the nearby province to raise them for resale to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years. Islomidin is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD to purchase additional cows. This loan will allow Islomidin to expand his business and better provide for his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Sheline Ondeche

texts.en:
Sheline O. is 64 years old and married to Saul. They have two children aged 30 years and 25 years old. They live in Kakamega town.

Sheline has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 12 years. She is in need of cooking oil, flour, soap and soft drinks to add to her stock. She is applying for a loan of Kshs 30,000 from KADET Ltd. Her monthly income is Kshs 9,000.

Her desire is to be able to open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour and soap to add to her stock

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N., 20, lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Deborah has a business selling food in the market, namely poultry, which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Deborah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Deborah hopes to become a nurse. Deborah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken for resale.

loans.name: Obara

texts.en:
Obara is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with four children between 13 and 3 years old.  He has been doing mixed farming producing milk, maize, sugar cane and vegetables.

He is challenged by a poor system of road networks and no ready market for his products.

Obara has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes the income generated will enable him to educate his children and give them a better standard of living. He wants to fully rely on his farming income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty N. lives in Ndeeba, in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children who are in school. She also takes care of her father.   Resty's business is a bar. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Resty sells her products by retail in a shop.  Resty has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings which she will use to buy more crates of beer and local gin to sell. Her main business challenges are the rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling by wholesale only and also to build her own house. Resty lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and local gin to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan P. es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya, se inicio en el año 2008, está casado  con la Señora Ramona Benitez con quien  tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, poseen una despensa en su domicilio que está ubicado en  la comunidad de Potrero Yvate.
El desea contar para estas fiesta con todos las mercaderias de cosumo masivo por la fiestas que llegan y para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de bebidas, verduras, panificados, carne y otros.

Todos los créditos retirados por el mencionado poseen un histórico impecable de pago, agradece el crecimiento laboral que obtuvo con nuestra Institución.
texts.en:
Juan P. is a recurring client of Fundación Paraguaya, having started working with the institution in 2008.  He is married to Ramona Benitez with whom he has three grown-up children.  They own a small grocery store in their home which is located in the community of Potrero Yvate.

This festive season, Juan P. would like to be able to offer popular merchandise for the holiday period in his store.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy drinks, vegetables, baked goods, meat, etc.

All the loans Juan P. has taken out have had an impeccable payment history.  He is grateful for the growth he has been able to achieve in his business with our institution's help.

loans.use: To buy drinks, baked goods, meat, etc.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en: Sixteen residents of Sambuor village in Kandal province have applied for this group loan. The members have chosen Mrs. Yeng S., who is 47 years old, as their leader, and all plan to use a portion of this loan to improve the lives of their families. Mrs. Yeng S. and her husband are farmers who own two-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice. She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. Her husband works in construction, and the couple plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support their two children, one of whom is a teacher while the other is still attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Sancris) Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario M. A., tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, cursos el sexto año D. primaria en la escuela, tiene 5 hijos, 3 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica a una tienda D. artículos D. consumo diario, igualmente el esposo D. ella se dedica al comercio, doña Rosario tiene seis años D. experiencia con este tipo D. negocio, inicio su negocio con mil quetzales, y quiere incrementar su capital para mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que reunio a 9 compañeras para solocitar un préstamo que a cada una les servirá D. capital en la actividad que realizan, ya que cada uno D. ellas tambien se dedican a actividades productivas como: Venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, Venta D. Refacciones, Crianza D. animales, Confección D. playeras, y Tejido D. sabanas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario M. A. is 46 years old, and has completed six years of school. She has five children, three of whom are still in school. Her business is a general store. Her husband is also a businessman. 

Rosario has six years of experience in this type of business. She began with a capital investment of 1000 quetzals [about $125 US] and now wants to increase her investment in order to improve her income. For this reaS., she got together with her nine communal bank associates to solicit this loan. 

The loan will be used by each member for her own business. Some of the businesses are: basic goods sales, snack sales, animal raising, t-shirt making, and sewing of bedsheets.

loans.use: Working capital for general store

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: El Sr. Leoncio,  ingreso a la institución  el año 2005 con el grupo solidario "los bendecidos" trabajando en ese grupo como seis secuencias siendo un cliente antiguo y sin embargo  sus compañeros por la edad se retiraron del grupo. Y el  permanece con crédito individual demostrando puntualidad en  sus pagos,  es un cliente dedicado al hogar y a la manutención de sus hijos ya que se encuentran en la universidad estudiando dos de sus hijos y los otros en el colegios una persona muy trabajadora su deseo es el de ver a su hijos profesionales y hombres de bien, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leoncio joined the institution in 2005 with the “Los Bendecidos” (The Blessed Ones) communal bank.  He worked in that group for six cycles and was a long standing client.  However, his fellow members dropped out of the group due to age and he remains as an individual borrower making his payments punctually.  He is a client who is devoted to his home and supporting his children two of whom are studying in the university and the others are in high school.

He is a very hard working person who’s wish is to see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy fabric, lining and sets of buttons.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Mr. Kou D. is a villager in Pun Phnum village, Takeo province and he was born in 1968. He is a father of three children who are studying in local public school.

He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support his family. 

His wife, Mrs. Chhun Leng Ai, is a rice wine maker and a pig breeder. 

In the crop field, he has a problem because his field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Kou D. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan he is going to buy pig food.  His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria De Los Ángeles C. tiene ya mas de un años dedicándose a la venta  de artículos escolares.
Este negocio es una fuente de ingresos para su familia, esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mercancía ya que desea también vender productos para fiestas infantiles, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que su negocio requiere.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Fidencio Enrique Amaro se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso que tiene de su trabajo como constructor independiente.
texts.en: Señora Maria De Los Ángeles C. has been selling school supplies for more than a year.  This business provides a source of income for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise as she wants to also sell products for children's parties, but she doesn't have the money necessary to invest in her business.  She plans to make her payments with the earnings from her business since her husband, Señor Fidencio Enrique Amaro, is responsible for the family's expenses with his income as an independent builder.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for children's parties

loans.name: Nul

texts.en:
Nul R., age 40, is a tailor. She earns an income of USD 3.33 per day through her business. She needs to earn more in order to support her family, since they must spend USD 44 on food and USD 45 on the other necessaR. expenses eveR. month. 

For this reason, R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to start a new business. With the loan, she will buy groceR. items to offer for sale in a new groceR. business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair the family house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

Nul R. resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in a new grocery business

loans.name: Willis Otieno

texts.en:
Willis Otieno is 37 years old from Corner Mbuta in Kisumu county. He is married to Rehema and they have four children who are all boys.

Willis has a retail shop that he has been running for the past seven years and is in need of new stock. He has therefore applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar and detergents to add to his stock. 

He will use the profits made from his business to cater for his family's needs and also pay school fees for his children. He hopes to be able to expand his shop to become wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, soap etc. to add to stock.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a farmer who lives in Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is 55 years old and married. Leonida grows rice and corn crops and then sells her harvest to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods and noodles.

Leonida's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo,  hija y nieto en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, en donde acondicionado en su sala un lugar para colocar su su pequeña tienda, ubicado en la zona rural de la campiña  El Pariso a unos 15 minutos del distrito Andrés Razuri a 30 minutos de la provincia de Ascope y a una hora de distancia al departamento de La Libertad (Trujillo) .  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Rosa se dedica a su casa su tienda, en cual sus  vecinos encuentran algunos de productos  ( papel higiénico, lejía, detergente y golosinas, etc.), con su pequeño negocio que a colocado Rosa trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia, también le ayuda su hija con los ingresos económicos, ya que trabaja como empleada doméstica e una casa de familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Rosa trata de adquirir un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos.

Rosa es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family. She is 60 years old and she lives with her husband, her daughter, and a grandson in a house of their own. it is equipped with running water and with hydro. The living room was reconditioned to host a small store. It is located in the rural village of El Pariso, at 15 minutes from the district of Andres Razuri, at 30 minutes from the province of Ascope, and at 1 hour's distance form the department of La Libertad (Trujillo). These regions are known for the important business activities of population, including commerce, agriculture, farming, and tourism. 

Rosa manages the store in her house where her neighbors find some products (bathroom tissue, bleach, detergent, sweets, etc.). The small business that Rosa has installed she tries her best to provide her family with a better quality of life. Her daughter also contributes to their income. She provides cleaning services in a private family home.

At a visit to Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) Rosa requested a loan of 600 nuevos soles to supply her store with more inventory in order to meet the needs of her clients, and in turn to increase her earnings.

Rosa is known by her neighbors to be a very happy woman who is ready to help others. She is a responsible mother whose objective for her family is to provide for them through her efforts and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more products to supply her business.

loans.name: Lucila Sotera

texts.es: La señora Lucila se dedica a la venta de productos como conservas, refrescos, embutidos abarrotes, etc. en un almacén ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad de la paz, anteriormente se dedicaba a la  venta de condimentos al por mayor, sin embargo tuvo la oportunidad de abrir un almacén que le diera mas ingresos, es una persona muy emprendedora, también vende rellenos de papa, postre y arroz en un ambiente de su almacén y en el mes de marzo inauguró una broastería en la misma zona para tener mejorar sus ingresos. Doña Lucila desde pequeña se encargó de su familia y con mucho esfuerzo logró sacar adelante a  sus hermanos menores. La señora solicita el crédito en emprender para la compra de un exhibidor el mismo que lo utilizará en el  almacén, doña Lucila es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora es cliente por más de tres años demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, a corto plazo piensa en invertir en nuevos negocios para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hermanos y de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila sells products like pickled fruit, soft drinks, cured meats, groceries, etc. in a store located in the southern part of the city of La Paz.  She used to sell wholesale condiments but she got the opportunity to open a store that would produce more income.  She is a very enterprising person.

She also sells stuffed potatoes, dessert and rice in a space set aside in her store.  In March she inaugurated a Broaster Chicken place in the same neighborhood to improve her income. Since a very young age, Lucila has taken care of her family and with much effort managed to raise her younger siblings.

She is asking for a loan to buy a display unit to use in the store.  Lucila is a very enterprising, hard working person.  She’s been a client for over three years and has always been responsible and punctual with her payments.  In the short run she plans to invest in new businesses to improve the standard of living of her siblings and of her family.

loans.use: to buy a display unit.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 44 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 44 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton of Los Ríos province. The members of SEÑOR DE LA SALUD center live in Recinto Soloma, part of Echeandia canton. The center serves farmers of short season crops such as maize and rice. 

Segundo farms maize and rice. He buys agricultural inputs in Ventanas and sells his products in the farmers market everyday, especially during the Sunday market. He is asking for a loan to buy seed and fertilizers. The loan will enable him to buy the agricultural inputs he needs. Segundo faces challenges such as crop pests and diseases and changes in the weather. His dream is to buy his own farm. In his free time, Segundo likes to play boly.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth, 38 years old, is a rice wine producer at her home and her husband is a carpenter. Both of them can make $12 per day. They have two children,  aged 13 and 9, both of them are in school right now. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $30 on transportation, and $30 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy rice to produce wine to sell. Because there are a lot of expenses she needs to pay for her family’s living, she wants to raise about 10 pigs to get more income and, with the profit she earns, she will send her children to school until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flavourings and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one school-aged child.

Ruth has a service-based business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

Ruth has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand his service-based business and purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora María vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, su gente es muy cálida y amable.
 
La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 24, 22 y 19 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo este año ingresa a la universidad. Su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su tienda, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 26 años, trabaja en ella de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, detergentes, huevos, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su tienda.

Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Señora María lives in the Yanuncay neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cold climate and great natural, architectural and cultural beauty. It is the third most important city in the country and its people are warm and friendly. 

Señora María is 50 years old, married and with her husband  has three children who are 24, 22 and 19 years old. Her two eldest children are studying at the city’s university and her youngest child will enter the university this year.  Her husband helps tend to her store and the house where they live is their own.
 
Señora María has had her grocery store for 26 years. She works there Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning until ten in the evening.

She is in her fourth loan through a communal bank. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, eggs, cold cuts and other basic needs items to better supply her store.

Her goal is to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, eggs, cold cuts and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Mabel Roxana

texts.es: Mabel tiene 25 años, su actividad es la venta de artesanías. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una emprendedora mujer que busca la forma de mantener a su familia tiene un hijo menor de edad bajo su cargo. Ella se levanta temprano para realizar algunos retoques en sus artesanías, pues su lugar de trabajo está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de vasijas, pinturas, barro entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Mabel, age 25, sells handicrafts.  She has had this business for over five years.  She is an enterprising woman who looks for the way to support her family.  She has one minor child under her care.

She gets up very early to make some finishing touches on her handicrafts.  The place where she works is located in the outskirts of the city.

The reason for the loan is to buy earthenware pots, paints, and clay, among other needed products.

loans.use: to buy earthenware pots, paints, and clay, among other needed products.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with two children. Lolita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita  is a hog raiser to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets. 

Lolita  has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lolita hopes to become a supplier of pork in all of Misamis Occidental.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Pedro Celestino

texts.es:
El sr pedro es una persona trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante y dar a su familia una vida comoda, Pedro se dedica a la venta de pan, el cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa que vende pan en su casa de habitacion.   Pedro tiene un hijo el cual esta estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
Pedro vende su producto en varios barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Choluteca, sus clientes son propietarios de pulperias. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pan.
Los planes de Pedro es hacer mas grande su negocio y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is a hardworking person with the desire to get ahead and to provide his family with a comfortable life. Pedro sells bread with the help of his wife, who sells bread from home. Pedro has a son who goes to a school in the community.

Pedro sells his products throughout various neighborhoods and housing developments in the city of Choluteca. His customers are general store owners.

Pedro will use this loan to purchase bread. He plans to expand his business so that he can have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase white bread.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy, age 32, runs a business selling and delivering mineral water in gallons. She has had this business for four years. She lives with her husband and their three children.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to be able to sell and deliver gallons of mineral water using a multipurpose cab. 
 
Levy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Levy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to be able to sell and deliver gallons of mineral water using a multipurpose cab

loans.name: Ana Julissa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos  a la Señorita Ana, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Es licenciada en publicidad y mercadotecnia. 

Es una joven mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos, ella trabaja de secretaria en la Notaria Publica De Montecristi pero  también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que sale en las noches una vez que haya terminado sus horas laborables en su trabajo a ofrecer sus productos, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene más de cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Solicita nuevamente este crédito para seguir aumentando su negocio pues  cada vez tiene más clientes y requiere de mayor capital para cumplir con lo que le han encargado sus clientes, sin la ayuda de los créditos ella no podría seguir en su negocio y que le han ayudado a mejorar su estabilidad económica y emocional.  Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres  ciclos y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño  tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
The  communal bank José Cesario Reyes meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized on both a national and international level. It is also known for its famous Panama hats. 

Here we meet Ana, who is 28 years old, single and lives in her parent's house. She has a degree in advertising and marketing. She is an enterprising woman who likes to get ahead and generate her own income. She works as a secretary at the Public Notary of Montecristi, but she also sells clothing of all types. She sells door to door. She goes out at night after her work hours have ended to sell her merchandise. She offers credit to her customers and collects payments every fifteen days. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen days. She has been doing this work for four years and she is doing very well. 

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She is asking for a new loan to continue growing her businesss as her number of customers keeps growing and she needs more capital to fill the orders made by her customers. Without the help of these loans she would not be able to continue with her business. They have helped her improve her financial and emotional stability. She has been with the communal bank for 3 cycles and she likes it for the speed with which she can obtain loans. Her dream is to have a large boutique.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Jena has a shop where she sells clothes and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock from Natasha & Avon.
Jena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow poinsettias.

loans.name: Samuon

texts.en:
Samuon is 54 years old and her husband, Theun, is 56 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and two daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, one is a policeman and the others are in school.  

Samuon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a village leader and he also assists in his wife’s rice farm. 

Samuon is asking for a loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives. She will also use a part of the loan to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 51 years old, married and has two children who are 25 and 30 years old. She has been selling clothes to new and frequent customers in the last six years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate capital to buy clothes.in bulk. She wants a loan of 60,000 KES to buy more clothes to take advantage of the December holiday. She describes herself as honest and determined.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Shalon's Group

texts.en:
Shalon's group is comprised of two hard working women. Shalon is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past year, Shalon has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Shalon has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for resale, and will help Shalon generate greater profits and buy books to help her through her studies. Shalon hopes that in the future she will be able to study nursing. 

Shalon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Shalon's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Pekeshe

texts.en: Pekeshe is taking another Kiva loan of KES 10,000 to start another beauty salon business.  With the loan she wants to purchase a blow dryer, hair oil and hair weaves.  Her previous loans have improved her family's living standards and her net income has increased by fifty percent.  She dreams of establishing a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer, hair oil and hair weaves.

loans.name: Altaibaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Altaibaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a builder but his salary does not meet with his family's necessities. 

His wife Urantsetseg is unemployed currently and looks after her daughter at home. This year their daughter will be attending secondary school. Therefore Altaibaatar and his wife Urantsetseg decided to start a new business of clothes sales in the market during the day time. It is very beneficial to increase his family's income further.  According his plan, his wife Urantsetseg will sell casual and traditional nomadic clothes in the market. The loan Altaibaatar is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the commodities for his wife’s new business - clothes sales.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ndeye Penda Ndiaye

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  est âgée d’une trentaine d’années  et habite dans une des banlieues  du territoire sénégalais. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et commercialise des produits cosmétiques. Elle gère une boutique qui est localisée dans sa zone d’habitation. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de  150 000 frs prévu pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs en produits cosmétiques. Son objectif est de développer son activité de commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices ce qui lui permettra de mieux se prendre en charge et soutenir ses parents
texts.en:
Madam Ndeye is around 30 years old and lives in one of the suburbs of the senegalese territory. She is active in business and commercializes cosmetics. She manages a shop that is located in the region where she lives. She chose her business out of necessity. 

She has been a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC since 2005. She has already repaid one previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 150,000f to honor her commitments with her cosmetics suppliers. Her objective is to develop her business, and to grow her profits which will allow her to better take care of herself and support her parents.

loans.use: to pay for an order of cosmetics from her suppliers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 19 años, es una joven espontánea y trabajadora, convive con Wilder  de 18 años y su pequeño hijo Wilder de 02 años; a quien desea brindar una buena educación. Rosa desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra,  ahora es campesina y con sus ahorros acumulados y las de su pareja lograron comprarse su propio terreno donde cultiva plantas de café. Todos los días, muy temprano se dirige a trabajar en sus cultivos, pues del cuidado que le dé podrá obtener un buen fruto. Ella traslada  sus productos  desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios recibe por sus productos.
Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en temporadas de lluvia, porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. Con el dinero del crédito comprará sacos de abonos para mejorar sus cultivos. En lo futuro espera trabajar con la misma perseverancia que la caracteriza. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 19, is a spontaneous and hard-working woman.  She lives with 18 year old Wilder and her little two year old son, Wilder.  She wishes to give him a good education.  Ever since Rosa was a very young girl her parents involved her in working on the farm.

She is now a farmer.  With her accumulated savings and those of her life partner, they managed to buy their own land where they grow coffee.  Every day she heads out very early to work their crops.  With the care that she gives them she will be able to get a good quality yield.

She transports her products from her community to the distribution centers in the city of San Francisco.  That is where she gets the best prices for her products.  She has been doing this business activity for ten years.  She thinks the most difficult part is working during the rainy season because it impairs the output of her work.

She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crops.  In the future she hopes to work with the same perseverance that she is known for.

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She says that the loan will help her a great deal in the progress of her work.  She will use the 1,000 soles to buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For improving the business

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Mr. Komlan KOUEGNEOUGAN quit school in the 9th grade.  He is married to Abra GAGNON who is a retailer of general merchandise, Komlan is father to one child and has five others whom he supports. Mr. KOUEGNEOUGAN is a retailer of a local soft drink made of palm extract.  He has acquired ample experience in the field and has a reputation of repaying his debts on time.  

By his desire to make his business more profitable to improve the quality of life for his family, he is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a large stock of the beverage at a lowered price, thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: To Purchase Sodabi Soft Drink inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase beauty products and new clothes to stock her shop.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Miss Phuong is 38 and her husband is 41 years old. They have two children between 11 and 9 who are going to school. They only have 2000 square meters of land for growing rice. Mr Nam, her husband, works as a day laborer but he can’t find work easily. Phuong buys waste daily for recycling from door to door and then sells it to the local recycling company. The activity helped to increase their income by about $0.5/person/month to an average of $11.5/person/month. Phuong asks to borrow $50 so that she can buy a larger amount of waste for recycling and sell it to the company.

loans.use: Buy waste to recycle

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima lives in her own house with her husband and children on Avenida Buenos Aires, in the earthquake prone city of La Paz. She is an artisan and paints shawls and quilts which she takes to the southern zone of the city where they are most appreciated by the housewives. The credit that she is asking for is to buy more paints and materials so that she can make more products with the help of her children, to whom Maxima is teaching this art form. She could therefore increase her profits.

Her track record with IMPRO shows that Maxima asked for $100 credit in March this year, which she paid back. Her qualification is 1, which means she is an excellent client and can ask for more credit with no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maxima vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la av. Buenos Aires de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz ; es artesana y pinta manteles y fundas los cuales los acomoda en la zona Sur de nuestra ciudad, lugar donde es mas apreciado el trabajo por las amas de casa. El crédito que solicita es para comprar pinturas y tela y poder realizar el trabajo en más cantidad con ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes Maxima esta enseñando este arte y así mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico con IMPRO indica que Maxima solicito un primer crédito por $100 en Marzo de este año, el cual ya ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su calificación es 1, o sea cliente excelente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito sin ningún problema.

loans.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina P. L. belongs to the village bank “Desarrollo,” which mean “Development” in Spanish.

Dina owns and runs her own store of “abarrotes,” which is the general name given to the bulk supply of staple foods such as rice, flour, eggs, butter, etc. Six years ago, Dina didn’t have her own source of income. Her husband owned a car and made a living as a taxi driver in order to support t Dina and their four children. Dina decided that they needed a second source of income and wanted to become more independent in her contribution to the family. She opened a small candy store. The candy store grew into abarrotes, and now Dina serves much of the community, including many children and adults. In addition to the store, Dina and her husband also travel to the “fiestas patrias,” or national celebrations, to serve cervezas.
