Because they live well outside the city limits of Ayacucho, Peru, in the rural community, Dina’s husband must drive her into the city once each week to buy food supplies and stock her store.

As a professional goal, Dina hopes to continue growing her business, stocking more products and reaching more customers. For this reason she feels very happy to be a part of her village bank because it has helped immensely and has taught her how to save her profits and earn interest. Dina is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy more supplies for her store and service the family car to aid in her transportation to the city.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her store as well as service the family car to aid in her transportation to the city

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca Lidia, at 48 years of age, finds herself with a bronchial illness that does not allow her the freedom to work a job with set hours. In some instances she feels well enough and very motivated to work, and at other times she is bedridden because her lungs are congested and she can’t breathe. Unfortunately, she cannot obtain the medications she needs through her social security and must purchase it on her own at very high prices. Her husband works as a driver, and his income is not enough to meet her medical needs and day-to-day living expenses. Despite her illness, Blanca continues on and sells cosmetics and beauty products to her friends and neighbors to be able to earn some money to pay for her medicine and help her husband with the expenses for their three children.

Unfortunately, she does not currently have a wide variety of products which is why she is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, Blanca will be able to buy more merchandise to offer her clients particular during the holiday season when they are looking for gifts to give. With your support, Blanca will be able to improve her health condition.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca Lidia a sus 48 años, ya cuenta con una terrible enfermedad en los bronquios que no la deja trabajar en una empresa con horarios fijos. En ocasiones se siente muy bien y con muchos ánimos para trabajar y en otras se mantiene en cama enferma, puesto que siente que se le cierran los pulmones y no puede respirar. Desgraciadamente el seguro social no tiene el medicamento que ella necesita, por lo tanto tiene que comprarlo por fuera y son muy caros los medicamentos. El esposo de Blanca trabaja como chofer y lo que gana no les alcanza para pagar las medicinas y los gastos del hogar es por eso que Blanca a pesar de su enfermedad sigue adelante y vende a sus vecinos y amigas cosméticos por catálogo para poder sacar dinero para pagar las medicinas que tiene que comprar y de paso poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus 3 hijos.

Sin embargo actualmente no tiene mucha variedad en sus productos es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes en esta temporada de navidad donde todos compran para regalar. Con tu ayuda Blanca podrá superar esta terrible enfermedad.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nana Yaw

texts.en:
Nana Yaw A. is trader who deals in second-hand clothing. He is a married man with a child of 4 years old. His wife is also a trader who is working very hard to help her husband put food on the table for the family. Business is going on very well for Nana Yaw and he wants to maximize his profit by increase his capital base.

He is hereby asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy more second-hand clothing and also improve his shop.

loans.use: Buy more second-hand clothing and also improve his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 25 years old, lives with her husband and her four-year-old child in Bac Phu commune, Soc Son district. Mrs. L. and her husband married in 2002. At that time, they just moved out and realL. needed funds to start their business. She discussed with her husband to join TYM Fund (Kiva's Partner in Vietnam) in order to borrow some money and buy plastic goods to sell in the nearby market and to open a small refreshment/drink store at home. Their business is doing well. Her income increases significantL.. Mrs. L. starts to be able to buy some furniture such as a television and a motorbike. After a while, her husband bought a car wash machine, increasing their famiL. income even more. On average, they earn 270-300USD per month. This time she would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more plastic goods for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý, 25 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ 4 tuổi tại xã Bắc Phú, huyện Sóc Sơn. Hai anh chị cưới nhau năm 2002. Lúc đó, hai vợ chồng trẻ mới ra ở riêng nên còn thiếu vốn làm ăn. Chị bàn bạc cùng anh xin tham gia Quỹ Tình thương để vay vốn mua đồ nhựa buôn bán tại chợ xã và bán hàng giải khát tại nhà. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên, chị Lý sắm được một số vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình như tivi, xe máy. Sau một thời gian, chồng chị đầu tư thêm máy rửa xe đem lại nguồn thu nhập đáng kể. Bình quân mỗi tháng thu nhập cả gia đình từ 270-300USD. Dự định vòng vốn tiếp theo chị xin vay 1200USD để thêm mua đồ nhựa gia dụng, tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy articles made of plastics

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 40 years old, married, with 3 children. She has sold garden plants for more than 12 years.

She inherited the trade from her parents who were great plant salesmen. Now and for the past 10 years, Francisca has been in charge of and managed her parents’ business with great care and responsibility.

She tells us that there are many similar businesses in her city, since the good weather and the fertile ground are good for the cultivation of plants. In spite of the competition, she has many loyal customers who come from various parts of the country to buy their plants from her.

She would like to open a sales stand next to the main city highway at kilometer 55. She believes that this will help visitors and foreigners that come to Caacupe on weekends to see her goods.

She would use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, flowerpots, and other items for her nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de plantas para jardín hace ya más de 12 años.

El oficio lo heredó de sus padres quiénes fueron grandes comercializadores de plantas, actualmente, el negocio fundado por sus padres ahora esta a cargo de la señora Francisca, quien hace más de 10 años lo administra con mucha responsabilidad y esmero.

Ella nos cuenta que existen muchos negocios del mismo tipo en su ciudad, ya que el buen clima y la tierra ayudan a la buena producción de plantas. A pesar de la alta competencia, ella posee buena cantidad de clientes formados, pues de distintos puntos del país vienen a comprar sus plantas.

Tiene proyectado abrir un puesto de venta y exposición en el km. 55 al costado de la ruta principal de la ciudad, de esta forma la señora piensa que sus productos serán observados por los visitantes de otras ciudades y extranjeros que llegan a Caacupé especialmente los fines de semana.

El préstamo solicitado desea utilizarlo para la compra de semillas, abono, macetas e insumos para su vivero.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, seeds, and flowerpots, etc.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo Sebastián R. is married and father to 5 children. He and his family live in and own their house in the city of Ñeemby.  Hugo sells leather-covered thermos bottles for mate or tereré, which are the most popular drinks in Paraguay.

Tereré is the most common drink in Paraguay – so common it’s practically a symbol of the country.  Paraguayans drink tereré in part because of the hot weather throughout most of the year.  It’s made of very cold water mixed with refreshing or natural curatives, each with different purposes such as diuretics, weight reduction, treatment for high blood pressure, digestion, etc.

Mate is similar but is prepared with hot water.  Both tereré and mate use thermos bottles for the water and “guampas” for the yerba mate (the dried leaves used to make tereré or mate).  “Guampas” are generally made of wood, metal or cow horns.  Lately it’s become fashionable to use leather-covered thermos bottles with unique designs, engravings and colors.

Hugo has a vehicle that he uses primarily for delivering his products and for purchasing materials.  He is applying for a loan to purchase thermos bottles, leather and “guampas.”

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hugo Sebastián R. es casado y padre de dos hijos; ellos viven en una casa propia en la cuidad de Ñeemby. Hugo se dedica a la venta de termos forrados en cuero para mate o tereré que son las bebidas mas consumidas en nuestro país.

El tereré es la bebida más típica de nuestro país, es prácticamente un sello que nos caracteriza, el mismo es consumido ya que en nuestro país las altas temperaturas son muy comunes en la mayor parte del año, es por ello que se toma el “tereré” que consiste en agua bien fría a la cual  se le adiciona remedios refrescantes o naturales que poseen distintos tipos de propiedades como diuréticos, adelgazantes, para la presión sanguínea alta, para la buena digestión, entre otros.

El mate por otra parte es lo mismo pero se toma con agua caliente. Para ambos casos se utilizan termos para el agua y “guampas” hechas de madera, metal o del mismo cuerno de los vacunos, en donde se coloca yerba para luego ser tomada con el agua, por lo que está muy de moda utilizar termos forrados en cuero de vaca y que pueden tener distintos diseños, gravados y colores.

Hugo posee un vehículo que lo utiliza principalmente para hacer entregas de sus mercaderías y para la compra de sus materiales. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de termos, cuero, y guampas.

loans.use: Purchase of leather, thermos bottles and “guampas”

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. sells plastic chairs at the local market. She is a single mother and says that it is a good business which makes life worth living for her and her child.

She lacks enough capital to purchase in large quantities and would like a loan to improve her purchasing power and thus increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of plastic chairs at lower costs.

loans.name: Salah Din

texts.en: Salah D. is a taxi driver who has a small family. He works 12 hours in a day. He is a very hard worker. He was faced with some difficulty and he needed money. When he found the AFSG organization, he was very happy and requested an individual loan. He wants to purchase materials that he needs for his car and solve his problem of keeping his taxi working. He wants to make a good income, and he is happy about this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his car.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 26 years old and single. Juan has had a tire center over 4 years ago where he repairs tires, he learned this profession from his father who was dedicated to this job for a long time and from whom he learned a lot.

Juan also sells his goods in the interior of the country and in San Lorenzo where he currently rents a room and has established his business.

In the future he intends to buy several of his own machines to repair tires. Today he wishes to acquire a loan to buy a good amount of tires for new and used cars.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan tiene 26 años, es soltero. Juan tiene una gomería, donde repara las cubiertas y vende llantas y cubiertas hace 4 años, esta profesión aprendió de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo y de quien aprendió mucho.

El Sr. Juan vende también sus mercaderías en el interior del país y en San Lorenzo donde actualmente alquila un local en San Lorenzo en donde tiene su negocio fijo.

En el futuro tiene pensado comprar su propio local con varias maquinas para reparar cubiertas. Hoy desea adquirir el crédito para comprar una buena cantidad de cubiertas para autos nuevas y usadas.

loans.use: Purchase car tires

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Kunthea Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people living in Kos Prak Village in Kandal Province led by Mrs. Chea K., who was selected by the members and is the 27-year-old mother of two preschool-aged children.  She and her husband, Mr. Chea Suy, are fishermen in the local village. Mrs. K. is requesting a loan to buy more fish nets in order to increase their catch.  In addition to this business, Mrs. K. is also a cow breeder currently raising two cows.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets in order to increase their catch

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijas, todas ya son mayores de edad, al igual que su cónyuge trabajan y ayudan en los gastos de la casa.

Lidia es una persona muy sacrificada, quien gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación con ésta actividad puede brindarle una vida digna a toda su familia. Su despensa tiene en su propio domicilio hace más de 25 años, actualmente cuenta con una diversidad de productos satisfaciendo la demanda de su numerosa clientela.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ya que tiene ofertas en ésta época.
texts.en:
Lidia is 50 years old, married, with 4 grown children. Her husband also works and together they help meet the household expenses. Lida is a sacrificing person, who, thanks to her effort and dedication to this job, can provide a dignified life to her family. Her convenience store has been located in her home for more than 25 years, today she has diverse products, satisfying the demands of her numerous customers. The loan will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale as there are sales during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, fruit, vegetables, canned goods and products for the home.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Doña Leonor es integrante del Grupo el Caimito, inicio su negocio  vendiendo de manera ambulante frutas y verduras. Gracias a un financiamiento ofrecido por ADIM logró  poner una pulpería en su casa, donde ofrece productos de necesidad diaria aun con su negocio en su casa no olvida  su primer actividad que es la venta de  frutas y verduras. Cuenta con el apoyo  de su esposo y dos hijas, siendo ellas las encargadas de la pulpería. Vive  en una comarca de Nancimi llamada el Caimito. Plazo otorgado 3.5 meses
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of the Caimito Group, and started her business traveling to sell fruits and vegetables. thanks to the funding offered by ADIM, she was able to put a general store in her house, where she offers daily neceskties even though the business is in her house, she doesn't forget that her primary activity is selling fruits and vegetables. She counts on the support of her husband and her two daughters, being that they are in charge of the general store. She lives in a community in Nncimi called the Caimito. The term is three and a half months.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Mrs. Nirmala T. lives in Sainbu Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, son, and two daughters. Her son makes and sells candles in a local grocery store, and her daughters are in grade 12.
Both Mr. and Mrs. T. own a farm in Sainbu Bhaishepati where they grow seasonal vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening. Due to a lack of modern technology they still depend on traditional farming, like compost fertilizers. Mrs. Nirmala T. is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150) to buy various kinds of seeds and fertilizers for their farm.

loans.use: Buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ploak

texts.en:
Ploak S., 39, is married and lives with four of her children and her husband in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She purchases and sells rice to the market-wholesaler to earn a living and is able to make $8 each day, while her husband grows rice and many kinds of vegetables. On average, he makes $4 a day to help support the family. This couple is also supported by one child who works in a salon.

Mrs. Ploak S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to expand her rice stock.

loans.use: To expand rice stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. is a trader of timber products, like plywood, in the community where she lives. Through handwork and self determination, she hires dogma machines from people who cut the timber directly from the bush for her. There has being frequent breakdowns of the machines preventing her from receiving her weekly supply of timber.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to acquire two dogma machines so she doesn't have to rely on hiring others dogma machines. She plans to employ helpers to assist her in cutting the timber. With this loan, she will be more self-sufficient to meet the demand of her clients who travel from the city to buy her timber. Timber is processed into wood products and used for a variety of crafts. Elizabeth wants the best for her children and to cater to all their school needs, which will be more possible with your help.  

She is thirty-eight years old, married with three children. Her two oldest are in high school studying reading, visual arts and science, while the youngest is breastfeeding.

loans.use: Elizabeth wants the loan to buy two dogma machines to cut timber

loans.name: Margarita De Los Santos

texts.es: La señora Margarita de los Santos C. C. tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio el edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijas , el esposo trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ella trabaja como farmacéutica en el hospital México de Nicaragua , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es establecer mas cultivos de piña para darles un mejor apoyo en cuanto a los estudios y salgan hacia delante , la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento , con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer 2 manzanas , de piña las cuales necesitan insumos para que la producción se venda a un buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Margarita de los Santos C. C. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in the El Eden neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. Her husband works to help her with the household expenses and she works as a pharmacist in the Mexico hospital of Nicaragua. They are raising three children who are in school. Their plan for their family is to cultivate more pineapple to help them better support their children’s education, enabling them to advance. The greatest difficulty has been lack of financing, but through their efforts they have managed to establish two acres of pineapple. They need agricultural supplies to improve their crop to sell at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha H. S. is a snack seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She belongs to Tujitegemee  loan group (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She is hoping this loan will allow her to increase her profits wand expand  her business.  

Asha is 32 years old, married with a 12 year old child. She also cares for two dependents.

loans.use: To buy more flour,cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. is newly married to Marlo S., and they live in Barangay Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. They were both undergraduates in high school, leaving because of financial difficulties. They work hard and strive harder in order to earn a living for their future children so they will be able to afford to send them to school until college.

Due to their low educational attainment, the couple ended up being simple farmers. Sometimes her husband works as a part-time carpenter in their village. They help each other in maintaining their onion and rice farming to yield a good harvest.They plant and harvest twice a year and they only gain a net income of 6,000 pesos (roughly $US140) per harvest season - a small amount to sustain their needs for half of the year. Their incapability in terms of financial aspects motivates Roselyn to request a loan amount of 5,000 pesos that will be used in purchasing the needed agricultural supply for their rice and onion plants.

Hard works and patience are the best ways to become successful, says Roselyn.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. A. is 45 years old, and married with 2 children. Moses sells ice-cream at wholesale and retail. He hopes to expand this business. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more ice-cream to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
El señor Atilano está casado con la señora Silvia Noguera con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gloria de 33 años, María de 32 años, Norma de 30 años, Juan de 23 años y Marcelo de 20 años.

Cuando Atilano tenia 18 años de edad su madre le pidió para que le repare su radio, entonces don Atilano se puso a experimentar por la citada radio, hasta que pudo solucionar el desperfecto. Fue así que decidió estudiar electrónica que le llevo 3 años de estudio, al terminar el mismo decidió abrir su propio local dedicado a la reparación de televisores y radios.

Desde entonces tiene una buena cantidad de cliente ya que se lo conoce por su buen trabajo.
En un futuro próximo Atilano quiere seguir ampliando su clientela y continuar perfeccionandose con sus 60 años.
texts.en:
Atilano is married to Silvia Noguera and they have 5 children: Gloria, age 33, María, 32, Norma, 30, Juan, 23, and Marcelo, 20. When Atilano was 18 years old, his mother asked him to repair her radio. Atilano began working on the radio, until he was able to fix it. It was then that he decided to study electronics. He spent 3 years studying and when he finished, he decided to open his own TV and radio repair shop. He has a large clientele and is known for his good quality work. In the near future, Atilano wants to continue growing his customer base and improving himself, even at the age of 60.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for televisions and radios

loans.name: Fairness Group

texts.en:
These women are Rugiatu K., Fatmata B., and Kadiatu K.. They named their group Fairness Group. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. Each of them received a loan of Le 1,000,000 in the last loan cycle. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees and feed themselves and their families. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Rugiatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in secondary school, one is in primary school and the last is still not of school-going age. Her husband, too, is a businessman. Rugiatu sells items like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, cotton, bowls, dishes, and so on. She has been in this business for more than fifteen years now. Rugiatu will invest her loan in her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Hardworking and industrious, Mariafe B. is 24 years old, a single mother of one child and presently lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She joined PAGLAUM last April 2009 to secure financial assistance for her sari-sari store to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to provide for her child to finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Suyunboy

texts.en:
Married and father of two children, Suyunboy K. was born on August 28, 1974. 

Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Suyunboy has been selling cattle since 2003. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. 

Today Suyunboy would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and expand his business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (254991509) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, B. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale.  B. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1996, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to renovate an existing shelter for the her livestock.  B. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by her from TYM Fund.  B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Anabetty

texts.es: AnaBetty U. G. de 39 años de edad reside en Santa Tecla en el departamento de La Libertad. AnaBetty vive con su esposo quien trabaja en la venta de ropa de manera ambulante  y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando. AnaBetty posee un negocio en el mercado central de San Salvador donde vende variedad de vestidos para ocasiones especiales como fiesta rosa (15 años), primera comunión, boda, entre otros; también ofrece variedad de accesorios de decoración para el cabello o para los mismos vestidos, el destino del crédito que solicita AnaBetty es para la compra de accesorios y vestidos para comercializar en su negocio.
texts.en:
AnaBetty U. Garcia is 39 years old and lives in Santa Tecla in the La Libertad department. AnaBetty lives with her husband, who works as an itinerant clothing salesman, and her three children, who are still students. AnaBetty has a stall in the San Salvador central market where she sells dresses for special occasions like first communions, weddings, quinceanera, etc. as well as a variety of items designed to adorn hairdos or the dresses themselves. The loan she is requesting is to purchase accessories and dresses to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Nasjwa

texts.en:
Nasjwa N. is currently in the business of selling cakes and bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery.  Nasjwa is 18 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land, build and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a bakery

loans.name: Diombo

texts.fr: Diombo D. est une femme de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de chaussures, tissus teintés « Thioup » et de draps de lit. Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettront de contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Diombo D. is a woman of 57, married and the mother of 3 children. She sells shoes, hand-dyed cloth known as «Thioup», and bedsheets. The income generated by her business allows her to contribute to the daily expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling shoes, cloth, and bedsheets

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. lives in a populous village in Malaria, Caloocan City near the market.  She is 37 years old.  Her husband June, 39, manages his own car detailing shop just beside their house.  They have six little children.

Gina started her business more than ten years ago distributing low-cost diaper overruns from factories to small stores in her community.  A few years of successful selling gave her enough courage to establish her general store in front of their house beside her husband’s workshop.  She still sells diapers in bulk and retail.  She now makes P25,000 a month.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006 after attending a series of pre-membership seminars.  Gina is now in need of a new loan of P12,000 for the expansion of her general store.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To expand her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. has been raising poultry to sell on a small scale for one year. He is 33 years old and still single.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. He has already serviced two loans which he repaid promptly. He used the previous loan to build a shelter for his chicken-rearing project. He has now applied for a third loan to buy more chicks to raise and sell. He wants the chickens to be ready to sell during the festive season, because it is the peak time for his business.

In the future, he plans to supply poultry meat to hotels, not just around Naivasha, but also in major towns surrounding Naivasha like Nairobi and Nakuru.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more chicks which he will raise and sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: S. N. is a married woman and a 45 years old and resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia her birth place. Khan Sim currently sells vegetables that she grows them on her own land in the village. Usually, S. N. needs to wait three month times later before harvesting and selling her mature crop. She has four children: two are married and live independently and others are single and are working as garment workers. S. N. will be using the half of her loan to buy more vegetable seeds to grow and the rest to buy an old motorbike which she will use for her family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds to grow and the rest to buy an old motorbike which she will use for her family's riding needs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is from the village of Dulapo. She is 49 years old. Grace is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a "nipa" hut making business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from selling "nipa" huts in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 25 years old. She is married and has a daughter who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Comfort is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more provisions to increase her inventory. Comfort desires to give her daughter the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Lluri Paquita

texts.es: Lluri R. es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de un menor, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es docente (profesor). Lluri forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín de Porres” desde hace cuatro años, ella empezó con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en el negocio de venta de repuestos. Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, labiales, etc. para venderlos a sus clientes. La meta de Lluri es llegar a tener una fuente de soda con una gran variedad de productos que agraden a sus clienntes.
texts.en:
Lluri R. is a very active and determined woman who sells beauty products. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 35 years old and has a child. She has the support of her husband who is a teacher. Lluri has been a member of the communal bank “Fray Martín de Porres” for four years. She started with a 300 soles loan, which allowed her to start a business selling spare parts. She is now requesting a loan for 2500 soles to buy beauty products (perfumes, creams, lipsticks) to sell to her customers. Lluri’s goal is to have a soda fountain with a wide variety of products that please her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products (perfumes, creams, lipsticks)

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca is 30 years old. She sells planks and she is a very hard working woman. She is very happy with her plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with two children. Her children are excelling in school. Due to the increase in her customers, she hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  Her dream is to educate her children to the university level and also build her own house in the future. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Claudia Helen

texts.es:
La señora F. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Seguencoma, de la ciudad de La Paz.
Claudia trabaja como secretaria en una entidad privada de esta ciudad ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los muros de las habitaciones de su vivienda, así como la refacción de los baños.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. F. lives in her parents' house in the region of Seguencoma in the city of La Paz. Claudia works as a secretary in a private company, an income with which she maintains her family. The loan requested is for repairs to the walls of the rooms of her home, as well as the repair of the bathrooms. This is the second time she has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis carried out rates her favourably and enables her to enter into a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to house.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Francisca C. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos que dependan de su matrimonio, su esposo trabaja y aporta al hogar. Francisca se dedica a vender pescado y camarones 
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años.  Este producto lo compra en la playa El Zope y lo comercializa en el departamento de Comayagua a varios restaurantes de la zona, y tambien vende a personas al detalle.
 
Los dias de venta son los miercoles y viernes, el producto lo trasporta en auto bus. 
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar pescado blanco, camaron pargo, filete y curiles. 
gracias a este negocio logra cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca C. is 56 years old, married, and does not have any dependent children. Her husband works and helps support their household. Francisca sells fish and shrimp. She has been in this business for eight years. Her products are acquired at El Zope Beach and sold in the department of Comayagua to different restaurants in the area. She also sells to individual retail customers. The days when she sells are Wednesdays and Fridays. Francisca transports her products in her minibus.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy whitefish, shrimp, snapper fillets, and clams. Thanks to her business, she has been able to cover her household expenses. She is very happy because her business continues to grow each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seafood to sell

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Mr. Chak R. owns and operates his rice-selling business from his home in his village. The business enables him to feed his family. The main operation is to buy mature rice in bulk at reasonable prices and then resell and gain the proceeds. Chak R. was married many years ago to Phan Mean, age 55, who is his family partner who earns a living as a rice grower. She also produces and sells a few cakes to the people for additional income. This couple has two single and three married children. Two are cupcake sellers and others are building workers. In Cambodia, this is the time of year when rice comes to maturity and prices are especially low, so Chak R. is applying for this loan as capital to buy a large amount of mature rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of mature rice to resell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena manages a sari-sari store. She is 41 years old with three children. The eldest child is 18 years old. She lacks capital to run her business. That’s why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for a loan of 15,000 PHP. This will help her buy more stocks of groceries for her store. With the profit she will earn, she can send her children to school and provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 42 years old, married and has five children. She owns a shop; she makes and sells beads and accessories. She said bead-making gives her joy as this gives room for creativity. She makes different designs and these attract more customers to her shop.
 
Beads are used to beautify oneself for any kind of occasions; it is also use to dress a bride for a wedding ceremony. Due to her high patronage, Bola wants to expand and improve on her business.

Bola is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150, 000 to purchase more beads and accessories to sell. She hopes to support her husband in educating her children. She appreciates all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beads and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Flor  De Azucena Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Panamericana se caracteriza por acoger a socias que se encuentran en Zonas nuevas de la ciudad de El Alto, generalmente migrantes de primera generación.
Es el caso de la asociación “ Flor de Azucena”, cuenta con 12 integrantes y están ingresando al ciclo 16, esto significa pronto cumpliran 8 años trabajando con la familia de Pro Mujer.
Los negocios de las socias son:  venta de ropa, aceite, pelotas, confección de chompas, venta de plástico, elaboración de aguayos (tejido especial  para llevar a los bebes) , venta de condimentos,  tejido de mantas, venta de alimento seco y venta de comida.
 
La señora Casilda M. de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 niños, tiene el negocio de venta de ropa hace un año atrás, ella compra su mercadería de Desaguadero porque es más económico y vende sus productos en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto, tambien realiza viajes a diferentes pueblos como Caranavi y espera estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer. En esta oportunidad el préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, es decir, ropa.
texts.en:
The Panamericana focal center is characterized by gathering in members who live in the city of El Alto’s newest areas; usually first-generation immigrants. Such is the case of the “Flor de Azucena “ (Easter Lilly) association. It is composed of 12 members who are starting their 16th loan cycle, which means that they are about to complete their 8th year collaborating with the Pro Mujer family. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sales of clothing, cooking oil, balls. Some make sweaters, others sell plastic items. Some manufacture aguayos (a special woven item used by women to carry their babies on their backs) while others sell condiments. There are blanket weavers, food sellers and grocers. Casilda M., 28, is married and has 5 children. She has sold clothing for a year now. She buys merchandise in Desaguadero, because it’s less expensive there, and sells her products in El Alto’s La Ceja market. She also travels to other towns, like Caranavi. She hopes to be associated with the Pro Mujer family for a long time. She will use this loan to buy clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr. S. is a modest person of 27 years who lives with his family in Phnom Penh city. He is married with three minor kids and a school-aged child. He helps be responsible for his family by working as a garment laborer, through which he can make around $100 salary a month. He is married to Sophal, 27, who works with him in the same industry. S. has no vehicle and he has always paid much money to taxis to take him to work. S. hopes to reduce this fee with a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorcycle for his travel needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: To Me To You Group

texts.en:
This group is named “To Me To You”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. They are therefore requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group in order to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader is Abibatu K. who is pictured right. Abibatu sells cloth and has been doing this business for more than fifteen years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy bales of cloth (cottons) to add to her business.  

Abibatu was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and the couple has two children – one in class one and the other in nursery school. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy bales of cloth

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has a fruit and vegetable shop. He sells all types of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. Wael has been in this business for two years and has been able to attract many customers in his neighborhood since he sells good quality products.

Wael is requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua so that he can buy fruits and vegetables. This will help him become more competitive in the market.

In the future he plans to continue improving his work by purchasing and offering the best products and also purchasing more exotic fruits and vegetables depending on the season.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: M. Musa is thirty-seven years old. He is married with five school agedchildren. He owns a retail shop business selling essential goods. The retail shop is located alonga  highway in Lukaya Central. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, bread, cold drinks, millet flour and others items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, bread, cold drinks, millet flour and others items for resale.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn V. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Merlyn owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also helps at their farm, which her husband mainly manages. They plant rice crops and sell the harvest in their town. One of her wishes for the future is to have her children finish college and to find appropriate jobs for themselves.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Sacsac, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and farming businesses. Her husband, Zacarias N., 57 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business. They have four children who are 20 to 31 years old. Victoria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she hoped for something better for her family. Victoria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow and with the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000; thus, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan cycle, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her livestock and to purchase fertilizer for farming so that she can continue to save up for future additional capital for her business. Victoria N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for pig fattening and farming needs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erlinda hopes for her farming to be successful.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Baax Yaye Group

texts.fr:
La groupe de solidarité BAAX YAYE est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par même centre d'intérêt. 

Madame ANTA BOUYA S., ) l'extrême droite de sur la photo, vêtue de grand boubou orange parsemé d'étoiles blanches est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa belle fille et de sa petit fille. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de colliers et de bijoux en perles de couleurs. C'est elle même qui fabrique les colliers avant de les revendre en faisant du porte à porte. Elle pratique cette activité depuis au moins 20 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter beaucoup de perles en couleurs pour fabriquer plus de colliers et de bijoux afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus importants. 

Elle a comme objectif d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et assurer la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Baax Yaye solidarity group was created on 5th December 2007. It is made up of 12 women from the same neighborhood, who are neighbors and/or have the same interests. Mrs. Anta Bouya S., who is on the extreme right of the photo and dressed in a large orange "boubou" (African dress) sprinkled with white stars, is in charge of the group. She is 57 years old, married and mother to six children. She also has responsibility for her daughter-in-law and granddaughter. She has a small business selling necklaces and jewelry made out of colored beads. She makes the necklaces herself before retailing them on a door-to-door basis. She has been carrying out this business for at least 20 years. Her new loan will allow her to buy a large quantity of colored beads in order to make up more necklaces and other jewelry and make a more significant profit. Her aim is to boost her savings and provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase colored beads

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. is a member of the Rizal Central Branch of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a microfinance institution partner of Kiva in the Philippines. She is 57 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer and, because of their family’s meager income, none of their children is pursuing a degree. Their eldest is engaged in buying and selling while the other three work as drivers and laborers.

Mildred dreamed of having a better life and a nice future for her children and that is why, when she entered ASHI, she became committed to the rules and regulations of the institution. She is recognized as one of the most dedicated and active members. She works hard to receive the benefits ASHI provides to its exemplary members. As a result, her life is getting better and she has proven her dignity and her dedication to rise from poverty.

Mildred is applying for a loan of Php 15,000 to fund her business. She is a dealer in soft drinks in her community and supplies many stores. This additional capital will increases her profit and sustain the demands of her customers.

Mildred’s family is glad there are institutions like ASHI and Kiva who are helping families who direly needs financial assistance but don’t have the capacity to provide collateral to serve as a guarantee for the loan. They are hopeful their dreams in life will soon be meet.

loans.use: To buy additional cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan de 51 años, vende periódicos en las calles de Guayaquil con su bicicleta, vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada y muchas casas de caña a su alrededor. 

Ya tiene 20 años vendiendo periódicos por la falta de oportunidades y la necesidad dinero. Su esposa le ayuda con algunos gastos vendiendo libros ellos tiene 4 hijos que en ocasiones su hijo menor le ayuda a vender los periódicos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. 

Para ayudarle a sus hijos con sus estudios el quiere comprar con el préstamo libros y cuadernos y un aparte dirigirla para pagar las pensiones. En el futuro quiere tener un vehiculo para ya no recorrer en bicicleta.
texts.en:
Juan, age 51, sells newspapers with his bicycle on the streets of Guayaquil. He lives a periurban area called the Perimetral. It is situated near a salt marsh with lots of cane houses around it. He has been selling newspapers for 20 years due to the lack of opportunities and the need to make money. His wife helps him with some of the expenses by selling books. They have four children. Sometimes their oldest child helps him sell the newspapers. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. everyday. In order to help his children with their education, he wants to use the loan to buy books and notebooks. He will use some of the loan to pay the school fees. In the future he wants to have a vehicle so that he no longer has to use his bicycle when he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Books and notebooks

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John N. is a sole proprietor  businessman who operates  a butchery in an urban setting near a school. His customers are mainly students. He has been in this business for  four years and earns an  income of Kshs.9,000 per month.

John is married to Margaret Wambui and together they are blessed with four children; three of the children are secondary school students and the last born is in primary school. His wife does farming and this adds to the family income. John was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client of   KADET; he has no history with any other MFI. He  is applying  for his first loan of Kshs.20,000 from  KADET, with which he  intends to buy more goats to have more meat to sell in his butchery.

His major aim is to firmly establish his business and see his children get a better education in future. He is 43 years old and  very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more goats to have more meat to sell

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a married father of three daughters and three sons.  He is a taxi driver in Bethlehem city and lives in Bethlehem.  Ahmed wants to fix his car with the $3,000 loan he took from FATEN.  Ahmed is saving as much as possible to buy a new car soon and increase his productivity and returns.

Ahmed lives a very simple life due to the demands of a big family and hopes that fixing the car will help him carry on with taking care of a big family.

Ahmed appears next to his car in the picture here.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Marcyline

texts.en:
Marcyline N. is a 23-year-old pharmacist with a pharmarcy in Chaani Changamwe Mombasa. She is married to Nicholas who owns the pharmacy and they are blessed with three children.

She has been in this business for the last two years and has done great. She hopes to use the second loan she is requesting from KADET to expand her stock in the pharmacy shop and use the anticipated profit to open up another shop in the town centre.

She hopes to continue with her education in the future and open up a clinic beside her pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand her stock in the pharmacy shop

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson A. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. He is 39 years old. Nelson is married and has three young children. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to improve the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Nelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve the business

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a resident of Kisii Town in western Kenya, where he has been doing mixed farming and selling his produce of bananas, maize, beans and milk. He has been in farming for 25 years.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will be a good and stable source of milk for family consumption and income for the children's education fees.

His major challenges are animal diseases, a poor market for the products and hostile weather conditions at times. He is very appreciative to Juhudi for the loan service.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a deep fried potato selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells coconuts at the market which contributes to her income.  Fatuma faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to supply potatoes wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, wheat flour, salt, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 35 years old and is a widow with two children, ages 8 and 9 years old. Marie Louise sells cassava. She has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from 6am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. She currently employs two people.

Marie Louise will use this loan to buy more cassava to sell. Any profits she makes will allow her to reinvest. In addition, she will start to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Antony Mwaura

texts.en:
Antony Mwaura N. is a 35-year-old man, married to Margaret Njoki. Together they have three children. Margaret supports the family by adding income, while Antony works as a mechanic in Eldoret town. He has been in this business for 15 years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings.

This will be Antony's fifth loan from KADET LTD. He has repaid all other loans successfully, and with this loan he plans to use it entirely to buy spare parts for his mechanic job. His dream is to become richer and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the business

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
Juana Bautista vive en el barrio carrizal de Barranquilla, en una casa familiar en compañía de su hija que comparte con sus sobrinos. A Juana la separación de su esposo  y su inmenso deseo de salir adelante con su joven hija de 16 años, le impulsaron su espíritu emprendedor con el que ha logrado negocios, que la sostienen y que muy seguramente  le darán  la opción de alcanzar el sueño de convertir a su hija una profesional exitosa. Ellas en la actualidad comparten un casa familiar con sus sobrinos  en un pequeño espacio de la vivienda, donde desde hace ya diez años se dedica a la fabricación de escobas, traperos, cepillos, experiencia aprendida de una amiga al verla en dificultades para conseguir ingresos y ella fue adicionalmente capacitándose y aprendiendo tanto en lo productivo como en lo administrativo, generando sus propias oportunidades y  logrando con sus ahorros, comprar todas las herramientas y equipos para su desempeño. Progresivamente  Juana fue adicionando  otra actividad  que es la venta de refrescos y bebidas, dulces y variedades en general, ahora cuenta  con su maquinaria básica, equipos, enfriador y estanterías, para realizar sus actividades generadoras de ingresos, con la que ha apoyado a su familia, un hermano y un sobrino que  la ayudan en la fabricación de estos productos y también ha generado 10 empleos en las personas de la comunidad,  con  quienes cuenta para el impulso de su venta en  el municipio de Barranquilla  y en general en poblaciones del departamento del Atlántico y de  Bolívar. Juana cuenta que recientemente se han incrementado los pedidos de los vendedores y también para diciembre, su otro negocio de refrescos y variedades tuvo un repunte en las ventas. Este es su prime crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este credikiva comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus productos como paja, algodón,  listones de madera y cepillos de lavar; Su promedio de ventas mensuales es de $1.500.000 COP, su margen de utilidad es del 50%, su autonomía es del 98.9%,  su liquidez de 5-1 sus ventas las realiza  de contado. 
Juana es una mujer feliz de tener este negocio porque le encanta atender a su clientela y siente su actividad productiva muy agradable por eso  disfruta de ella y se mantiene sonriente.
texts.en:
Juana Bautista lives in Carrizal neighborhood, in Barranquilla.  Juana and her daughter live in a family member's home that they share with her nieces and nephews.  Juana's separation from her husband and her immense desire to get herself and her 16 year-old daughter ahead in life, drove her entrepreneurial spirit, with which she has succeeded in setting up businesses that support herself and which will almost certainly allow her to reach her dream of turning her daughter into a successful professional.

Juana and her daughter currently share a family member's house with her nieces and nephews.  They live in a small part of the house where, for ten years now, Juana has worked making brooms, floor cloths and brushes.  She learned this trade from a friend who saw that she was having difficulties in making income.  Juana trained and learned how to make her products and also how to run her business and make her own opportunities.  With some savings she had, she was able to buy all the tools and supplies that she needed to carry out her business.

Juana also started out in another business activity, selling soft drinks, sweet treats and other general snacks.  She now has the basic machinery, tools, chiller cabinet and shelving that she needs to carry out her income-generating business activities.  Through her businesses, she has managed to support her family.  A brother and a nephew help her to make her products and she has also created 10 jobs for other people in her community on whom she relies for her sales in the town of Barranquilla and in the towns of Atlántico and Bolívar departments.

Juana tells us that her sellers' orders have increased recently and also, during the month of December, her other business selling drinks and snacks saw an upturn in sales.

This is Juana's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this Kiva loan to buy materials for making her products: straw, cotton, wooden bars and cleaning brushes.  Juana's average monthly sales amount to $1,500,000 Colombian pesos, her profit margin is 50%, her autonomy is 98.9%, her liquidity is 5-1 and her sales are made in cash.  Juana is happy to have her business because she loves serving her customers and she enjoys her productive activity.  She enjoys her work and it keeps her smiling.

loans.use: To buy materials for making her products: straw, cotton, wooden bars, cleaning brushes

loans.name: Charly Jannisse

texts.es:
La señora Charly es socia del banco comunal Vecinas unidas, del Distrito calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad.
Tiene 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de celulares, ella se abastece con productos que traen de la frontera con Bolivia, su esposo trabaja como chofer de motocar (transportista).
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 8 celulares chinos, para venderlos acá  en Pucallpa, ella trabaja mayormente con pedidos
Por el impedimento que tiene con la pierna, no puede ir a traer ella misma sino que otra persona se encarga de enviar sus pedidos, de esa manera también ahorra bastante en lo que son pasajes y le sale más a cuenta.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido tener su capital para seguir trabajando, porque por estos días es bien difícil obtener préstamos, los trámites son demasiados engorrosos.
texts.en:
Charly is a member of the “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s 33 years old, married and has a minor child.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She sells cellular phones.  She stocks up on products brought from the Bolivian border.  Her husband works as a motorcar driver (transportation).

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 8 Chinese cellular phones to sell in Pucallpa.  She works mostly on order.

Because of the impediment she has on her leg she can’t go herself to pick up the merchandise so someone else takes care of sending her orders.  This way she saves quite a bit on transportation costs and makes more profits.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has been able to have capital to stay in business because these days it’s quite difficult to get loans; the paperwork is quite cumbersome.

loans.use: To buy cellular phones.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle O. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 39 years old. Annabelle is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling assorted such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies & rice per kilogram in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Shova

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Shova L.. She is married and has 2 children aged 26 and 23. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to seeds and fertilizers for vegetable farming. In the future, Shova plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. You can also join the BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza has been a fish vendor for nine years. She buys her fish directly from fishermen and sells an assortment of fresh fish from her rented stall at the local market. 

Analiza has requested this loan in order to purchase more fish to offer for sale at market. 

Analiza and her husband have one child. In the future, she hopes for her child to finish college and attain success.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 30 years old and is married.  He and his wife have two children between the ages 2 and 5 years old. Theogene is transporting people from their workplace.

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy motorbike.  with this profits, he will build a house for his family and save money for his future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcyle.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre Santa Rosa se conformó en fecha 03 de julio del 2008. Con mucho esfuerzo y esmero se encuentran ya en el décimo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también  hacen trabajos en forma conjunta con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Luciana B., quien se dedica a la artesanía, nos comenta que mediante el crédito y la asesoría recibida de Fundacion Paraguaya durante todos estos años, pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración.
Ella posee varios telares en su domicilio, donde cuenta con gran variedad de productos y tejidos con precios muy accesibles, mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante.
Las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importantes para las miembros de este grupo ya que pudieron desarrollar sus capacidades de trabajo en equipo, además de levantar su autoestima como madres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This committee of hard working women is called Santa Rosa and was formed on July 3, 2008.  With lots of effort and motivation they are now in their 10th loan cycle, in a very united way within the program.

Aside from their individual work, they also work together to raise funds for the group.

One moving story is that Luciana B., who sells crafts, tells us that the loan and advice she’s been getting all these years from Fundacion Paraguaya, allowed her to greatly improve her business and its management.

She has a number of looms in her home, where she also has a large number of weaved items at good prices.  This business helped her household financial situation improve greatly.

The activities with Fundación Paraguaya are very important for the members of the group, because they were able to develop their training as a team.  It also raised their self esteem as working mothers.
.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas y pintura, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad. En el taller trabaja con tres empleados, labora todos los días y su ventaja es estar solo en la zona, brindando los servicios.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro de diferentes medidas y pintura de aceite, también remodelar el negocio, ampliándolo para dar una mejor vistosidad y atender mejor a los clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar el taller, ser más productivo.
texts.en:
Elmer manages a metal and paint shop. He lives in San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 12. His shop has three employees and they all work every day. Elmer has the advantage of being the only person in the area who provides these services.

He is requesting a loan to buy iron in different sizes and oil-based paints. He also wants to remodel his business by expanding it so that it has greater visibility and can better serve his customers. His aspiration is to improve his workshop so that it is more productive.

loans.use: to purchase iron in different sizes and oil-based paints.

loans.name: Exiomara Ermelinda

texts.es:
la sra. Exiomara Ermelinda tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el parque central de el Triunfo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, muchas personas la prefieren ya que sus comidas son muy sabrosas y sus precios son baratos.
Exiomara es madre de 5 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, su esposo es agricultor, juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimentos para la preparacion de las golosinas.
Exiomara tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exiomara Ermelinda, age 50, sells snacks in the central park of Triunfo.  She has been in business for several years and many people prefer her business because of the tasty, inexpensive dishes she prepares.
