Exiomara is the mother of five children, all of whom are adults.  Her husband helps with the household expenses.  He works as a farmer and together they work hard to get ahead.

The loan will be used to buy ingredients for food preparation.

Exiomara also raises hens.

loans.use: To buy yucca, cabbage, tomatoes, lemons, pork, beef, chicken, beans, flour tortillas, bread, juices, and gas.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 31 años, convive con Pedro de 31 años, ambos tuvieron 4 hijos menores a los cuales alimenta y educa en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Duraznillo. Como es de costumbre todas las mañanas sale a la ciudad a vender los gladiolos que ella misma siembra en un terreno alquilado; ya hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, y ahora desea tener mayor capital para poder vender en varios puntos del país. Ya que la ciudad de Tarma es conocida como  “la ciudad de la flores”, donde se produce la mayor cantidad de flores que se distribuye por todo el interior del país.  Olga disfruta de su trabajo porque puede salir a varios lugares y no tiene que regatear sus flores ya que ella misma las vende de lugar en lugar. Pero en estos meses tiene planes de viajar a la capital para vender las flores que sembrará con el préstamo que obtenga. Proyectándose a los meses de octubre y noviembre; donde el precio de venta se incrementa, producto de la demanda que genera las festividades dentro del país. Su buena disposición en el trabajo la motiva para enfrentar con mucha tranquilidad los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus menores hijos, donde invierte la mayor cantidad de sus ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sarita Colonia”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta por que tendrá otra vez la oportunidad de lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Olga, comprará con el dinero solicitado semillas de flor de gladio y alhelí que sembrará dentro de estos meses, y para asegurar la buena producción de sus cultivos invertirá también en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para distribuirlos consecutivamente.
texts.en:
Olga, aged 31, lives with Pedro, also 31, and they have 4 minor children to educate and provide for in their own home, located in the village of Duraznillo. As is customary, every morning she goes to the city to sell the gladiolas that she grows on rented land. For 10 years now Olga has been dedicated to agriculture, and she wants to increase her capital to be able to sell in various parts of the country. Tarma is known as the “City of Flowers,” and its crops are distributed throughout Peru. 

Olga enjoys her work because she gets to travel to various places and she doesn't have to bargain over prices, since she herself sells her crops from place to place. In the future, she plans to travel to the capital to sell the flowers that she will sow with this loan, looking towards October and November, when flower prices will increase, due to demand generated by national holidays.

Olga's good disposition towards her work motivates her to confront with tranquility the expenses of the household and educating her minor children, where most of her earnings are invested. This is her 2nd loan through MFP, and she is quite content because it gives her another opportunity to reach her objectives. Once again, she commits herself to the payment schedule, as in her previous loan. In addition, Olga is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because all the members are responsible persons with strong solidarity.

With this loan, Olga will buy gladiola and anheli (a local favorite) flower seeds to sow during these months, and in order to assure good crop production, she will also buy various sacks of organic manure to distribute consecutively.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds to plant and organic manure to fertilize her flowers, which she herself will sell in various locales.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
42-year-old Cristita has had a snack vending business for two years now. She is a mother of six school-aged dependents and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Cristita sells a freshly prepared snack like sweet potato and banana cue at the market everyday. She earns PHP 1,250 per month doing this type of business. She established the snack vending business as a way of generating extra income for the family, especially for the education of her children. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for snack preparation.

Cristita has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Cristita hopes to expand her food business and gain more profits.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for snack preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 55 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía donde vende polos, chompas, muñecas y pantalones, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Inti Quilla" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 55 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  The borrower has a handicrafts store where she sells tops, sweaters, dolls and pants.  She works from 9.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand her business selling handicrafts. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

The borrower is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng is 35 years old and a resident of Kompong Chhnag Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Roeng, aged 33, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has two children who are of school-age. They also work on the farm when they are free from studying. Mrs. Cheng says she planted rice over 2 months ago but it is still not growing well because they need more fertilizers. Therefore, Mrs. Cheng has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing costs: she hires the machine but it is on credit.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of fertilizers and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Frank has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for 3 years.         
	
To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Frank hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Frank hopes to expand his business. Frank is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mary Isabel

texts.es:
Mary de 37 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Mary desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y alimento balanceado para los mismos, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mary es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para tener otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Mary, 37, lives with her family in her own home. She lacks basic services and is located in a rural area of the district of Olmos in Lambayeque province. This area is characterized by its agriculture and livestock.

For several years Mary has worked raising and selling goats. Her corral is at the back of her house where the animals are happy and comfortable. She gives them feed and natural pastures so that they reach optimum growth and then sells them at different markets in the area. Thus she makes a very good profit and is able to pay the daily expenses of her family.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and feed. With the income she receives from the sales, she will cover her loan and improve her family’s quality of life. Mary is a hard working and very responsible person whose only wish is for her family to better itself and improve economically in order to have more amenities.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spaghetti, sardines, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, es ama D. casa y vive con su familia y dos hijos, a quienes apoya con el estudio, el negocio lo tiene desD. hace 6 años y lo tiene en su propia casa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos y concentrado, esta compra le ayudara para mantener en su granja un número mayor y cuando los venda ganara más utilidad.
La proyección D. Ana es que su granja sea amplia y con un buen numero D. cerdos, que el comercio este mejorando para que también su calidad D. vida sea mejor.
texts.en:
Ana makes her living raising pigs.  She is a home-maker as well and lives with her family and two children, who she supports in their education.  She has had her business for 6 years, and it is set up in her own house.
Ana is requesting the loan in order to purchase pigs and animal feed.  This purchase will help her to maintain a larger number of livestock in her farm and so when she sells them, she will earn a greater profit.
Ana hopes to expand her farm with a good number of pigs, that the market continues to improve and that her quality of life improves as well.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Ominajon

texts.ru: Оминахон умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Её муж занимается услугами таксиста на местном городе. Она сама занимается откормом скота. Она успешно продолжает данный бизнес более 11 лет и у неё очень хороший опыт. Она имеет 6 голов овца и 3 голов корову. Она получает хороший доход от данного бизнеса, прибыль который она получила,  она отремонтировала свой дом. Оминахон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ominajon is a smart and honest woman. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the nearby town. Ominajon herself raises cattle for sale. She has been running her business for the last 11 years and has a lot of experience taking care of animals. Her herd consists of six sheep and three cows. The business is profitable and she was able to repair the family home using income from cattle sales. Ominajon is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno.  Es viuda y tiene 63 años. Nunca visitó una escuela, pero sus tres hijas y dos hijos que tienen entre 25 y 44 años cuentan todos con una educación superior. Ellos ya son independientes y viven fuera, sólo su nieto D. 14 años vive con ella y le hace compañía D. vez en cuando en su negocio. 
DesD. hace seis años Eusebia se dedica a su bodeguita donD. venD. sobre todo bebidas. Inició con un capital D. S./ 1,000.00. Antes que instale esa bodeguita tuvo una tienda D. ropa, pero le han robado todo, así que tenía que empezar D. nuevo. Con este nuevo préstamo D. S./ 3,000.00 va a comprar productos nuevos como arroz, azúcar y abarrotes en general.
Su meta es ampliar su negocio. Está unos 7 años con Manuela Ramos y lo que le gusta es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Nueva Generación Community Bank in Ilave district in the department of Puno. She is a widow and is 63 years old. She herself has never been to school, but her three daughters and two sons aged between 25 and 44 have all had a good education. They are all adults living away from home. However, a 14-year old grandson lives with her and keeps her company from time to time in her store.

For the last six years Eusebia has run a small store where she sells mainly drinks. She began with an investment of S/.1000. Beforehand she had a clothing store but everything was stolen and she had to start over again. 

With this new loan of S/.3000 she plans to buy new products such as rice, sugar, and other groceries. Her goal is to expand her store. Eusebia has been a client of Manuela Ramon for seven years, and she most enjoys the opportunity to save.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a poultry house and sells grown chickens. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy chicken feed for the chickens. Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Genara Marcelina

texts.es: Genara Marcelina tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de realizar este negocio a pesar de que no es fácil ella tiene sus 3 hijos que le ayudan con la actividad desafortunadamente Genara no ha podido brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, porque los ingresos que obtiene son muy pocos como madre soltera le brinda lo que ella puede. El motivo del crédito es para realizarles ciertas mejoras para su bote.
texts.en: Genara Marcelina is 38 years old. She sells seafood. She has had this business for more than 9 years She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys being able to manage the business even though it is not easy. She has 3 children that help her with the business. Unfortunately, Genara has not been able to give her children an education as her income is very low. As a single mother she does what she can for them. The reason for the loan is to make certain improvements to her boat.

loans.use: to make certain improvements to her boat.

loans.name: Chansiman

texts.en:
Chansiman, picutured here, is 28 and single. She lives with her widowed mother in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. Chansiman is a garment worker. 

Chansiman is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike to get work. Currently, she travels to work by bicycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Xuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 56 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years, she has bred sheep and cows. She sells her sheep for meat and breeds cows to sell milk and yogurt. These products are very popular among local people who use them in everyday cuisine. 

Xuraman is requesting a loan to expand her business and purchase six sheep and one milk cow.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a cow

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en: Tabita, a 33-year-old mother of two children aged four and seven, both in school, is married to an agronomist. Tabita sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, and salt in a store that she has run for three years. She would like a loan to increase her inventory of goods to sell in her store. Any profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sai's Group

texts.en:
Sai is a 27-year-old mother of two pre-school children. Living in a village of the Ponhea Krek district, she and her husband have been farming and planting cassava for five years to make a living. She supplements her income by raising pigs for sale and sometimes also by working for other people. 

With her current daily income of around four U.S. dollars, she is requesting her first group loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this will help her to grow more rice and cassava so as to earn larger income. This will allow her to feed her family better and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 47-year-old married woman. She has three children with her husband, who works for a private company. Four years ago, Hanan started a small independent business from home. She started by selling clothes and added another type of product that is not even related – selling frozen food products such as frozen vegetables. For both businesses, Hanan has her own customers who keep knocking on her door asking for what she sells. Hanan has applied for a loan to expand her second business and buy one more freezer to stock more frozen food products.

loans.use: to buy one more freezer for frozen food products.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, de 29 años de edad, es originaria de León, es ama de casa y a la vez comerciante se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y tiene una pulpería. Tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están estudiando y el menor no tiene edad para asistir  a la escuela. Comenzó con esta actividad cuando tenia 23 años , crio su primer cerdo después fue aumentando poco a poco sus animales posteriormente también compro gallinas para  criar y vender. Este ha sido su primer negocio el cual le ha permitido ser independiente de su esposo generando ingresos para contribuir su hogar y salir 	adelante 	con 	sus 	hijos.
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos para vender. Este inversión le ayudara porque podrá mejorar la calidad de sus animales, podrá vender a buen precio y sacar adelante su negocio. A ella le gustaría tener una granja de cerdos y gallinas con buenas condiciones para la crianza y desarrollo .
texts.en:
Reyna, 29 years old, is originally from León.  She is a housewife who also works raising pigs and chickens and has a small store.  She has three children, two of whom are in school, and the youngest is not yet old enough to attend school.  

She started this work when she was 23 years old.  She raised her first pig and afterward began slowly adding more animals.  She also purchased chickens to raise and sell.  This has been her first business, which has allowed her to be independent from her husband and generate income to contribute to the household expenses and improve her children's lives.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase pigs to sell.  This investment would help her because she will be able to improve the quality of her animals, sell them at a good price, and improve her business.  In the future, she would like to have a pig and chicken farm with good conditions to raise and develop her animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, is a widow with four children. Perlita is 61 years old and resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Perlita owns and operates a coconut crop with a lemon business venture to earn a living and she's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2006, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Perlita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.ru: Фозилджон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Более 13 лет он занимается купле- продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местном скотном рынке. Он имеет большой опыт работы и знает все секреты данного бизнеса. На сегодняшний день он имеет 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Фозилджон хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия и запрашивает займ для ремонта своего дома.  Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Foziljon is a kind, hardworking man. He is married and has two children. For more than 13 years he has bought and sold small livestock at the local market. He has a lot of work experience and knows all the tricks of the trade. He currently has 10 heads of small livestock. Foziljon wants to improve his living conditions and is requesting a loan for home repairs. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi N. is 38 years old, married and mother of five (05) children with also three (03) dependants of her died brother. Her husband has not any stable economic activity, that is the reason why she is taking in to charge all the family needs. Dress maker by trade, she realized that this career was not so profitable to her as it is only profitable in the feast period. Then, she has decided to make trading. So, she buys paddy rice at Kovié (Togo), husks, stock and resells it on the market of Aného. This activity is very flourishing for her as she is succeeding to make a profit which allows her to provide for her family needs. With all the experience that she has in this trade, she wishes to increase her activities in order to be able to respond to the more and more high demand on the local market. With the credit of $ 850 solicited, she could have at her disposal a consequent working capital to have a permanent stock of rice.

Madame N. Adjovi est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle a également en charge 3 enfants de son frère décédé. Son mari n’a pas d’activité économique fixe, ce qui fait qu’elle prend en charge tous les besoins de la famille. Couturière de formation, elle s’est rendue compte que ce métier ne lui était pas trop rentable car il n’est lucratif qu’en période de fête. Elle a donc décidé de faire du commerce. Ainsi, elle achète du riz paddy à Kovié (Togo), le décortique, le stocke et le revend sur le marché d’Aného. Cette activité est très florissante pour elle car elle arrive à dégager un bénéfice qui lui permette de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Avec toute l’expérience qu’elle a dans ce commerce, elle souhaite augmenter ses activités afin de pouvoir répondre à une demande de plus en plus forte sur le marché local. Avec le crédit des $ 850 sollicités, elle pourra disposer d’un fonds de commerce conséquent pour avoir un stock permanent de riz.

loans.use: Paddy rice storage

loans.name: Kébidou

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Nigeria, Mr A. Kebidou is married and father of five children. He works selling brochette and is his main source of income, which allows him to provide for his family and their needs. His practice of good hygiene and his expertise has made him a favored merchant of all the local inhabitants of his neighborhood. He has 2 active loans which he keeps in good balance. To expand his business he needs to buy animals and chicken meat, so he is asking for another loan of $650.00, which will enable him to increase his earnings and to contribute more to the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Né en 1966 au Nigéria, Monsieur A. Kébidou est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exerce comme activité de vente de brochette qui constitue sa source de revenu et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Sa bonne pratique de l’hygiène et sa maîtrise fait de lui un bon vendeur aimé de tous les habitants de sa localité. Il compte actif 2 crédits qui ont été bien soldés. Pour pouvoir renforcer son activité de vente par l’achat d’animaux et de poulets de chair, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $650 qui pourra le procurer d’importants revenus afin de contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase animals and chicken meat.

loans.name: Dostu

texts.en:
Dostu B. lives in the Alinazarli village of the Beylagan region. He is 48 years old. Dostu is married, and he has two children.

He is engaged in cattle-breeding. This year, he borrowed a loan from Normicro's Beylagan branch in the amount of $400 and bought one cow. He is developing his job, and cattle-breeding is improving day by day.

loans.use: For buying one cow

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Mrs. Vorng P. P. is 35 years old and works two jobs in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  First, she is a teacher and can earn only $2/day at this job.  She also works with her husband selling medicines and medical supplies to people in their village.  This gives them enough income to support their 3 young children.  Mrs. Vorng P. P. will use this loan to purchase more medicines for her store because the local people are demanding more and more of her products.  In the future, she and her husband want to open a bigger pharmacy with a variety of medicines and supplies.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her small pharmacy

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 43 years old and single. She makes garments which she embroiders and then sells to the wholesalers in the city of San Cristobal, who exhibit in the city's handicraft market. She is part of a group called Esquipulas 3, together with Rosa Lopez P., who also works making handicrafts such as embroidered table clothes and napkins. Both of them would like to use the loan to buy larger quantities of fabric and thread to divide between them, and bring down their costs and increase their profits

PETRONA, tiene 43 años, soltera es artesana se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir las cuales posteriormente borda y vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad de San Cristóbal quienes exponen en el mercado de artesanías de la ciudad Pertenece al grupo Esquípulas 3 junto con doña Rosa López Pérez quien también trabaja como artesana pero confeccionando manteles y servilletas las cuales borda posteriormente. Ambas esperan con el préstamo comprar cantidades grandes de telas e hilos de bordar y repartirse entre ellas y así bajar los costos de compra y aumentar sus ganancias al vender sus productos a los mayoristas de la ciudad .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products and help her business grow

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mr. Ung B., 35, is married and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.
To cover his household’s expense, Mr. Ung B. works as a construction foreman, earning around $16/day in revenue, while his wife works as a housewife looking after her child and cooking food for him. Mr. Ung B. hopes to use this loan to purchase wood frames and some construction tools to facilitate his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood frames and some tools to facilitate his business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a single mother of a daughter who lives with her.

Señora María has made a living selling clothing and household appliances for 17 years. She previously had a small grocery store which wasn't very successful, so she incorporated clothing sales, which had much more advantageous results for her than the other business.

With the current credit requested, she hopes to acquire a larger quantity of clothing and household appliances to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María es madre soltera y tiene una hija que vive con ella.

La Sra. Maria se dedica a vender ropas y electrodomésticos hace ya 17 años; anteriormente tenía una despensa la cual no tuvo mucho éxito, luego fue incorporando la venta de ropas a cuota que le resulto mas ventajoso que la otra actividad.

Con el actual crédito solicitado desea adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas y electrodomésticos para vender.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and household appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and add stock to his spare parts business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia Córdova de Gràndez, a member of the communal bank, “Flor del Maní” , is a native of the Moyobamba province, in the district of Soritor. She is a very hard worker, and sells staple goods, vegetables, breads, and donuts that she prepares. Amelia enjoys her business because she has contact with people. Her grocery store is located in her own home in the province of Soritor in the department of San Martin.

With a loan of S/1,500.00 which she will repay in six months, she will buy a variety of staple goods like: cases of soap, sacks of rice, sugar, various vegetable stews, packets of toilet paper, canned fish, cases of fruit, and liters of oil. In addition, she will buy sacks of flour, kilos of raisins and candied fruit, eggs, yeast, cases of milk, drinks of various brands and sizes. She wants to supply her business well, so that her customers can find what they are looking for.

Amelia is 53 years old and has seven children: a boy and six girls. At this time she is only in charge of two children who help her with the business and household tasks. She is content because she also has the support of her husband, and because above all she is in her home and doesn't have to travel from one place to the other.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Amelia Córdova de Gràndez, socia del banco comunal “Flor del Maní” es natural de la provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Soritor, ella es una persona muy trabajadora , se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, panes y rosquitas de almidón que ella prepara, le gusta esta actividad porque tiene contacto con las pesona, su bodega esta ubicado en su propia casa en el jr. Ramón Castilla No 1507 del distrito y provincia de Soritor, departamento de San Martín.

Con el crédito de S/. 1 500.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como: cajas de jabón , sacos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros, además comprará moldes para panteón, harina en sacos, pasa y frutas confitadas en kilos, esencias, huevos en javas, levadura, leche e cajas, bebidas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, quiere surtir bien su negocio, por que quiere que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Tiene 53 años y 7 hijos un varón y 6 mujeres, ahora solo tiene dos a su cargo quienes le apoyan en las actividades de la casa y del negocio, esta contenta por que también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sobre todo por que esta en su casa no tiene que estar trasladándose de un lugar a otro.

loans.use:
A loan that will invest in the purchase of products for her grocery store

El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de productos para su bodega

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni has been working in the agricultural field for many years in order to help with the household expenses and assist her beloved husband, who fulfills his duties with honor. She grows corn, potatoes, and other vegetables. She is awaiting the harvest with the noble hope of yielding greater profits with the sale of her produce this year. With the aim of improving the quality of her crops, she would like to purchase more manure and organic fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

YENI, se dedica desde hace mucho a la labor agrícola para servir de apoyo y sustento monetario a su hogar y a la actividad que desempeña dignamente su querido esposo.Siembra maíz, papa y demás vegetales, está en espera de la cosecha y tiene el noble deseo de obtener mejores ganancias con la venta de sus productos este año; para tal fin desea incrementar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes naturales con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Eourn Long Group

texts.en: Mrs. Eourn L. lives in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 42 and a basket and mat seller in the village. She is the group leader in a group of six members. She is married to Mr. Sareourn Kheav, who is a construction foreman, and they have two children, one of whom is working in garment factory while the other is attending the local school. To support her family needs, Mrs. Eourn L. is trying to find a good way to improve her business. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy raw materials and start making her own baskets to sell. The man in the picture is Mrs. Eourn L.'s husband, since she wasn't available at the time that the picture was taken.

loans.use: These women would like to buy raw materials to start making baskets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines for her small business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan U., 47, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. She works as a city cleaner and can earn up to $3/day. Her husband, Brak Va, is a motorbike mechanic and earns around $5/day. The couple has three children, one of whom is married. One of the children also works as a city cleaner like her mother.

Mrs. Phan is applying for a loan of $500 in order to purchase a trailer for her family. She would like to use a trailer as a taxi to transport workers in the city. She believes that this additional business will greatly help to further support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
This group was formed over a year ago and is in the third round of funding by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (“Women Entrepreneurs Committee”) programme that has established the Fundación Paraguaya. Members are based in the Reducto neighbourhood of the city of San Lorenzo and are engaged in a variety of activities such as selling clothes, food, and natural remedies, either from home or door to door. The group is a stable group and there is solidarity and co-operation amongst its members. They ensure repayments are made on time and whenever a member becomes ill, others, through fundraising activities, come to her assistance. They have managed to save around $250, which they have invested in a local co-operative.

This latest round of financing is a testimony to the women’s strong desire to improve their economic conditions and self-esteem through performing key activities and mutual assistance. This is an important process leading to the strengthening of the bonds within Paraguayan families.

In accordance with the business activities of members, this loan is to purchase meat, cheese, vegetables, children and adult clothes, ice cream, soft drinks and beer. They also wish to diversify into mail-order business selling cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité LA ESPERANZA se formó hace ya más de un año, son un grupo que esta en el tercer ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas son vecinas del barrio llamado Reducto en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.

Las señoras se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades entre ellas algunas tienen su negocio en su casa como despensas, las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios naturales y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.

Como grupo es un comité estable y responsable que paga sus cuotas con puntualidad y dentro del grupo son solidarias y trabajadoras, ellas ya poseen un ahorro de G.1.070.000, que lo depositan en una Cooperativa de la zona. Además realizan actividades en conjunto como rifas y venta de comidas típicas para lograr un fondo de caja de auxilio para casos en que alguien se enferme, o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

En este ciclo se nota la dedicación de las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo de su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo. Y un punto muy importante el fortalecimiento de los hogares paraguayos.

De acuerdo a las actividades de las señoras destinarán los fondos del crédito para la compra de mercaderías; en caso de las que poseen despensas compra de carne, queso, verduras. En el caso de las vendedoras de ropas comprarán ropas para adultos y niños, también en el caso de las señoras de venta de comida pretenden invertir en otros ramos como venta de productos de cosméticos por catalogo. Además algunas desean comprar helados y bebidas varias como gaseosas, cervezas, jugos, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz was born in 1963. This man is married and has 3 children. Avaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Lachin region in Azerbaijan and has settled in Khirdalan town. Now Avaz needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the  necessary spare parts for repairing cars. He has been in this business for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy the necessary spare parts for repairing cars

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice D. is married and has 6 children. She has received schooling through Basic level. Alice manufactures palm oil for sale in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a corn mill operator.

Alice uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Alice will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest into the business to increase production and sales which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 44 años D. edad, sólo estudió el primer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 03 hijos (02 varones D. 24 y 21 años y 01 mujer D. 18 años D. edad). Vive en el distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 4 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado D. Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300, compró verduras, negocio que se dedica en la actualidad. Doña Celia quedó huérfana D. madre al primer año D. edad y a los 3 años quedó huérfana D. padre. Creció con otras familias, no pudo estudiar porque solo se dedicaba al pastoreo y a los 20 años D. edad tuvo su pareja y empezó a vender verduras. Su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca, ovino, el cual lleva directamente a la ciudad D. Tacna.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 06 degollados D. carne D. alpaca a S/.900, los cuales serán comercializados en la ciudad D. Tacna, también comprará verduras a un valor D. S/.500 para ser vendidos en la feria sabatina D. Conduriri al por mayor y al por menor.

Su sueño es aumentar su capital en el negocio D. carne y que sus hijos estudien y trabajen.
texts.en:
Celia is a 44-year-old who only attended the first graD.. She is a married mother of 3 children—2 sons ages 24 and 21, and 1 daughter age 18. She lives in the Conduriri district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the “Maria Parado D. Bellido” Microfinance Institute in Conduriri for 4 years. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she purchased vegetables, which she currently sells. Ms. Celia lost her mother when she was only a year old, then lost her father at age 3, so she was raised by other families. She was unable to study because she was a sherpedess. At 20 years old, she got married and started to sell vegetables. Her husband buys and sells mutton and alpaca meat, which he takes directly to the city of Tacna. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 6 alpaca carcasses at 900.00 PEN each, which will be sold in the city of Tacna. She will also purchase vegetables at 500.00 PEN each so that she can sell them wholesale and retail in the Saturday market in Conduriri. She dreams of increasing her capital in the meat business, and of her children studying and working.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca meat and vegetables

loans.name: Luganda Kulya Group

texts.en:
Saydah is the Treasurer of the Luganda Kulya Group in Kasangali, a lovely village on the outskirts of Kampala. She’s been a member of this borrowing group for over six years; this is her 19th loan. Saydah is a 52-year old, hard-working single mother of three children. She also cares for her sibling’s four orphans.

Saydah raises broilers (chickens for eating) and layers (chickens for egg production) for wholesale delivery to local restaurants, grocery outlets and butchers. Her current stock is 200 head. In a typical week, she will deliver 12-15 crates of 30 eggs to her customers for 4,500 Ush per crate. She also sells several broilers each week for 4,000 Ush each. She uses broiler sales proceeds to buy more chicks and depends on the income from layers to support her family. Loan proceeds are used to purchase chicken feed in bulk quantities. Saydah prefers to buy quality chicken feed made with maize, fish, cotton and shells to improve the nutrition quality of her products and command a higher price at market.

All of Saydah’s children are in school. She wants to expand her stock to 500 chickens so she can send her children to better schools and provide them with better clothes.

loans.use: Purchase high quality chicken feed in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Nam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Năm 33 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Thời gian đầu  tham gia vào Quỹ chị  Năm  vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Sau 4 năm tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn đang đầu tư vốn để sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị Năm đều tham gia sản xuất và kinh doanh mặt hàng này.  Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Năm đang ngày càng ổn đinh và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho  công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nam Thi N., 33 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. In the beginning Mrs. N. borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and planting trees. After 4 years of participating in the Fund and learning and developing her business skills, today besides the livestock business she also invests in manufacturing and selling funerary goods. Currently she and her husband both contribute to the work in manufacturing and selling these goods everyday. With their average income reaching 5,000,000 VND/month, the family's finances are becoming more stable day by day and is also growing. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to use in the manufacturing and sales business of funerary goods of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for manufacturing

loans.name: Alicia Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Janeth P. B. tiene 37 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Alicia Janeth se dedica a un wawawasi, empezó cuidando algunos  niños, pero poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora tiene muchos  niños a su cargo, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió la construcción del piso y tartajeo de su local.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá  en algunos arreglos de su local y en la construcción de su casa. 
Alicia Janeth tiene el gran sueño de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca mucho más.
texts.en:
Alicia Janeth P. B. is 37 years old; she finished secondary school, and has dependent 2 children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Alicia Janeth runs a Wawa Wasi (children’s daycare center). She started taking care of a few children, but after some time, she managed to take work with many children. She runs this business at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to finish the floor of her business facilities and to pay the workers. With this $250 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will perform more improvements to her business and home. Alicia Janeth’s dream is to see her children become professionals and also to make her Business grow even further.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her business and home.

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
P., 46, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979.  She grows different kinds of crops like rice, vegetables and some fruit trees. 

She is a good mother of four children: two are students and the other two are helping with their parents' work.  She is married to Nhang, age 45, who also sells firewood that depends on carving from the forest.  

In view of the fact that crop growing is P.'s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to help her meet the hard physical labor demands of cultivating, P. is applying for a loan to buy water buffalo to use for plowing the fields. 

(P.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy water buffalo to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma J. N. is a perfumes and chips (french fries) seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She's been a seller for 5 years. She belongs to Wapendanao group loan (Group code 2008).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more perfumes and Irish potatoes for her business and to open a kiosk. She is hoping with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Fatma is 41 years old, divorced with a 3 year old.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes, irish potatoes and to open kiosk.

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah manages a rolling store business, selling fish and chicken. She also buys and sells used clothes in her neighborhood. She usually roams around the village to sell fish, chicken and second-hand clothes. Her products are very salable in their village and for this she wanted to develop and expand her business in the market somehow. She believes that availing herself of a loan of PHP10,000.00 as additional capital will be of great help in her business and to her family. Devorah patiently maintains it since it is a great source of her family income.

Devorah is 37 and married to Jaime, a retired policeman. They were blessed with three children: April Imee, who is 10 and in grade four; Princess Sarah, who is 6 years old and a preschool student this coming school year; and Jaimelyn, who is 18 months old. The family is currently residing in the large village of Research, Minante, Cauayan City. Devorah is a mother who wants the best for her children and she is fulfilling these dreams through patience and hard work.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Married with five children, Hilda is requesting a loan of about $175 to help her with her crop cultivation and goat rearing business. To cultivate her crops, it costs Hilda $110, and to purchase a goat and piglet, it is $33 each.  Hilda believes her business will continue to do well because she has all the necessary requirements: the land for the crops and the grass for her goat to feed on.  

Hilda’s business of farming and goat rearing helps her neighbors because she now provides manure and cassava.  In addition, by hiring the needed labor for her farm, she is helping strengthen her community. 

In the past, Hilda has faced some adversity in her life: health issues, lack of capital for her business to grow, and the inability to pay for providing educational opportunities for her five children. In fact, because of past illness problems, Hilda lost her left arm.  However, with this loan from Kiva lenders, Hilda remains positive and can use the profit to further her children’s education, to construct a bigger house and to purchase some much-needed housewares for her family.

Since January of 2008, Hilda has been a GHAPE member, and says that she has benefited from the easy repayment plans as well as the various training the organization provides.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To cultivate her crops and to purchase a goat and piglet

loans.name: Akeem

texts.en: Akeem is thirty-five years old and married with three children. He sells sarongs of various colors to his customers. He is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ahmatali

texts.ru: Ахматали - мужчина 33 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка.Живёт и работает в отдалёном районе Уткансой кишлаке Хамробод.Он имеет высшее образование.И сейчас по своей специальности работает учителем в районной школе для начальных классов. Но как всем известно , что зарплата учителей очень низкая Ахматали имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса откорма и продажи скота.Ахматали хочет получив повторный кредит купить корм для своих коров и увеличить численность голов скота.
texts.en:
Ahmatali is a 33 year old man, he is married and has one child. He lives and works in the remote region of Utkansoi in the Khamrobod kishlak (village). He has a high education and now works by his profession as a teacher in the regional elementary school. But as everyone knows a teacher's salary is very low. Ahmatali has an additional income from his animal husbandry business. Ahmatali wants to receive a repeat loan and buy fodder for the cows and increase the head count of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Lamini

texts.en: Lamini G. is a widow with two children. She has no formal education.  Lamini is a trader who sells second-hand clothing as a hawker, which she has done for 4 years.  Lamini uses her income to pay for feeding and clothing her family.  Lamini will use the loan to buy more second-hand clothing to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Lamini plans to put the profit into savings and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kurbonboi

texts.ru: Курбонбой – молодой мужчина 1978 года рождения. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Занимается продажей солнечных очков на втором этаже рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, магазин № 222. Его жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детей. Курбонбой привозит товар из города Бишкека Республики Киргизии. Он ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Курбонбой планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию декоративных искусственных цветов и некоторых видов хозтоваров. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления его планов.
texts.en:
Kurbonboi is a young man, who was born in 1978. He's married and the father of two children. He earns his living selling sunglasses from Store No. 222 on the second floor of the Panchshanbe market in Khujand. His wife is a housewife and looks after their young children. He goes once a month to Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic to get his merchandise. Kurbonboi plans to expand his business by buying a stock of artificial flowers and a variety of housewares, so he is requesting a loan to achieve his goals.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy housewares and artificial flowers

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz S. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and married with three adult children. To earn a living, Paz cultivates a plot of land. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. She has been in the business for over 5 years and she earns approximately 8750 PHP per month. In 2008, Paz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her business and living situation. This will be her fourth loan. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP. She is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers. She hopes to use any increase in revenue to improve her family’s living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кодирова Рано 1968 года рождения, замужем мать троих детей. Рано 22 лет занимается национальной вышивкой, она вышивает на платьях  золотыми нитями разные виды цветов, что придает платью красивый, нарядный вид. Так же у неё много учеников, которых она учит вышивать. Эти наряды пользуются большим спросом у женщин нашего менталитета . На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить разноцветные нити и благодарит кредиторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Rano K. is married and is a mother of three children. Rano has been doing traditional embroidery for 22 years. Using gold thread, she embroiders various types of flowers on dresses, which gives dresses beautiful and elegant looks. Rano also has many apprentices, whom she teaches embroidery. The outfits are in high demand among women in our culture. Rano wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase colorful threads and thanks creditors for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of colorful threads

loans.name: Aïtchatou

texts.fr: Aïtchatou est née vers 1950 à Pobè dans le Département de l'Ouémé, au Sud du Bénin.  Aïtchatou n’est jamais allée à l’école. Dès son jeune âge, Aïtchatou aida sa mère dans la vente des produits vivriers. Après son mariage, Aïtchatou s'est mise à son propre compte, mais pour vendre des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.).  Aïtchatou vit à Cotonou,  Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin et est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé. Aïtchatou sollicite ce crédit-ci pour augmenter le volume de son activité qui connait depuis quelque temps un problème de stagnation.
texts.en:
Aïtchatou was born around 1950 in Pobè in Ouémé county, in southern Benin. She never went to school. From a young age, she helped her mother with selling staple goods. After her marriage, Aïtchatou started off on her own, though with selling sundry items: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardine, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc. She lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin and is on her fifth loan with ALIDé. She is requesting this loan to increase the volume of her business, which has been experiencing a problem with stagnation for quite awhile.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned milk, sardines, and tomatoes;  sugar, soaps, and school supplies

loans.name: Ardimdin Group

texts.en:
These people are Abu K., Aminata K., Hassan K., Fatmata S., and Aminata T.. They named their group Ardimdin. They are small-scale businesspeople and also farmers in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni. They are each requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to help them expand their businesses.

Abu K. is the leader of this group. Abu was born in Masorie village about twenty-six years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the two of them have two children, two and four years old. Abu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassava, potatoes, and any other vegetables he can lay hands on. He buys in Masorie and the surrounding villages and sells in Freetown. In Freetown, he would buy items like rice, sugar, flour, “Maggi” (used in making sauces) and these he sells in Masorie village. Abu has been in business for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jeniva's Group

texts.en:
Jeniva K. is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 40 years old and married with 8 children, aged 23 years to 8 months, all of whom are in secondary and primary schools (except one who is still young). She is a business lady involved in the sale of produce in Omukabare Katerera in Bushenyi. Before running this business, she used to sell tea at the road side; she had to change in order to make more earnings.

She has mainly sold her produce to traders from Kampala for 11 years now and she is able to make profits of approximately 150,000 UGX a month, which helps her to pay for her children’s education. She hopes to work hard so that she can own a large amount of stock that she can sell to large markets in Kampala directly. At the moment, Jeniva needs a loan to help buy agricultural produce for resale since part of the profits derived from her business help to pay off laborers. She is indeed a friendly and kind lady and this has won her customers in such a competitive business.

loans.use: Buying agricultural produce for resale.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn P. started her rice farming business in 2001 in Surallah, South Cotabato.  She’s 29 years old, married, and has 2 children, the eldest of whom is 5 years old.  She owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field and 1 sow. These give her enough income to buy her family food, clothing and other basic necessities.

She applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  She needs the loan to buy farm supplies and to pay for the hand tractor she uses. This will help her to sustain her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Bravo Plus Group

texts.fr: Annie M. 41 ans, est une femme qui est dans la micro-entreprise depuis 1996. Elle a acquit une solide expérience dans ce domaine qui lui permet de bien gérer son activité. Elle vend de haricots et de l’huile de palme et végétale dans un quartier montagneux situé à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Annie est cliente fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC qui lui a déjà prêté 4 fois les crédits qu’elle a remboursés correctement. C’est grâce à ces crédits que son affaire a prospéré. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant de haricots dans le but d’accroitre son capital et répondre au besoin de ses clients. Annie est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 4 et 18 ans. Quatre d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Annie M. is 41 years old. She has been a small-business woman since 1996. She has acquired some solid experience in the field and she is able to manage her business well. She sells beans and plam and vegetable oils in a mountainous district located west of Kinshasa. Annie is a loyal client of IMF Hope RDC (Kiva Field Partner), and the organisation has already disbursed 4 loans in the past, all of which she has repaid on time. Her business has prospered thanks to these loans. Her next loan will be used to resupply her stocks of merchandise, especially with the purchase of beans. Her goal is to increase her revenues and to meet client demands. Annie is married and she is the mother of 5 children, they are aged between 4 and 18 years of age. Four of her kids are going to school.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To resupply her stock of merchandise, to purchase a sack of beans.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en: Jovie E. is from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jovie owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Jovie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jovie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en: Paterna A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is school-aged. Paterna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting root crops and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 1,400 PHP. In 2007, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizer like manure. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield and fertilizer like manure

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Maria Lucila T. tiene 73 años de edad, es madre soltera con 7 hijos, todos adultos, vive con 3 nietos y desde hace 17 años tiene una pulpería que le permite mantener a sus 3 nietos ya que su madre viajo a Costa Rica en búsqueda de trabajo, sin embargo el dinero que le envía no es suficiente para la manutención de sus hijos por lo que doña Maria Lucila tiene que atender su negocio para poder mantener a sus nietos y a ella misma.

Esta pulpería le ha permitido poder tener el sustento diario, esta microempresaria ya fue beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de kiva, el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma y del cual se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas por ese apoyo. Esta señora no puede leer ni escribir sin embargo es ayudada por sus nietos en el negocio.

Esta microempresaria esta solicitando se le preste para comprar los siguientes productos: 2 quintales de Arroz americano, cada quintal le cuesta US 40 dólares,1 quintal de  frijoles que lo compra a US 40 dólares, 90 libras de  carne de res a US 1.30 dólares cada libra, 100 libras de carne de pollo a US 1.45 dólares cada libra, 2 quintales de azúcar a US 30.50 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de harina a US  40 dólares cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US  35 dólares  cada bidón, 2 cajas de leche la Lechera a US 40 dólares cada caja y  3 cajillas de huevos a US 9 dólares cada cajilla.
texts.en:
Maria Lucila T., 73, is a single mother of 7 adult children. Three grandchildren live with her and she has had a small grocery store for the last 17 years which allows her to support her three grandchildren since their mother went to Costa Rica to work. However, the money she sends home isn't sufficient to support her children so Maria Lucila has to tend to her store to support herself and her grandchildren. The store has produced enough for her daily support. She has already benefitted from a previous Kiva loan which she repaid on time; she is grateful to the lenders for this help. She can neither read nor write but her grandchildren help her out in the store. She is requesting funding to buy the following products: 2 quintales of American rice (a quintal is a weight measurement equivalent to 46 kilograms) at 40 US dollars each, 1 quintal of beans at 40 dollars US each, 90 pounds of beef at 1.30 dollars US each, 100 pounds of chicken at 1.45 US dollars each, 2 quintales of sugar at 30.50 dollars US each, 2 quintales of flour at 40 dollars US each, 2 bidones (a large jar) of oil at 35 dollars US each, 2 cases of La Lechera evaporated milk at 40 dollars US each, and 3 cases of eggs at 9 dollars US each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American rice, beans, beef, chicken, sugar, flour, oil. La Lechera condensed milk, eggs.

loans.name: Domingo Rolando

texts.es: Domingo Rolando es un hombre trabajador, su actividad económica es una miscelánea, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que el inicio con muy poco capital pues no tenía los suficientes recursos, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado mejorar sus productos y así ha mejorado cada día, junto a su esposa han  mejorado la administración de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para ropa en general, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, calzado y lo más importante granos básicos ya que en temporada navideña recibe muchos pedidos. Sus deseos son de ampliar con mucho más productos.
texts.en:
Domingo Rolando is a hard-working man. He has been selling sundries for over 14 years. He started this business with very little capital because he did not have sufficient resources. With the help of loans, he has been able to improve his products. That is how he has improved every day; he and his wife have improved the administration of the business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy general clothing, sweets, refreshments, soft drinks, footwear, and most importantly, basic grains. He receives lots of orders during the Christmas seasons. His wish is to expand with many more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Otilia Cecilia

texts.es:
Otilia R., vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos, su esposo es albañil tiene 2 hijas una estudia ya en la Universidad y la otra esta en el colegio.

Otilia comenzó hace 10 años atrás remendando ropa con una maquina que le regalo su papa, ahora ella trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 23h30 cuando no tiene mucho trabajo de costura Otilia sale a vender ropa de catalogo, una de las dificultades del trabajo es cuando los clientes le incumplen con los pagos por lo que ella deja a crédito la ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, sabanas, telas para agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere estudiar diseño para poder crear su propia línea de ropa y poder así tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Otilia R. lives in an area on the outskirts of the city in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made out of concrete and has water and electricity service. Her husband is a bricklayer and they have two daughters. One is studying at the university and the other is in high school. Otilia started mending clothes 10 years ago with a sewing machine that her dad gave her. Now she works from 10am to 11:30pm. When she doesn't have a lot of sewing work, Otilia sells clothing from a catalog. One of the difficulties with her work is when her customers can't pay on time and she needs to give them credit. With the loan, she wants to buy clothing, sheets and fabrics to increase her business. In the future she wants to study design to be able to create her own clothing line and have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, sheets

loans.name: Lilian Elsa Beatriz

texts.es: Lilian Elsa Beatriz V. A. de 23 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad en su casa de habitación, la cual tiene 3 años de poseerla. Lilian es una joven muy trabajadora quien se dedica por completo a sus dos hijas y quien a su corta edad conoce la responsabilidad de sostener a dos hijas por si misma. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz y sodas, productos que son mucho más solicitados en la tienda y que generan mayores ganancias. Para Lilian es necesario surtir la tienda, debido a que es esta la manera en la cual podrá obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
Lilian Elso Beatriz V. A. is 23 and lives with her two children, 5 and 2, in the Department of San Salvador. Out of necessity, she has a store selling perishables in her home. Lilian is a very hard-working young woman who dedicates herself completely to her two daughters. From her young age she has known the responsibility of supporting her children on her own. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy beans, sugar, rice and sodas; items that are more popular in her store and earn her better profit. For Lilian it is necessary to stock her store well, because this is the way she can have higher income and offer a better quality of life to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and soda

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.ru: Сангов Курбоназар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сангов Курбоназар животноводством занимается более 12 лет. Он одновременно занимается растениеводством. Сангов Курбоназар откармливает и продает скот. Он сажает разные полезные растения для кормления скота. Целью кредита является закуп скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonazar S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 49 years old, married, with four children. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than twelve years. Additionally, he grows crops. Kurbonazar S. raises and sells cattle, and also cultivates various crops to feed his livestock. The goal of the loan is to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Balinaki Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Mirabu B. P. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard-working and friendly lady, married with seven children aged 20 to 4 years. She takes care of six orphans. 

B. is a business woman who sells textiles (clothes) at various markets. Her biggest challenges are the debtors who often take a long time to pay, and the transportation costs to the markets of Lukolo, Mutai, Kakira, Namulesa, and Budondo where she sells her textiles. 

B. is grateful to her loan facility because it enables her to stock a variety of items and charge fair prices to her customers. B. hopes to someday have a stall where she can sell her clothes instead of moving them to all these markets. She also wants her children to have a university education. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for resale so that she can make more profits and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking, responsible and affectionate woman. She is married with five children. Her children are excelling in school. Esther is 4o years old. She sells lumber to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to be a major lumber distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more lumber to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcato Tora Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del  banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora son damas emprendedoras, trabajadoras que a pesar de los inconvenientes encontrados en el día a día buscan la manera de surfear estos inconvenientes  y salir adelante junto a sus familias, este banco se localiza en la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad Chilcato Tora de ahí el nombre de su banco comunal, este sector se caracteriza por tener unos hermosos paisajes andinos llenos de vegetación propia de la zona,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 

Gloria se casó muy joven a sus 20 años ya tiene un niño de tres años, su esposo trabaja como empastador de paredes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá de manera independiente.

Nuestra socia se dedica a criar animales como  chanchos, gallinas, vacas,  tanto para la venta como para el consumo en  su casa, la leche que producen sus vacas si es exclusivo para el consumo de su familia y los animales los vende  a sus vecinos de la comunidad para solventar algún apuro económico. 

Gloria es una joven muy alegre y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras  de su banco comunal del que forma parte desde hace dos ciclos, con el crédito solicitado va a  comprar   pollos, vitaminas y alimento para criarlos y venderlos. Tiene como máximo  sueño construir su casa propia.

Carmen C. tiene 60 años enviudó  hace 29 años porque un auto atropello a su esposo, además perdió un hijo de los siete que concibió, sus tres hijos mayores son casados  y sólo vive en su casa propia  con sus otros tres hijos  que aun son solteros y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar.

Carmen se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos, vacas, la  leche de sus vacas a veces entrega al carro lechero o  lo deja para el consumo de su hogar, sus animales son vendidos en la comunidad, nos comenta que lleva once años en esta difícil labor que aprendió de sus padres y gracias a ello ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Nuestra socia  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y con el préstamo que realiza va a comprar pollos y alimento para seguir con su negocio. Su meta es llegar  a construir un galpón para incrementar su criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Chilcato Tora" [Women of Chilcato Tora] are enterprising and hard-working despite the daily inconveniences they face. They are always looking for a way to work through these issues and get ahead along with their families. This bank is located in the city of Cuenca, in a community called Chilcato Tora, hence the bank's name. This area is characterized by beautiful Andean landscapes with native vegetation. The people who live there work in agriculture and cattle raising. Gloria got married young, and now at age 20 she has a three-year-old son. Her husband works patching walls. They don't have their own house and so they live with her husband's mother although they are financially independent. Gloria works raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and cows, both for sale and for her own family's use. The milk produced by her cows is only for the family's use, and she sells her animals to the people in her community in order to be able to cover any unexpected expenses. Gloria is a happy young woman and she enjoys a friendly relationship with all of the other members of her communal bank. She has been working with the bank for two loan cycles. With this loan she wants to buy chickens, and vitamins and feed to raise and sell them. Her greatest dream is to be able to build her own house. Carmen C. is 60 years old and was widowed 29 years ago when her husband was hit by a car. She also lost one child of the seven that she carried.
