Her three oldest children are married and the other three, who are single, live with her in the house she owns. They help her out in paying the household expenses. Carmen also works raising chickens, pigs and cows. She either sells the milk she gets from her cows to a delivery truck or uses it at home. She sells her animals in the neighboring community. She has told us that she's been doing this hard work for eleven years and that she learned it from her parents. Her work has helped to allow her children to get ahead in life. Carmen is in her second loan cycle and with this loan she will buy chickens and feed in order to continue with her work. Her goal is to build a warehouse in order to expand her chicken raising operation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. de 41 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. María posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se dedica a elaborarlas, este negocio le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, ya que es María la única persona que trabaja,  por esta razón solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor, de manera que lo obtenga a menor precios, así mismo comprar tambos de gas, para tener una pequeña provisión de este, ya que en ciertas ocasiones el gas propano escasea y sube de precio, lo que significa muchas perdidas para ella. María desea poder mejorar sus ventas, atendiendo mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera contar con la estabilidad económica tan deseada por ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
María Isabel R. is 41 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 18 year old son who is going to school. María sells and makes tortillas. This business allows her to have everything necessary for her home, since María is the only person that works. She is seeking a loan through Integral (Kiva’s field partner) so that she can have the necessary amount of money to buy corn wholesale to have a lower price in the raw product, as well to buy additional tanks of propane gas to have a small supply of it since it sometimes becomes scarce and the price rises which means a great loss in profits. María wishes to improve her sales by serving a greater quantity of customers so that she can have greater economic stability so wished by her and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks [for resale]

loans.name: La Perla Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Perla está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes se dedican a la agricultura. El coordinador del grupo es Denis Gómez quien desde hace doce años trabaja en la agricultura con la ayuda de sus hijos e invertirán el crédito en insumos para progresar. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Lucrecia S. quien desde pequeña aprendió a amar la tierra y trabajar en ella  ya que sus padres tenían una pequeña finca y Juana Baldivia desde hace cinco años cultiva. Ellos invertirán en el cultivo aprovechando el invierno.
texts.en:
The La Perla group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people who put forth great effort in their agricultural work. Denis Gómez is the coordinator of the group. He has worked in agriculture, with the help of his children, for 12 years. He will invest the loan in supplies in order to progress. Lucrecia S., a colleague in the group, learned to love and work the earth when she was little. Her parents had a small farm. Juana Baldivia, the other colleague, has been a farmer for five years. They will invest in the crops, taking advantage of the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies like fertilizer and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Progressive Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
38-year-old S. Joseph is a hard-grinding go-getter and father of three. He is now well-posted, in terms of experience, in his ten-year-old retail and boda-boda businesses (local commercial motorcycle transportation) which he concurrently operates in Terere, Mukono.

For the most part, it's Joseph’s retail business which has given him the financial ways and means to cater for all his children’s education and also to improve his family's welfare. The odds of future success in his retail enterprise have been rising in every passing year, ever since he took root. His enterprise and experience have both been playing in his favor.

At present, Joseph’s weekly generated profits are 100,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to revamp his shop with an array of new retail merchandise and he also wants to improve his bod-boda business. Joseph also says that he gets additional revenue from fishing and he is happy about it.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his shop like sugar, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Karn

texts.en: Karn R., 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces rice wine and raises pigs for an income of USD 1.6 per day. Her husband is employed to produce cement tables and chairs, earning an income of USD 4.6 per day.  R. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more rice to produce rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy rice to produce rice wine

loans.name: Pape Mass

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape Mass F. habite a la cite sones, une cite  située  non loin de la localité de Baye Laye a Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse depuis février  2010. Il pratique l’activité de maçon. Mais il vend en même  temps des briques et des produits alimentaires. Il loue aussi des bois de coffrage et des futs pour eau. C’est un chef de famille qui doit gagner sa vie et gérer  une famille et c’est la raison pour laquelle il cumule toutes ces activités. Il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de briques prévues  pour la vente. Son objectif étant  de maximiser ses gains, ceci lui permettra de mieux gérer  les besoins de sa famille et constituer une épargne   pour gérer  les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mr. Pape Mass F. lives in the Sones neighborhood, a neighborhood situated not far from the Baye Laye district, a part of Guediawaye. He is a member of the bank since February, 2010. He is a mason by trade. But, at the same time, he sells bricks and food products. He also rents out timber formwork and drums for water. He is the head of a family who must earn his keep and manage his family's needs, and that is why he has so many different business activities. He has taken out a loan of 200,000 Francs to enhance his stock of bricks in order to sell them. His objective is to maximize his profits, which will allow him to better meet his family's needs and save for unexpected needs that may arise.

Translated from French by Kathy Guis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Bendiya  6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya 6 est constitué de six femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et qui  vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le gombo, le dah,  le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de dah.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32500FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The Bendiya 6 group is made up of six married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, which is the second adminstrative region of Mali. They are participating with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their business activities for the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include peanuts, okra, hibiscus, millet, and corn. They are on their fifth farming loan, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Fatouma D. plans to buy fertilizer before prices go up, small equipment, and to pay the plowing costs for maintaining about 1 hectare of peanuts and hibiscus. The crops are sold in the city of Dioïla and in Fana after harvest, to a customer base of both men and women. The group expects to make an average profit of 32500FCFA per planting season.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, sowing, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small tools and equipment

loans.name: Mrs. Soeng Ket Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people who live in Trapeang Chhuk village, in Takeo province, are taking a village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for varied goals towards improvement of their businesses. Mrs. Soeng K., who was born in 1948, is a village bank president who was selected by the other members. She is a Khmer cake seller and she is also a pig breeder. Since all her businesses are going well, she wants to improve them. To increase her current income, Mrs. Soeng K. is seeking a loan to buy more Khmer cakes to resell. With the rest of the loan, she will purchase more piglets for breeding. She is a widow with two children: one is a driver, the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy Khmer cakes to resell

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues d'un même quartier. Elles ont monté leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame DEMBA DAME S. debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse d'encens et de parfums. C'est elle même qui fabrique ses encens et fait ses cocktails de parfums. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 07 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des produits pour la fabrique de ses encens et de ses parfums

Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007. It is made up of 11 women from the same neighborhood, who are neighbors and/or friends. Mrs. Demba Dame S., who is on the extreme left of the photo, is in charge of the group. She is 50 years old, married and mother to six children. She sells incense and perfumes. She makes the incense and perfume cocktails herself and has been doing this for seven years. Her new loan will allow her to buy products in order to make up her incense and perfumes. Her aim is to help her husband take care of the family and boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase incense and perfumes

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer Y. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Matambok, Brgy. Mandalupang, Manjuyod, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and an Easy Ride Operator (transportation) business. Her husband Jimuel Y., who is 37 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 5 and 8 years old. 

Jennifer joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jennifer has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing  19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Jennifer Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maylinda owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Maylinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Maylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Maylinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Maylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: George  Kamau

texts.en:
George Kamau  M.   is 43 years old, married to Leah Wakarima who is a business lady, and they have two children aged 12 and seven years. George operates a little retail shop in South Kariobangi, an urban setting where most of his customers are low-income earners and few middle-income earners. He has been in this business for about seven years, with a monthly income of Kshs.25,000.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. George is applying for second loan of Kshs. 50,000 with which he intends to add more stock worth Kshs.15,000, and open another shop that will cost him Kshs.35,000. In that way he can be in a position to serve his customers effectively.

He hopes to save the anticipated profit and later venture into spare parts sales and see his children get a better education and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to add Kshs.15,000 worth of stock and open another shop for Kshs.35,000

loans.name: Plasidia

texts.en: K. Plasidia, aged 34, has maintained a banana plantation, alongside her teaching profession, for more than eight years in Kituriba, Rukungiri. Hard working and dependable, she makes an average of 100,000 Ugandan shillings a month from banana sales, which is not enough to sustain her extended family. Plasidia has persevered to keep the enterprise growing, and her aim with this loan is to buy mulch and manure for the plantation. She wants to expand into bigger markets, increase productivity, earn more revenue, and be able to live a better life and educate all her children.

loans.use: purchase manure and mulch

loans.name: Susan Tapapul

texts.en: Susan Tapapul E. is 39 years old and lives in the Magwara section of Kilgoris town. She is married to David, who works as a farmer. The couple has eight children. Susan is applying for a loan to rent a piece of land where she can do her farming, and also to buy seeds to plant her crop. This is her first loan from Kadet Ltd, which she found out about through a friend. She intends to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her farm. Her dream is to see her business grow to the point where she can own a piece of land and do large scale farming.

loans.use: Rent a piece of land to farm and buy seedlings

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa C. est mariée mère de 5 enfants, âgée de 46 ans, elle est polygame et vit avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala.  
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, Awa n’a pas pris du temps pour s’accrocher aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman depuis son jeune âge et l’exerce pour elle-même il y a plus de 20 ans. Son activité principale est la vente des  chaussures, sacs et autres, elle est coiffeuse  et très bien sollicitée par les femmes de la ville de Koutiala. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  et satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité et en quantité, Awa a fait recourt à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Elle est à son troisième  prêt individuel  et les deux précédents a été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter,  70 paires de chaussures  et 25 sacs. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako  et effectue sa vente dans la  ville de Koutiala et dans son salon de coiffure à une clientèle composée  de jeunes filles et des femmes mariées  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 175.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro  satisfaire ses besoins entretenir ses enfants  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs Awa C. is a married mother of five children and is 46 years old. She is polygamous and lives with her husband, her co-wive and their children in the neighborhood of Hamdallaye of the city of Koutiala.

Since Awa lacked the opportunity to complete elementary school, she didn't waste time and at a young age entered upon an income generating activity with her mother. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Her main activity is selling shoes, handbags and similar items. She is also a hairdresser and her services are in great demand from the women of Koutiala.

In order to increase her working capital and meet the quality and quantity demands from her clientele, Awa came to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is her third individual loan, after having properly repaid her previous two loans.

She wants to use this loan to buy 70 pairs of shoes and 25 handbags. She gets her supplies in Bamako and retails them in Koutiala and in her beauty salon. Her customers are girls and married women who pay cash or buy on credit.

Thanks to her larger working capital, Awa expects to make a monthly profit of 175,000 CFA francs. She will use it to pay the installments of her loan, provide for herself and her children, and invest any money left over in her business.

loans.use: To buy shoes and handbags

loans.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria Narcisa S. R. tiene 47 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Gloria Narcisco S. R. is 47 years old. She lives in Uníon Libra in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos with her partner and three children.

The members of V.R.V La Union (the Union Community Bank) are located in the Aguas Frías area, in the district of Ventanas. They pursue short-cycle agricultural work, growing corn, rice, and beans. They spend a lot of time doing this activity.

Gloria has worked in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans, for 15 years. She buys her supplies in Ventana and sells them in the Ventanas market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The support from this loan will help her financially to supply the necessary goods. She faces obstacles including plagues, illnesses, and variation in the climate. Her dream is to buy land. She enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Poline is a dairy farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. She has been farming for 18 years now and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of coffee which she sells to the local market.

Poline is 43 years old and a widowed mother of two children aged 17 and 22 who both attend school.

She has requested this loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. The extra income from this loan will help her pay for the education of her children. Her major challenge has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. She hopes that her milk production will increase in the future since she hopes to acquire more dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Monicah  Wanjiku

texts.en:
Monicah Wanjiku has been selling timber as her primary business. She also has a butcher shop in Githurai and earns a profit margin of Kshs.27,617 per month. She is married to Fredrick and together they have three children aged between 9 and 18 years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a friend. She plans to use the loan as follows: buy timber worth Kshs.50,000 and use Kshs.30,000 to buy more meat to sell at the butcher shop.

She will use the anticipated profit to re-invest in the businesses, so she will have enough stock to sell to her customers. In the future she hopes to grow her businesses and open another branch of the timber yard.  In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Khudoikul

texts.en:
Khudoikul T. is 54 years old, married and has four children of school age. Khudoikul crafts Tajikistan’s traditional cradles. The cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful and made of wood. As a rule, this traditional cradle is presented by the grandparents when the baby is forty days old, and this event is celebrated in the family circle.

Khudoikul has been in this business for thirty years. His wife and children help him. He sells the cradles out of his home. The business stability ensures a steady income and the family’s possibility to improve their living conditions.

Khudoikul has been working with IMON for two years. For the entire period of time he has shown himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Khudoikul requests a loan in the amount of 7500 TJS in order to purchase the planks and paint for producing the cradles. Since Khudoikul has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word, we are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase planks and paint

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El Senor Luis Enrique G., habita en la ciudad de Esteli, tiene 41 anos de edad, casado, y solamente tiene un hijo. Con mucho sacrificio se intereso en estudiar un poco mas y logro llegar hasta II ano de Secundaria; 
Desde hace unos 15 anos, a traves del INATEC, estudio un curso de Fontaneria; luego consigui un trabajo en ENACAL (Empresa Nacional de Acueductos y Alcantarillados), y trabajo por 10 anos; poco a poco fue recogiendo un poco de dinero y logro independizarse.
Actualmente trabaja como su propio jefe, independiente y cuenta con una gran clientela, quienes muchos lo conocen desde que el trabajaba en ENACAL.
Solicito este credito, para Capital de trabajo, pues necesita comprar algunas herramientas que le facilitaran su trabajo y mejorara la calidad de el mismo.
Su meta es lograr tener mas personal que trabaje con el y poder tener todas las herramientas necesarias.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique G. lives in the city of Esteli. He is 41 years old and married. He only has one son. With lots of sacrifice, he is interested in studying a little bit more to be able to reach the second year of secondary school.
15 years ago, through INATEC, Luis took a course in plumbing. Later, he was able to get a job at ENACAL (Empresa Nacional de Acueductos y Alcantarillados) (National Company of Aqueducts and Sewers). He worked there for ten years. Little by little, he was able to save money and achieve personal independence.
Now he works as his own boss, independently, and he has a large client base. Many of the clients were met while he worked for ENACAL.
He is requesting this loan for working capital. He needs to buy some tools to help him with his work and improve the quality of his work. 
His goal is to have more people to work with him and to have all the necessary tools for his job.

loans.use: tools for plumbing

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Claudia es socia del banco comunal Vecina Unidas del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, su esposo se desempeña como motocarrista (transportista).
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, principalmente menú y lo hace con ayuda de su hermana.  Esta actividad la realiza solo de lunes a viernes, porque el fin de semana se dedica a su familia, tiene que estar con sus hijos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 ollas grandes, un colador de metal, 1 cuchilla de licuadora, 1 tabla de picar, 2 baldes de 25 litros, 2 doc. De jarras de vidrio de medio litro, 1 balón de gas.
Gracias a su negocio puede solventar parte del gasto de su hogar y  de esa manera ayuda a su esposo y pueden disfrutar tranquilos los fines de semana.
"..gracias a Manuela Ramos, por hacer que las mujeres salgan adelante por si solas".
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 31 years old, married and has two minor children.  Her husband works as a mototaxi driver (transportation).

She sells meals, especially economic meals with help from her sister.  She works at this activity from Monday through Friday because she devotes the weekend to her family; she has to be with her children.

With this 2000 new sol loan she will buy: 3 large pots, a metal colander, a blender blade, a chopping board, two 25-liter buckets, 2 dozen ½-liter glass jars and one tank of gas.

Thanks to the business she is able to cover part of the household expenses and help her husband so that together they can enjoy the weekends in peace.

“Thanks to Manuela Ramos for making women get ahead on their own.

loans.use: She will buy: 3 large pots, a metal colander, a blender blade, a chopping board, two 25 liter buckets, two dozen ½ liter glass jars, and one gas tank.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Standing out and making a difference is hard to do, but Rosita A., 47, is determined to do so. Rosita reached only high school and is married to Joselin, an electrician. Being a community partner of CCT, Rosita applies her learning in entrepreneurship to her business. Together, Joselin and Rosita raise their three children.

Rosita owns a sari-sari (variety) store located near their house. There she outshines other sari-sari stores in the vicinity by providing quality products at an affordable price. She makes sure her stock is fresh and worth every centavo of her customers’ money. Monthly Rosita earns a net income of Php 3,900.

Standing out requires maximum effort, and Rosita needs help to make her business stand out. She decided to borrow Php 24,000 to help her grow her business. With this she will buy more canned goods, noodles, soap, toothpaste and other household essentials. She believes that increasing the quantity of her products will affect the profitability of her store and add up to savings for her. 

A usual problem shared by Rosita with other sari-sari store owners is the difficulty in collecting payments from neighbors who do not pay their bills. Cash flow is very important for Rosita as the store is one main way of financing the studies of her children. That is why Rosita never gives up despite the problems and reaches for her dream of growing her store into a bigger enterprise.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: the replenishment of products

loans.name: Gerino

texts.es: Gerino tiene  59 años, vive con su hija y sus nietos en casa de un familiar. Casi toda su vida se ha desarrollado en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, desde hace 20 años decidió radicar en la ciudad, saliendo de su tierra natal en busca de nuevas oportunidades. Si embargo su esposa falleció hace poco y en la actualidad sigue desarrollando con más intensidad la agricultura ya que arrienda terrenos de cultivo y siembra principalmente maíz, alfalfa y avena, que luego de 6 meses de cuidados esta lista para cosechar y venderlo al por mayor en el mercado de su localidad. Adicionalmente a esto también se dedica a la venta de animales que principalmente son ovejas, siendo los fines de  semana los días de feria ganadera. De esta manera ha logrado tener un capital que le permite mejorar su calidad de su vida y compartirlo con sus nietos es por esta razón que quiere comprar un terreno propio. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y promete ser puntual en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y semilla de alfalfa y avena.
texts.en: Gerino is 59 years old and lives with his daughter and grandchildren in a relative's house. Almost all his life he has worked in agricultural and ranching activites. 20 years ago he decided to settle in the city, leaving his place of birth in search of new opportunities. However, his wife passed away a short time ago and he is currently developing his agricultural activities more intensely. He rents land for cultivating and plants primarily maiz, alfalfa, and oats which after 6 months of care are ready to harvest and sell wholesale at his local market. In addition to this he sells animals, principally sheep, at the weekend livestock market. In this way he has managed to raise the capital which has allowed him to improve his quality of life and share it with his grandchildren. It is for this reason that he wants to buy his own land. This is his second loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support and promises to be punctual with his payments. As well, he is grateful to be a part of his communal bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive people. He thanks those people who will be financers of the loan he is requesting as it will be very useful for the progress of his activity. With this loan he will buy bags of fertilizer and alfalfa and oat seeds.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and alfalfa and oat seeds

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir H. O. is 31 years old, single and does not have any children yet. He owns an auto spares shop serving mostly local car owners. Besides selling spare parts, he is also a mechanic and repairs and services vehicles. His business is located in Jua Kali, Kisumu, at a car yard. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for the production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the lake basin. 

Bashir has been in his business for four years now. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the unavailability of certain spare parts which, if found, are expensive. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and get tenders to service corporate vehicles. He also sees himself having his own family. He describes himself as jovial and understanding.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is 51 years old. She is from the Sijeh area in Kisumu and is a widow. She has two children aged 20 and 26 years old.

Jane has a welding business and has employed people to help her run it. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more steel to add to her stock. Jane will use the profits made for this business to cater for her family's needs and also pay her workers.

She hopes to see her business grow to great heights in the near future.

loans.use: to buy steel to add to her stock

loans.name: Ziyad

texts.en:
Ziyad is a 34-year-old father of two daughters and three sons. Ziyad's sons and daughters are growing up therefore he wants to furnish an empty room in the house for his daughters to use.

Ziyad took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the furniture as he can't afford to buy it all at once  with the salary he earns.

Ziyad is photographed in FATEN's branch in Jabalia refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase house furniture and furnish his daughters' room.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, en un bazar que está ubicado en su casa, ahí vende artículos de paquetería, librería, abarrotes y verduras. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 4 años.
Su mercadería de abarrotes la compra en supermercados mayoristas y lo que es mercadería de paquetería y librería en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que hay mayor variedad de productos y además los encuentra a bajo costo. 
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para su bazar y también comprará materiales de construcción para ampliar su negocio y ubicarlo en el ante jardín de su casa, ya que en la actualidad está ocupando espacio de su comedor.
Sus metas son abastecer su negocio de mercadería, ampliar su infraestructura y comprar una conservadora de alimentos (congeladora).
Sus sueños a nivel personal es poder concretar éstos proyectos para tener una mejor situación socio económica y así vivir más tranquila. 
Mercedes vive junto a su hermana, quien le ayuda en el negocio, mientras espera otro trabajo. 
Mercedes está muy agradecida del apoyo y confianza depositado en ella, por parte de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido una gran ayuda para su vida y negocio. Ella asiste a todas las reuniones grupales del banco comunal, las cuales son muy gratas y los demás socios son muy solidarios.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, ha podido integrar estos aprendizajes de ventas a su propio negocio.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the communal bank "Aurora Boreal", located in the city of Vina del Mar. She is a merchant who has a general store installed in her house. She sells packaging, school supplies, groceries, and vegetables. She has been in business for 4 years.

Her grocery merchandise is purchased from the wholesale markets and she acquires her packaging and school supplies from the city of Santiago where she finds a variety of products and at lower prices.

With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her general store and she will also purchase construction materials to expand her business and relocate it to the front yard of her house. It is currently in the dining room area.

Her goal is to supply her store with merchandise, to expand the infrastructure, and to purchase a freezer. 

Her personal dreams are to complete these projects to have a better socio-economic situation and to live a more tranquil life.

Mercedes lives with her sister, who helps her with the business while she finds other work. Mercedes is very thankful for the support and trust that has been imparted upon her by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner). It has been a great help for her life and for her business. She attends all of the communal bank meetings. They are very enjoyable and the other members are very supportive.

With respect to the orientation, she has been able to integrate this sales knowledge to her own business.

Vina del Mar is a city and commune located in the central region of Chile. It is known as the City of Gardens for the gardens and patios of the heritage buildings in the city. It is also known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store and to purchase construction materials to enlarge the store.

loans.name: Jose Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio de 22 años, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares,la cual es propia y cuenta con servivios de agua y luz,ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos,que se encuentra a una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores laboran en la agricultura, ganadería y comercialización de frutas(en especial limón y mango).
La actividad que realiza Eulogio es la elaboración y venta de cajas de madera para transportar frutas, su taller donde las elaboraes en el domicilio de sus familiares, su negocio es muy rentable ya que en la zona existe bastante demanda de comercialización de fruta y lo transportan a otros lugares,ya cuenta con su propia clientela que hace pedidos y los ingresos que obtiene le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales.
Por esoa creído conveniente pedir un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  1000 nuevos soles para comprar materia prima (madera, clavos, papel, etc) para seguir resalizando las cajas de madera y poder cumplir con los pedidos pendientes y quedar bien con los clientes,destacandonos por los trabajos de calidad que se realizan.  Eulogio es un hombre que a sabido salir adelnte con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo para mejorar en la vida para seguir ayudando en los gastos con los familiares que vive.
texts.en:
Eulogio is 22 years old. He is single and lives in the house of some relatives, which is their own and has water and electricity. It is located in the rural area of the Olmos district, which is an hour from the department of Lambayeque. The people there work in agriculture, raise animals, and sell fruit, especially lemons and mangos.

Eulogio's business is making and selling wooden boxes for transporting fruit. His workshop where he makes them is in the house of his relatives. His business is very profitable since in that area there is quite a lot of business selling fruit, which is transported to other places. Eulogio has his own customers who place orders, and the income that he obtains helps him pay for his personal expenses.

For this reason, he thought it would be convenient to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN to buy more basic materials (wood, nails, paper, etc) to continue making the wood boxes, be able to complete his pending orders, and remain on good terms with his customers, emphasizing to us the quality of his products. Eulogio is a man who has known how to advance himself with much effort and work to improve in life to continue helping with the expenses of the relatives he lives with.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to continue making wood boxes for transporting fruit.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 10 años de estar ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el aumento de precio en los productos, ya que ella viaja hasta Managua para realizar las compras en donde los precios cambian. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de sabanas, mochilas, bolsos, calzado, cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en: Ángela is 55 years old. Her activity is selling general merchandise. She has been offering her customers the products they ask for for more than 10 years.  One of her biggest challenges is the price increase of the products. She travels to Managua to do the purchasing, and the prices there change. She reason for the loan is to buy sheets, backpacks, purses, shoes, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.use: to buy sheets, backpacks, purses, shoes, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is 22 years old. He is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than four years. Sadi bakes the national bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His wife helps him with his business. 

Having many customers, Sadi sells the majority of his products just from his place. However, he also runs a trading place in the central local market for selling the "lepeshka.” 

Now, Sadi requests 9,800 TJS. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale as required for his business. Sadi is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour in volume for baking the national bread “lepeshka.”

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nelly de 26 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Manejando su motocarro, Darwin ayuda en los gastos del hogar a su familia, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad en su hogar, puesto que siente que es el sustento principal de la casa y quiere corresponder todo el cariño que le brinda su familia. Él es muy amable con sus clientes y siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que estar todo el día fuera de casa en busca de clientes, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo, espera tener en el futuro el dinero necesario para comprar otro motocarro y ponerlo a trabajar. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han ido desgastando.
texts.en:
Darwin is 35 years old. He is a very simple man and a worker. He lives in his own home together with his wife Nelly, who is 26 years old, and their three dear children. He wants to provide them with a better quality of life. By driving his motorized rickshaw Darwin helps with the household expenses. He knows that he has a great responsibility within his home. He knows that he is the mainstay of the home and he wants to return all of the love that his family gives him. 

He is very friendly to his customers and always greets them with a smile on his lips. What he likes best about his job is chatting with his passengers. He has worked in this field for 20 years and believes that the most difficult part of his job is having to be away from home all day looking for customers.  However, he knows that this is his job and he has to do it. He hopes that in the future he will have the necessary money to buy another motorized rickshaw and put it to work.

This will be his seventh loan with MFP. He hopes to be very punctual with his payments because he does not want to create problems with his community bank where he has participated actively and is a well-loved member. He will buy new tires for his motorized rickshaw with the 500 nuevos soles that he has requested because over time they have worn down.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Abdelwahab

texts.en: Abdelwahab is a 62-year-old married man with no children. He owns a public transportation taxi and works as a public driver in addition to taking special requests. He earns a decent income but he does not have enough cash to pay for his taxi's insurance and licensing. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of  $1,500 for this purpose. Abdelwahab's taxi is the only source of income for his family and he wants to keep it secure.

loans.use: to pay for his taxi's insurance and licensing to ensure his business is ongoing.

loans.name: Andrea Jacqueline

texts.es:
La Señorita. Andrea vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, su gente es muy cálida y amable.
 
La Señorita Andrea tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá es ama de casa y su papá es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un taxi, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia es estudiante de una universidad de la Ciudad, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de sus estudios.

Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in the Yanuncay sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and great natural, architectural, and cultural beauty.  It is the third most important city in the country.  Its people are very warm and friendly.

Andrea is 19 years old and single.  She lives with her parents.  Her mother is a housewife, and her father is a professional driver.  He works driving a taxi.  The house where they live is their own.

Andrea is a student at the city university.  This is her second loan with her communal bank.  She will use the loan to pay for her education.  Her goal is to become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 61 años, es una mujer responsable y muy amorosa. Hace algún tiempo se separó de su esposo con el que tiene un hijo; que junto a su nieta viven en su casa propia ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día, los pobladores de su localidad salen a comprar los alimentos del día en la bodega que acondicionó en su casa, desde hace algunos años. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que es la bodega más surtida de su localidad. Pero la actividad que más disfruta Teodora, es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de café y plátanos, ya tiene 41 años dedicándose a ello y según afirma es una buena terapia, “descanso en la tranquilidad del campo”, afirma. Además de asociarse en la cooperativa denominada “Cerezo”, donde compran sus granos y la capacitan para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. Sus planes son adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, para poder minimizar los gastos de alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestarios de la unión palomar”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura saldrá adelante, gracias al apoyo financiero brindado. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teodora de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Teodora, age 61, is a very responsible and a very loving woman.  She separated from her husband some time ago.  They have a son, who together with her granddaughter, lives with her in her own house in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).  

Starting very early every morning the local inhabitants go to buy their daily food in the grocery store that she established in her house several years ago.  She says that the business is going very well for her.  It is the best stocked grocery store in her area.

However, the activity that Teodora most enjoys in farming.  Her main crops are coffee and bananas.  She has been doing this for 41 years.  According to her it is good therapy, “I rest in the peacefulness of the field,” she says.

Also, she is a member of the “Cerezo” cooperative where she buys grains and receives trainings in order to improve the quality of her crops.

Her plan is to get her own farm land in order to be able to minimize the rental expenses.

She belongs to the “Prestarios de la Unión Palomar” Communal Bank.  This is her second loan with MFP, where she is sure to get ahead thanks to the financial support provided.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Upon receiving your support, Teodora will use the requested money to buy basic needs items to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking and honest 41-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a seven-year-old child who is school-going. For more than three years he has been supplying hospital consumables and laboratory items so as to make a living. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from farming tea. 

Previously he was employed. He wants in the next five years to have his own vehicles to supply his products. His dream is to have an annual turnover of 5 million Kenya shillings. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a microscope, an electric centrifuge and a digital thermometer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to acquire business management skills.

loans.use: to buy a microscope, an electric centrifuge and a digital thermometer.

loans.name: Estuardo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Estuardo de Jesus es casado, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la construcción de vivienda como ayudante de albañil, tiene 3 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de medicinas para la salud de su familia y compra un mueble para uso personal. Espera mejorar su condición de vida con el préstamo que está realizando.
texts.en:
Estuardo de Jesus is married and 21 years of age.  He finished 6th grade of basic education and works in home construction as a mason's assistant.  He has 3 years of experience in this trade and he counts on the support of his wife who takes care of the domestic tasks.

He decided to request a loan that would allow him to purchase medicine for the health of his family as well as a piece of furniture for his personal use.  He hopes to improve his living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to cover health expenses and purchase furniture

loans.name: Fearness Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rugiatu was born in Makeni city about 47 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools.

Rugiatu sells palm oil, rice, and fish. She has been doing this business for 21 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Rugiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Rugiatu will use her share of the loan, 1,500,000 Leone (SLL), to buy fish, palm oil, and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil, and rice for resale

loans.name: Noris Jackeline

texts.es:
Noris es una joven de 24 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en la colonia Moncada-Lobo y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria.

Noris inició vendiendo golosinas y actualmente lo sigue haciendo, con las ganancias que fue obteniendo a traves del tiempo logró instalar una pequeña pulperia en una parte de su casa de habitacion y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. Noris no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos asi que todos los gastos de su casa corren por su propia cuenta por esa razon se esfuerza tanto en mantener activos sus negocios. Por las mañanas y tardes se dedica a atender su pulperia y por las tardes-noches se dedica a elaborar y vender las golosinas.

Noris solicita este prestamo para surtir su pulperia de corn flakes, cereales, lacteos, pollo, embutidos, carnes, salsas, pastas, refrescos, jugos, condimentos, manteca, papel higienico, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo tendra mas y variados productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y eso le generará mas ingresos.

Su meta es construir su casa ya que actualmente debe pagar alquiler, y convertir su pulperia en un mini-super. Este es su sexto ciclo en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente.
texts.en:
Noris is a 24 year old young woman and a single mother of two children.  She lives in the Moncado-Lobo neighborhood and sells groceries for a living. 

Noris started selling sweets which she is still currently doing.  With the income she earned over time, she set up a small store in a part of her house and "she gives thanks to God" because things are going well.  Noris doesn't receive support from her children's father and she has to pay the household expenses on her own.  For this reason she works hard to maintain her businesses.   In the mornings and afternoons she tends her store and in the evenings she makes and sells her sweets.  

Noris is requesting a loan to stock her store with corn flakes, grains, dairy products, chicken, cold cuts, meats, salsas, pastas, soft drinks, juices, condiments, butter, toilet paper, and other products.  With the help of this loan she will have more and varied products to offer her customers and generate more income.  

Her goals are to build a house because currently she is renting and to convert her store into a mini- supermarket.  This is her sixth cycle with FAMA and she has made all of her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as corn flakes, grains, dairy products, chicken, cold cuts, meats, salsas, pastas, soft drinks, juices, condiments, butter, toilet paper, and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun, 52, lives in a common law relationship and has five children. She is a local farmer from Kompong Chhnang province. She tills a parcel of land for growing rice crops. She makes an annual profit from her business. Mrs. Oeun plans to expand into additional farmland for more income. However, she does not have sufficient capital to achieve her purpose. She said, “I’ll be able to generate the rice production at a high rate with my experience, and then I can keep it for daily food as well as sell it for money.”

Mrs. Oeun has applied for a loan from Kiva through HKL to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers to provide crop maintenance to her rice crops. The loan will be of much help for her to be able to invest in her rice crops.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La socia tiene actualmente 37 años de edad; los hijos de la socia tiene 12, 6, 4 años de edad; la socia tiene una carpa en el mercado en la cual ella vende huevos y mates, estos son hechos a base de hierbas naturales como la menta, cebada, airampo, lechuga, hinojo, hierba buena entre otros. la socia vende huevos sancochados con papas cocidas y acompañado de aji  hecho a base de hierbas o plantas medicinales y muy utilizadas en todo el país, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de huevos al por mayor, hierbas, papa al por mayor para continuar con su negocio y a su vez con la crianza de sus menores hijos, la socia con todo lo que le ingresa de la venta de sus productos, ella puede invertir en la educación de sus tres hijos, en la alimentacion y en la compra de vestido para ellos, la socia a futuro desearía tener un stand propio para poder crecer y elaborar comidas u otro negocio mas rentable.
texts.en: This borrower is 37 years old. Her children are 12, 6 and 4. She has a tent in the market where she sells eggs and mate infusions which are made from natural herbs such as mint, barley, airampo (a cactus seed), lettuce, fennel, yerba buena (spearmint), etc. She sells boiled eggs with potatoes, accompanied by chili sauce made from herbs or medicinal plants which are very commonly used across the country. She would like to invest this loan in buying eggs and potatoes wholesale, and herbs, so that she can continue in her business and continue raising her dependent children. With everything she makes from the sale of her products, she is able to invest in her three children's education, providing food and buying clothes for them. In the future, she would like to have her own stand so that she can grow her business and make food or run another more profitable business.

loans.use: to invest in buying eggs and potatoes wholesale and to buy natural herbs for making medicinal infusions

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. She earns a living by running a retail store where she sells canned goods, detergents, batteries and other items. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rokonka

texts.en:
Rokonka is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. He is a livestock trader and also a maize farmer. He has been doing this for the last five years. 

Rokonka learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. He is a good client and this will be his second loan. He is planning to buy more livestock and buy farm inputs like seeds and chemicals used on the farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to venture into farming and to educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a finicky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. One is enrolled in school while one is still too young. Her husband, who is employed, contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanajuma has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past five years, with her neighbors as customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. With a loan of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get funds to expand her business, which is her dream.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar is married and has three children – two of them are students. He is a hardworking and responsible man. Agriculture and fattening up cattle are the scope of his business. He is raising cattle to have milk and cream for sale. Samandar has been involved in livestock for over 20 years and he is a good, experienced farmer. His plans for the future is to buy 25 head of cattle for fattening. He hopes to obtain this loan and earn a good income by expanding his business. He wants to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is 51 years old and has three children. He likes to work hard because as he stated, he could be able to exercise as he goes on working. It is a healthy lifestyle, he added, but he cannot hide that this task is really difficult especially because he is getting old. Despite that, he patiently and humbly works and cares for his business.

As a matter of fact, he is asking a loan in the amount of P13,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use to develop his business to produce abundant crops. Hopefully, he can exceed his last crop to save for the betterment of their lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use to develop his business to produce abundant crops.

loans.name: Myryan Yaninna

texts.es:
Myryan es una joven muy emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas y por la producción de nuestro producto Bandera el “Pisco”, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazon que tienen, tiene 19 años de edad y a su edad es muy responsable y sobre todo luchadora, es conviviente y su pareja la apoya mucho en todo lo que ella hace, es su mano derecha, cuando se siente preocupada o cansada el le da animos para seguir y es por ello que ella lo quiere mucho, actualmente su pareja trabaja en la municipalidad de su ciudad y con ello tienen mas ingresos para su hogar, asi como también esta estudiando contabilidad .

Myryan se dedica a la repostería, vende dulces, gelatinas, tortas alfajores, bocaditos, recorre las calles de su barrio ofreciendo sus dulces pero no solo se dedica a ello sino también vende gas domestico, en su casa, Myryan es muy trabajadora, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que prepara de una manera muy deliciosa sus dulces y porque es muy ordenada y le gusta la limpieza por ello los clientes se animan a comprar su productos, además de que le gusta tratar de manera amable a los clientes.

Myryan está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más materiales e insumos para su negocio de dulces, con ello tendra mas ingresos para si poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, asi como también ahorrar para mejorar para cumplir su gran sueño:” Crecer como Microempresaria”
texts.en:
Myryan is a very hardworking young woman.  She lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its population of Afro-Peruvian origin, its dances, its reputation as the birthplace of great moments in Peruvian sports, its beautiful beaches, and for the production of its flagship product, Pisco.  The city is also famous for its cuisine, since the residents of Chincha are known for using good seasoning in their cooking. 

Myryan is 19 years old and is very responsible and, above all, tenacious.  She lives with her partner, who helps her with everything that she does—he is her right hand, and whenever she feels worried or tired he encourages her to keep going, and that is why she loves him so much.  Myryan’s partner currently works for the city government, and because of his job they have more income for their household, which is how he is able to study accounting.  

Myryan earns a living making and selling sweets, jello, cakes, and snacks.  She walks along the streets of her neighborhood selling her products; however, this is not her only livelihood, as she also sells gas cylinders from her home.  Myryan is very hardworking, and devotes about 9 hours a day to her business.  She thinks that her business is going well because she prepares sweets in a way that makes them very delicious, and because she likes to be neat and tidy.  These factors encourage customers to purchase her products, and it also helps that she treats her customers in a friendly manner.

Myryan is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because it is thanks to their support that she will be able to purchase more materials and ingredients for her sweets business.  This will allow her to earn more income, which she will be able to invest in her business.  This will also allow her to save so that she can more easily achieve her dream: “To grow as a micro-entrepreneur.”

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for making sweets.

loans.name: Ghadah

texts.en: Ghadah is 36 years old and lives in Gaza. She started her beauty salon business in 2012, and she has had a good experience in this field. Ghadah asked Ryada for this loan to buy an electronic generator, makeup tools for her salon, and make new decorations. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation. Her dream is to expand her business more and more in the future. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy an electronic generator, makeup tools for her salon, and make new decorations.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en:
Mika is 60 years old. He is married with 10 children. 

He has had a motorcycle transport business for 3 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase new motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to get more income and help him to provide sufficient food for his family and educate his children well. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, make more income and be able to support his family and save enough money for his old age.

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to get more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta wants to rent another plot for growing of Onions, Tomatoes, Kales, Spinach

loans.name: Abuwa

texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Tsévié, Togo, Madam Abuwa D., after having left her studies, started selling a local drink "Tchoukoutchou" (a drink made from sorghum base). Married to an elementary school principal, she contributes to the household with her business income. A very dynamic woman, she has mastered the preparation of this drink, which brings in a multitude of customers. As a result, she has been able to manage and successfully reimburse her loans.

She is now asking for a new credit of $450 that will help her purchase the sorghum as well as other necessary materials. This will help her increase her sales and consequently contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1975 à Tsévié, Madame D. Abuwa, après avoir abandonné ses études s'est lancée dans la vente de boisson locale « Tchoukoutchou » (une boisson fabriquée à base du sorgho). Mariée à un directeur d’école primaire, elle participe aux charges de leur foyer grâce aux revenus de ses ventes. Par son dynamisme et la maîtrise des techniques de préparation de sa boisson qui attire une multitude de clients, elle a fait preuve de capacité de gestion des crédits qu’elle a pu rembourser sans difficulté. Elle sollicite encore un nouveau crédit de $450 qui servira à l’achat de sorgho ainsi que les autres matériels nécessaires. Ceci va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sorghum and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to purchase stocks of used clothes to expand her used clothes selling business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía is 23 years old, is married, has three children and her husband is a bricklayer working in construction. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells sugar, salt, pastas, oil and, candy. She is part of a solidarity group named “Montebello 2” together with Ms. Regina Santiz Gomez who is focused on raising pigs. With the loan, Lucía will supply her store with groceries and Regina will purchase maize to feed the animals and more piglets to increase the breed.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 23 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL DE UNA CONTRUCCION. ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE: AZUCAR, SAL, PASTAS, ACEITE, DULCES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UNGRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MONTEBELLO 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA REGINA SANTIZ GOMEZ QUE SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS. CON EL PRESTAMO LUCIA SURTIRA SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y REGINA COMPRARA MAIZ PARA LA ALIMENTACION DE LOS ANIMALES, TAMBIEN COMPRARA MAS PUERQUITOS PARA AUMENTAR LA CRIANZA.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa creates handicrafts as do almost all the women in her community of Nachig. She embroiders tablecloths, napkins, cushions and bedspreads, and sells them with people in her community who bring their merchandise to other tourist states to sell. Rosa is 26 years old and has 2 children. With her work, she contributes to the household costs. She is part of the group known as Merced 3. With this loan, she will invest in more thread and fabric wholesale, as it's much less expensive to buy this way.

ROSA es artesana como casi todas las mujeres de su comunidad Nachig, ella borda manteles, servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas que vende con gente de su localidad quienes lo llevan a otros Estados turísticos para su comercio. Rosa tiene 26 años y tiene dos hijos, con la actividad que desempeña contribuye a la economía de su hogar. Ella forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Merced 3. Con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de hilo y tela al por mayor ya que adquiriéndola de esta forma es mucho mas barato.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Dam

texts.en: Mrs. Dam S. M., aged 31, sells beans in the market to earn $3 per day in revenue.  Her husband, aged 44, works as a broker, buying and selling potatoes to earn about $4 per day.  They have five children, two who work digging up potatotes to earn $3 per day collectively, and three who are students.  Mrs. Dam is requesting this loan of $800 to purchase a large crop of potatoes from a farmer and resell them in the market at a higher profit margin than she earns on beans.  She plans to use the additional income from this transaction to pay her children’s school fees and save for future business investments.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes to resell in the market.

loans.name: Holida

texts.en: Holida and her husband are engaged in business selling men’s wear and shirts.  In addition, her husband is engaged in cattle lending. Both businesses form Holida’s family income. With the last loan from MicroInvest, she purchasing shirts for her business. It gave her an opportunity to increase her assortment and improve the quality of her stock. Now she is going to expand business and wants to use a loan to purchase warm sportswear.

loans.use: To purchase warm sportswear

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a happy and responsible father who makes a living by selling and repairing cell phones. He started by just selling new phones as a street vendor, but as he increased the quantity of his sales and acquired greater knowledge of how to repair cell phones, he decided to invest the money he had saved in renting a location and opening a small space to sell and repair these important instruments of communication. Currently, Edgar is separated from his wife and is caring for their only son, Michael, who is 8. Michael is his reason for living, along with his elderly mother, who he supports unconditionally with his care and attention. Edgar's dream is to expand his location and to increase the quantity of cell phones and equipment to offer his clients. This is why he needs to obtain a loan that he promises to repay in 6 months. Let's help this model son and father achieve his objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Edgar, es un alegre y responsable padre, está dedicado a la venta y reparación de celulares. Empezó sólo vendiendo celulares nuevos y en forma ambulatoria, pero conforme aumentaba la cantidad de sus ventas y fue adquiriendo mayor conocimientos sobre la reparación de celulares, decidió invertir el dinero ahorrado que tenía para alquilar un local y aperturar su pequeño espacio de reparación y venta de estos importantes instrumentos de comunicación. Actualmente Edgar se encuentra separado de su esposa, quedando él a cargo de su único hijo, Michael de ocho años, quien es la razón de su vida junto a su anciana madre, quien la apoya incondicionalmente con el un cuidado y atención de su querido retoño. El deseo del señor Edgar, es ampliar su local y aumentar la cantidad de equipos móviles para ofertarlos, es por esa razón que requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Ayudemos a cumplir los objetivos de este hijo y padre ejemplar.

loans.use: Expansion of his space where he buys and sells cell phones to offer his clients increased comfort

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START A CHARCOAL BUSINESS

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Unidos: (United Women), she lives in the region San Martín, in the province of Huallaga, district of Bellavista. Her business, a restaurant that specializes in selling chicken, is located in the main room of her house, which has been set up in a way that is beneficial to the business. Since she runs her restaurant out of her home, she is also able to dedicate a lot of time to her business without having to neglect her obligations to her family.

With a loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of roasted chicken, “salchipapas” (Fench fries with sliced hotdogs and sauces on top), hamburgers, chicken and beans, potatoes in bulk, canned goods, ground beef sold by the Kilo, vegetables for salads and other ingredients that she needs so that her costumers will receive the best goods and service possible.

Maria Luisa is a very motivated, friendly and hard-working woman. She is 46 years-old and lives with her husband and two children. They motivate her to work a little harder each day so that she will be able to achieve all of her goals. Her goal for the future is to improve and expand the area that she runs her restaurant out of.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Maria Luisa es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas ”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga, distrito de Bellavista. El negocio, una pollería, se ubica en el ambiente principal de su propia casa especialmente acondicionado para la venta de este tipo de comida, lo que le permite compartir su tiempo entre el negocio y las tareas domésticas sin mayores dificultades.
