Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de pollos a la brasa, salchipapas y hamburguesas, como pollos en jabas, papas en sacos, embutidos y carne molida en kilos, verduras diversas para las ensaladas y otros que harán posible la buena atención a sus clientes con productos de buena calidad e higiénicos.

Maria Luisa es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día mas y alcanzar sus objetivos. Desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donde desarrolla su negocio.

loans.use: Ingredients for roasted chickens and "salchipapas"

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is 51 years old. He makes a living making and selling french fries on his motor bike.

He has four children that are in school, and his wife helps him with his french fries business.

Florentino rents his 4-wheeler and his motorcycle. He’s been making french fries for over 12 years, and he has seen both the competition and the demand rise over the years.

This loan is for the purchase of a motor whose price can vary. This will be Florentino’s fifth solicitation from our institution and he has had an excellent credit history and repayment of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Florentino tiene 51 años de edad y obtiene ingresos de una vagoneta, de la renta de una moto, y de la elaboración y comercialización de papas fritas. Tiene cuatro hijos que actualmente están estudiando y su esposa le ayuda con el negocio de las papas fritas. Florentino tiene una vagoneta que la trabaja en la línea de transportes FLORIDA de la cuál le pagan una renta diaria, también recibe una renta por el alquiler de su motocicleta. El negocio de las papas fritas tiene una antiguedad de más de 12 años respectivamente, y si bien la competencia es elevada la demanda por este tipo de producto es igual. El presente crédito es para la compra de un motor cuyo precio varia de acuerdo a las exigencias del mercado. El presente crédito es la quinta solicitud de Florentino en nuestra institución y demostró tener un excelente cumplimiento en todos sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motor

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz I. lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She was married 32 years ago and has four kids: three boys and one girl, all of whom are married. Shahnaz’s husband is a welder and has run a workshop in one of the busy markets for many years. He has also employed a few workers to help him in the business.

Shahnaz's husband gets orders from various factories and manufactures the required items. His business generates decent profits for them and helped them to marry their kids in a dignified manner. Now, they wish to be able to fill bigger orders for which they require a loan.

loans.use: to fill bigger orders for their welding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The funds will be invested to buy natural medicines for a small business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn K. is a villager in Chrork Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Suy Oun, are subsistence farmers. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study.

Even though the family members have various business activities, they are still not doing well. Thus, Mrs. Yorn K. needs to start another business and that would be cow breeding; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy a cow, so Mrs. Yorn K. decided to ask a loan for this purpose.

Previously, Mrs. Yorn K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy timbers to build her new house. Her husband and her younger daughter are shown in the photo with Mrs. Yorn K..

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian J. is 26 years old and unmarried. He lives with his mother in Taiy Loma, in the city of Carapeguá. He is an only child. Two years ago his father passed away in an accident. Cristhian earned a nursing degree two years ago and is currently working at the local health ministry.

Because his father had many clients with merchandise sold on credit, Cristhian had to take over his work as a roving salesman. He took responsibility for paying his father’s debts and, with lots of hard work and effort, managed to cover all his father’s debts, as well as another obligation left behind by his late father. Since his father passed away, Cristhian has had to work two jobs to take care of the house and his mother. His dedication and determination is admirable.

Cristhian is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise: bedspreads, hammocks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Cristhian J. es un joven de 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una de las compañías de Carapeguá (Tajy Loma) en compañía de su madre. Es hijo unico y hace dos años que falleció su papá en un accidente. Él se recibió de técnico en enfermería hace dos años y actualmente está trabajando en el ministerio de salud de la zona.

Cristhian tuvo que retomar el trabajo que hacía su padre, la de vendedor ambulante (macatero) ya que tenia muchos clientes a quienes dejaba mercaderías a créditos y también se responsabilizó de todas las deudas que tenía su padre, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo logró cubrir toda la deudas y otro compromiso que dejó su finado padre, desde que falleció su padre tuvo que llevar dos actividades diferentes de trabajo para poder mantener la casa y a su madre es admirable su dedicación y empeño.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (sobrecamas hamacas y otros).

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads, hammocks, sheets

loans.name: Srin

texts.en:
Srin V., age 41, is a mother of four children and lives in an outlying area. Since 2005, she and her husband have been working on farming and raising animals. This couple together is able to earn a living around $5 of profit per day. Mrs. Srin V. would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, a loan of US$1200 to purchase more piglets for her stock and buy feed for them as well.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Miryan G. de Amarilla es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, de la Compañía “Defensores del Chaco”, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Justo Amarilla Chaparro de 46 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

Tienen una carnicería en su casa particular, con clientela formada, y tiene buenos ingresos.

También son personas con buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente esta trabajando en esta actividad hace 10 años, y es una señora muy conocida y querida en la zona.

Ella desea un crédito pues con el podrá adquirir carnes de todo tipo para surtir más su carnicería. En Paraguay la población consume mayormente carne de vaca, es por eso que las carnicerías tienen mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Miryan G. de Amarilla is from San Estanislao city, from the company “Defensores del Chaco,” she is 39 years old, married to Mr. Justo Amarilla Chaparro who is 46 years old. They have to grown children. They have a butcher shop in their home, with a customer base, and have good income. They also are people with good commercial and personal references. This client has been in this business for 10 years, and is a woman who is well-known and loved in this zone. She would like a loan to be able to acquire all types of meat to stock her butcher shop. In Paraguay the population primarily consumes beef, so the butcher shops are generally successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, pork, and chicken.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Doña Irene tiene 56 años D. edad, estudió quinto año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. 08 hijos (04 mayores y 04 menores D. edad) y vive en el Jr. Bolognesi  Nº 129, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 08 años es socia del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 compró golosinas: galletas, chocolates y caramelos. Por falta D. medios económicos no pudo estudiar porque sus padres eran muy pobres y además eran varios hermanos. A los 18 Años D. edad tuvo su pareja y desD. los 20 años puso un restaurante, negocio al que se dedicó por varios años. DesD. hace 10 años venD. golosinas que trae D. la ciudad D. Tacna y venD. en Ilave. En la actualidad en paralelo a la venta D. golosinas, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes.

Con este crédito D. S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar con S/. 800, 20 cajas D. chocolate D. diferentes precios, con S/.600, 10 cajas D. aconcagua y S/.300 D. dulces. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos menores sean profesionales y también continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is 56 years old. She studied through the 5th year of elementary school. She is married and has 8 children, 4 are young 4 are old. Irene lives at 129 Jr. Bolognesi in the district of Ilave in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of "La Ilaveñita" Community Bank for 8 years. WIth her first loan of 300 soles, she purchases sweets, including cookies, chocolate and candy. Due to the lack of economic means, Irene could not study because her parents were very poor and she had many siblings. At age 18, she met her husband, and since age 20 she has owned a restaurant. 10 years ago she began selling sweets, which she brings from the city of Tacna and sells in Ilave. Currently, along with selling sweets, Irene operates a grocery store. With this loan of 2,500 soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she plans to purchase 800 soles worth of chocolate (20 boxes at different prices), 600 soles worth of canned food and 300 soles worth of sweets. Irene's dream is that her younger children become professionals and that she is able to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase, chocolate, sweets and canned-food.

loans.name: Adjo Emefa

texts.en:
Adjo is the woman on the left in this photo, wearing the white dress. She is 29 years old and lives in Wome, a small village approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Adjo is married with one child who will soon attend school.  

To pay for her child’s school fees and provide for her family, Adjo sells children’s clothes and t-shirts in Wome’s central market (where this photo was taken.)  

Adjo hopes to use this loan from Kiva to restock and vary her supply of clothing, so that she may stand out from competitors in the market and earn more money.  With the profits she will earn, she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Restock and vary her supply of clothing

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en: M. Khairullo lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, where he lives with his wife and three beloved children. Mr. M. makes a living running a small grocery store. Before MicroInvest loans became available, he traded in rice but thanks to MicroInvest loans he now owns his own company. He is proud of the fact that he has a good assortment of items to sell to his customers--sugar, sweets, bread, meat products, cheese, beer, juices, tinned stewed meat, perfumes and other items. He has applied to Kiva for a new loan to repair and upgrade his store. Mr. M. thanks Kiva for its support and for the help it provides to small businesses like his.

loans.use: to repair tand upgrade his store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is fifty two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children have completed senior high school. Sarah’s husband is a cocoa farmer. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. She is a trader. She trades mainly in plantain and other food items. She buys her produce from the farmers in her community and nearby towns. She treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Sarah has been in business for over six years and is well experienced. When plantain becomes scarce, she resorts to buying and reselling food items like cassava, yam, etc. Sarah wants to buy plantain on larger scale so that she can supply to a greater number of customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru:
Шарипова Зулайхо родилась 1976 году. Она после развода с мужем, начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность. Предпринимательством занимается шесть лет и на данный момент торгует детскими одеждами.  Торгует на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большой выбор детской одежды, начиная от детского нижнего белья до курточек и шапочек.  Она закупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон».  
Зулайхо хочет закупить сезонный товар и желает участвовать в программе Кива, чтоб получить денежные средства для расширения бизнеса в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Zulaiho S. was born in 1976, and after divorcing her husband, she went into business. She has been in business for six years and at present sells children's clothing at the Panjshir market in the city of Dushanbe. Her inventory includes a broad selection of children's clothing, ranging from children's undergarments to jackets and caps, which she purchases at the Korvon wholesale market. Zulaiho wants to purchase seasonal items and wishes to participate in Kiva's program in order to take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to have the wherewithal to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing (jackets, pants and pullovers)

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Uon O., 43, is married and lives with her husband in the Bati, Takeo province. She raises pigs from her home and sells palm sugar at the market. From these activities, she makes USD $20 in revenue per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and earns $1 per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are employed and one who is a student. Mrs. Uon O. would like to take out a loan to be able to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
“Little trials without God can break you, but big trials with Him can make you great,” a favorite quotation Beatriz G. remembers, every time she is tested by troubles in life.

Beatriz is 48 years old and married to Jessie, a security guard in DTI (Department of Trade and Industry) in Makati City, Manila. They have two children: Jessabeth - 21 years old, a lady guard, and Mark Bee Jay - 14 years old, third year high school student.

Beatriz is really an entrepreneur. She is very diligent in looking for other livelihood resources. Being an extraordinary entrepreneur, she was able to manage at least three simple businesses such as buying and selling frozen foods, food vending and direct selling of personal collection of AVON and NATASHA products for men and women.

With those businesses, Beatriz is able to earn a weekly net income of PHP 1,000 that she uses to support the education of her youngest child. She is now borrowing an additional capital of PHP 5,000 to maintain her small businesses. She is thankful that her husband is very supportive to her business undertakings; that makes her inspired every time.

loans.use: Business maintenance

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor  VICTOR C. S. y su esposa JUANA COLQUE, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes mantienen con su trabajo. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle  José Ballivián # 5181  en la zona Villa Juliana ciudad de El Alto. El don VICTOR tiene la profesión de mecánico que realiza en su mismo domicilio y su señora se dedica al las labores de casa, el Sr. Víctor aprendió esa profesión de su padre que desde pequeño fue enseñándole. El destino del credito es la compra de un vehiculo, el cual sera desarmado para asi tener repuestos a otras movilidades. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor C. S. and his wife Juana Colque have three small children whom they support. They live in their home at #5181 José Ballivián street in the Villa Juliana neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Victor is a mechanic who works out of his home and his wife is a homemaker. Victor began learning his profession at a very young age, taught by his father. This loan is for the purchase of a vehicle which will be stripped for parts that can then be used as replacements in other vehicles. Victor and Juana's greatest desire is to be able to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehichle that can be stripped for replacement parts

loans.name: Las Risueñas Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Marta E.,  quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Marta E. se dedica a la venta de Plateria, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias en generalpara de esa manbera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes

La sra. Carmen E.  se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esos productos al por mayor obteniendo asi mayor ganacia y variedad.

La sra. Mercedes E. Macen se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboracion de los comestibles ofreciendo de eso manera mayor calidad a su clientela.

La sra. Ramona E. se dedica a la venta de Prendas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias pudiendo ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Zully E. se dedica a la ventra de articulos de cosmetologia, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esos productos logrando ofrecer mayo variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Estelvina A. se dedica a la venta de bebidas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas en general ofrecie ofreciendo mas variedad a su clientela.

La sra. Patricia O.  se dedica a la venta de prendas,  invirtio el dinero en la compra variada de prendas de vestir  logrando de ese modo captar mayor clientela.

La sra. Flavia A. tiene una cantina,invirtio el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo y mercaderias de modo a ir surtiendo y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Luciana L. se dedica a la venta de Comestibles, invirtrio el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los comestibles, pudiendo asi ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso.

La sra. Cynthia G. se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir,  invirtio el dinero en la compra de esa prendas en general, logrando obtener mayor variedas para sus clientes.

La sra. Vielva A. se dedideca a la venta de comestibles, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los mismos ofreciendo calidad y variedad a su clientela.

La sra. Dora S.  tiene un copiten, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercederias para surtir su negocio de ese modo obtiene mayor varias para ofrecer al clente.

La sra. Rocio Fernanadez de se dedica a la venta de Bijuoteri, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esos articulos ofreciendo articulos varios a sus clientes.


La sra. Nanci M. se dedica a la venta de prendas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de  prendas de vestir en general , obteniendo si mayor variedad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Mirian A.  es peluquera y masajista, invirtio el  dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, obreciendo comodidad y buen servicio a su clientela.

 La sra. Daisy Y.  se dedica a la venta de bebidas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas varias pudiendo asi surtir su negocio y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

La sra.Cynthia E. es costurera, invirtio el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, de esa manera aumentar su produccion
texts.en:
The present committee was started by Marta E., who invited and organized her friends to become a part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras program.

Marta E. sells silverware. She invests her money by purchasing more products so she can offer a wider variety to her clients.

Carmen E. sells cosmetics. She purchases products wholesale so that she can obtain higher earnings and offer a wide variety of products.

Mercedes E. Macen sells groceries. She also buys and sells supplies for food preparation to increase the quality of her customer care.

Ramona E. sells clothing. She invests her money by purchasing additional products so she can offer a wider variety to her clients.

Zully E. sells cosmetics. She invests her money by purchasing additional products so she can offer a wider variety to her clients.

Estelvina A. sells drinks. She invests her money by purchasing additional products so she can offer a wider variety to her clients.

Patricia O. sells clothing. She purchases different types of clothing so she can attract a wider clientele.

Flavia A. owns a cantina. She purchases necessary items for her business and fashionable merchandise so that she can offer her clients more variety.

Luciana L. sells groceries. She also purchases and sells other ingredients needed to prepare food so she can offer her clients variety and increase her income.

Cynthia G. sells clothing. She invests her money by purchasing general assortments of clothings so she can have more variety for her clients.

Vielva A. sells groceries. She purchases and sells ingredients needed to prepare food so she can offer quality and variety to her clients.

Dora S. owns a copiten. She invests her money by purchasing additional merchandise to stock her business and offer more variety to her clients.

Rocio Fernanadez sells jewelry. She invests her money by purchasing additional articles so that she can offer her clients variety.

Nanci M. sells clothing. She invests her money by purchasing general assortments of clothings so she can have more variety for her clients.

Mirian A. is a hairdresser and masseuse. She invests her money by purchasing necessary items for her work so she can offer her clients comfort and good service.

Daisy Y. sells beverages. She invests her money by purchasing a variety of beverages so she can stock her business and offer more variety to her clients.

Cynthia E. is a seamstress. She invests her money by purchasing necessary items for her work so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing, silverware, cosmetic and haircare items, items for food preparation (eggs, bread, vegetables, fruit, etc.); beverages

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
Lê Thị D. is a 40-year-old married mother of two adult children living in the town of Kim Động.  For income D. raises livestock, mainly pigs, and she has been in this trade for over 11 years.  She earns approximately 3000000 VND a month with her business.

D. joined TYM Fund in 2003 to secure a loan to help grow her business and improve her living situation.  She used the loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  Thị is now requesting her 5th loan, in the amount of 15000000 VND, to be used to purchase breeding livestock which will help grow her business and generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Gladays

texts.en:
Gladays Q. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High School education. Gladays sells clothing at Kotokraba. She has been selling clothing since 2000. Her husband is a petty trader.

Gladays uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. Gladays will use the loan to purchase bales of clothes to expand her business to increase her profit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladays plans to reinvest and save to enable her to meet her financial obligations such as payment of school fees, water bill, light bill and other domestic expenses.

loans.use: purchase bales of clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Renaldo Baptista

texts.pt:
Renaldo Baptista P. nasce na cidade de maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, casado, pai de um filho de um ano. Freqüentar 10 classe na escola secundaria local. Não sustenta mais ninguém da família.
Vive na cidade no bairro da Liberdade (a 15 km de Boane) e trabalha na barragem dos pequenos libombos de boane a 17anos como observador de agua e neste momento ganha 5.300,00MT que usa no sustento da família assim como pagamento do credito.
Este é o seu quarto empréstimo com a hluvuku. Os outros empréstimos foram todos aplicados na construção da sua casa de material convencional. Levantou 10.000,00MT; 14.000,00MT; 14.500,00MT.
Com o credito actual no valor de 20.000,00MT pretende também aplicar na compra de materiais de construção.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e ouviu falar da hluvuku através de colegas de serviços.
Compromete se a pagar sem problemas para no futuro, depois de concluir a casa, comprar uma viatura para transporte pessoal e bens.
texts.en:
Renaldo Baptista P. was born in the city of Maputo. He is 40 years old and married, with a one-year-old son. He attended school through the tenth grade. He does not financially support any other family members. He lives in the Liberdade neighborhood (15 km from Boane) and has worked at the Pequenos Libombos Dam as a water oibserver for 17 years. He currently earns 5,300 MT, which he uses to support his family and pay off his loans. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku. The other loans were all used to build his house with standard materials. He borrowed 10,000 MT, 14,000 MT, and 14,500 MT. The current loan of 20,000 MT will also be used to purchase building materials. He's never had a loan with another bank and heard about Hluvuku through colleagues at work. He is committed to making his payments on time so that in the future, after the house is finished, he can buy a vehicle for personal use.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en: Togtohbayar J. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. The youngest son is 20 years old and is a third year student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Togtohbayar has a small business in livestock raising and selling. He purchases livestock including sheep, cattle and goat, in the springtime when meat price plummets. He feeds the animals that he bought in the spring until the fall when meat price peaks at its seasonal high point in the year. He mostly slaughters the animals in the fall and sells the meat at the local market. He and his wife have been in the livestock business since 1995. Since the start, he and his wife have done well; the business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT to 5,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in agricultural work

loans.name: 25 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Oanh N. Thị N. (172) is  62 and lives in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Oanh is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 25 Nam Ngạn (17.09.25).


Oanh is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  Oanh owns & operates a food stall where she sells assorted foods & snacks to the local community.  Oanh has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Oanh repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND, which she used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which she will use for the same reason. This will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Oanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (173) is 38 and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


2.  Lê Thị Liên (175) is  54 and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


3.  N. Thị Huệ (176) is 45 and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


4.  T. Thị Lý (177) is 43 and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


5.  N. Thị Lan (174) is  49 and is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Oanh N. Thị N. (172) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Oanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 25 Nam Ngạn (17.09.25).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán hàng tạp hóa trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Oanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Oanh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Oanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Oanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (173) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Lê Thị Liên (175) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. Thị Huệ (176) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  T. Thị Lý (177) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5.  N. Thị Lan (174) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

If you would like to translate the Vietnamese text above, please visit the  free online translator  offered by Vdict.com.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une dame âgée de 65 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison sur étal. Les revenus générés lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou D., 65, is the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruit displayed on a table top. The income thus generated permits her to contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
M. is a 33-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1998 to provide, along with his brothers, for living expenses of the family.

Today, M. is requesting $800 to perform maintenance on his taxi to be able to proceed with his work.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Kevwe

texts.en: Kevwe lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and baking materials. she is married with 6 children and she is 41 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and baking materials to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and baking materials to sell

loans.name: Adjihoutou

texts.fr: B. Adjihoutou est née le 01/01/1966 à Sèmè-Podji. Adjihoutou est mariée à DOSSOU Mondji, un chauffeur. Adjihoutou et Mondji ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podj. Adjihoutou vend des produits vivriers principalement le maïs ainsi que du bois de chauffage. C'est à Pobè et Kétou, deux localités du Département du Plateau que Adjihoutou s'approvisionne en ses différents produits. Adjihoutou a déjà sept ans d'expérience dans son activité et a eu aussi trois crédits, bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Adjihoutou sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de charbon de bois et de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema L. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Ema owns and operates a handicraft business, selling clay handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ema joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Ema is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Abomukisa's Group

texts.en:
Abomukisa S. is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a jolly, hard working, and friendly man. He is married and has 11 children, ages 18  to 35. Six of his children are still in school. In addition, he cares for his siblings. 

S. is a tailor in Lugazi. He also has been selling cosmetics for children, ladies and men for 7 years. Before that, he was a driver, and then he moved on to manage his own businesses. He does not regret the change, because he is able to make good profits from his business. He is grateful for his loans because they have helped him move on, and have recapitalized his businesses so he can earn more profits. He hopes to be able to save enough so that he does not need loans during his very old age. 

He needs a loan to buy more tailoring materials and cosmetics, so that he can save enough to pay his children’s school fees next year. This is his loan group's 69th loan.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Concha Group

texts.es:
María José C. Araica, Esperanza G. y Dinora H. formaron al grupo Concha. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y con visión a pesar de sus limitaciones.

El negocio de la señora María José C. Araica consiste en reciclar papel, botellas y latas. Ella llego tan sólo a cursar  primer grado de primaria  pero tiene una conciencia ecologista muy alta y trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y sueñas con verlos con una carrera. 

Dinora H. tiene una fritanga, que es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena.

Esperanza de los Ángeles G. comercializa de forma ambulante gran variedad de productos como cosas de horna, prensa pelos, cosméticos, colas, fantasía, lápices etc.
texts.en:
María José C. Araica, Esperanza G., and Dinora H. form the Concha Group. They are hard-working and enterprising women with a vision in spite of their limitations. María José C. Araica’s business is recycling paper, bottles, and cans. She only went to first grade, but she is very ecologically conscientious, and she works very hard so that her children are able to complete their education. She dreams of seeing them have careers. Dinora H. has a “fritanga”, which is a restaurant popular for excellent food in Nicaragua. It consists of selling fried foods, which are prepared solely to put on the grill. It is generally purchased for dinner. Esperanza de los Ángeles G. is a street vendor. She sells a great variety of products like decorations, hair clips, cosmetics, hair accessories, costume jewelry, and lipsticks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To recycle paper, bottles, and cans

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married with two children. She sells underwear as well as children's clothing at a small market in Mukachevo city and has been in this business for eleven years. Being very enthusiastic and optimistic she provides a good example to her neighbors, showing that economic crisis is not the end of the business. Georgina lives with her husband and children in a small house with big understanding and love towards one another.

Georgina would like to borrow 11,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase more children's clothing to sell during coming Christmas season. Many people buy children clothing as a gift, so Georgina wants to have large assortment to attract even more clients.

loans.use: to expand store inventory

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Tierra Rajada,  distrito de Olmos, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Como la mayoría de los pobladores de la zona, Tomás se dedica al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales, este negocio le es de mucha ayuda ya que usualmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sostener a lo suyos.

El cría ovejas y cabras, las engorda y luego las vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona eventualmente. A veces viaja hacia la ciudad de Chiclayo para vender sus animales en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad). La continua demanda por sus animales ha hecho que Tomás piense en ampliar su negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más ovejas para crianza y venta.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para sacar a su familia adelante, el es un padre responsable y bastante trabajador, sus vecinos y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona confiable y que siempre está sispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Tomás is 38 years old and is married and lives with his family in the Tierra Rajada hamlet, district of Olmos located three hours of the city of Chiclayo.

Like the majority of the people living in the area, Tomás’ business is to raise and sell animals, this business gives them a lot of help since he usually works as a farmer and the income is not enough to sustain his family.

He breeds sheep and goats, fattens them up and then sells them to businessmen who visit the area frequently. Sometimes he travels to the city of Chiclayo to sell his animals in the Moshoqueque market (a wholesale market in the city). The continuing demand for his animals has made Tomás think of expanding his business, this is why he needs this loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that he will invest to buy more sheep for raising and selling.

His greatest wish is to keep growing as an entrepreneur and to give his family a good start in life, he is a responsible father and very hardworking, his neighbors and people who know him hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a responsible person who is always ready to help whenever it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es: Bertha María G. Espinosa desde hace años vende ropa de diferentes estilos de manera ambulante y por encargo. Ella desde muy tempranas horas sale a recorrer las calles y las empresas en busca de clientela.
texts.en:
Bertha Maria Gomez Espinosa has been selling clothes of various styles for many years, both as a street vendor and by taking orders. She goes out very early in the morning to look for customers both in the streets and in local businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda A. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Bernarda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling her own caught seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Bernarda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Bernarda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bernarda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Faima

texts.en: Faima R. is an entrepreneurial businesswoman in Tanzania. She is married with one child. She runs a clothing shop at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her goods from the city market business center at Kariakoo city shopping center from both wholesale and retail shops and resells them to customers at her shop. She has been in the business for three years and the business income helps her pay house rent, business capitalization and meeting the family's daily demands. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 TZS to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María vive en  casa alquilada con su madre en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la de repostera, ella genera sus ingresos elaborando donuts y empanadas.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (harina, aceite, azúcar, levadura, etc.).

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
La señora María lives in a rented house with her mother in the Villa Neuvo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. She is a pastry cook; she earns a living making donuts and empanadas (pastries). This loan will be used to buy ingredients (flour, oil, sugar, yeast, etc.). She has been a customer of IMPRO since 2007. Because she has a very good credit history, she is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for her business selling donuts and empanadas (pastries)

loans.name: America Janeth

texts.es:
America O. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es albañil ellos tienen tres hijos. 

America inicio con la tienda y la venta de arroz  ya hace 5 años atrás. Debido a la falta de oportunidades tuvo que invertir todos sus ahorros en arroz y empezar a vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco implemento mas alimentos a la venta. 

Ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende todo tipo de víveres y carnes. Trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta las 23:00 pm todos los días. Ella atiende sola la tienda y tiene miedo de la delincuencia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, arroz y legumbres para su tienda. Una de las metas que quiere cumplir en el futuro es tener una de las mejores tiendas en todo Paraíso de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
America O., 32, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has all basic utilities. Her husband is a bricklayer and they have three children. America started her store selling rice 5 years ago. Because of the lack of opportunities, she had to invest all her savings in rice and start to sell to her acquaintances; gradually, she added more food items to her inventory. Now, she has a small store where she sells all sorts of food items and meats. She is open for business from 7am until 11pm every day. She tends to her store by herself and is afraid because of delinquency. She will use the funds to buy meats, rice and vegetables for her store. One of her goals for the future is to have one of the best stores in all of Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meats, rice, vegetables.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe is trader. She sells snacks (gala) and has been in this business since 1997, but started as a retailer. Now she could sell at wholesale and retail prices. She requests for a loan of NGN150,000 to purchase more cartons of snacks (Gala) to sell, which will in turn lead to a price reduction and increase her profit.
 
Dupe is 50 years old, married and has five children. With the increase in profit as a result of this loan, her family will be better cared for. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of snacks (Gala) to sell.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun Y., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells fruit for an income of about USD 10 per day. Her husband produces traditional plows and wooden beds, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy wood to produce more plows for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy wood to produce plows for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos aún pequeños. Hace más de 10 años, se ha dedicado a la venta de papa, limón, cebolla, ajos, tomate y demás tubérculos. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano por la mañana atendiendo sus clientes, hasta las 7.00 de la noche que termina de trabajar. Mientras que su esposo la ayuda en el trabajo, aunque a veces se encarga de recoger a sus hijos del colegio y atenderlos. De esa manera pueden ellos progresar y ayudarse mutuamente. Para Nancy, su prioridad es continuar trabajando, ya que de ello depende para que pueda mantener a su familia.  Por ahora su mayor anhelo es tener un puesto dentro del mercado, ya que donde actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria lo que no le garantiza seguridad. Este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste préstamo muy útil en el progreso de  su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de tubérculos y verduras, de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her two small children. For over ten years she has been selling potatoes, lemons, onions, garlic, tomatoes, and other tubers. She gets up very early in the morning to serve her customers. She finishes work at seven at night. Her husband helps her with the work, although at times he gets the children from school and looks after them. That way they can progress and mutually help each other. Nancy’s priority is to continue working because that is how she is able to support her family. For now her biggest desire is to have a stand inside the market. She currently sells as a street vendor, and that does not guarantee security. This is her tenth loan with MFP. Once again she promises to be responsible with all of her payments. She considers this loan to be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan to buy tubers and vegetables. That way she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tubers wholesale

loans.name: Tibisay

texts.es:
A la orilla de la carretera del municipio de Palmar de Varela, ubicado al Oriente del departamento del Atlántico, vive Tibisay E. M., una muy joven mujer de 23 años que tiene su familia compuesta por el cónyuge e hijo de tres años de edad. Ahí tiene un pequeño almacén, donde compra  y vende  repuestos de bicicleta y con su esposo, y muchas veces su cuñado que está en temporadas de alto volumen de ventas,  presta  el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de este medio de transporte ecológico que es muy usual en este municipio.

Como ella quiere ampliarse al mercado de mantenimiento y  reparación de motos, que su esposo y su cuñado conocen bien, está solicitando su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  por valor de $1.000.000 con el comprará  mofles, rines y retrovisores para motos y además surtirá  su almacén con cadenas, estrellas, guayas y neumáticos para llantas de bicicletas.

Su meta es incluir su servicio de motos y fortalecerlo mas adelante con mucha tecnificación,  ahora su gran desafío es comprar su casa en otro sector,  porque como esta justamente al pie de la carretera   hay mucho ruido y  la contaminación  pudiera afectar a su familia, porque transitan muchos  vehículos que desde otras ciudades del país van a Palmar de Varela o a otras regiones de Colombia.
texts.en:
At the edge of the highway in the town of Palmar de Varela, located in eastern part of the Department of Atlántico, lives Tibisay Escoria M.. She is a young woman who is 23 years of age and has a family consisting of her husband and three year old child. Tibisay has a small shop where she sells bicycle parts with her husband and brother-in-law. This season they have had a high volume of sales. They also provide maintenance and repair services for this mode of ecological transportation which is very common in this area.

Since she wants to expand her market by providing motorcycle repair and maintenance services, which her husband and brother-in-law are familiar with, Tibisay is requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 1,000,000 COP in order to buy motorcycle parts such as mufflers, tires, and mirrors as well as bicycle parts such as chains, cranks, chain guards, and inner tubes for tires.

Her goal is to begin providing motorcycle services and strengthen her business later on by acquiring more technical equipment. At the moment, her greatest challenge is buying a house in a different area because she currently lives near the highway where there is a lot of noise and pollution that could affect her family. Many vehicles from other cities pass through Palmar de Varela on their way to other regions within Colombia.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bicycle & motorcycle parts

loans.name: Anualitte

texts.en:
Annualite is a hard-working 24-year-old married mother of one child. She has a shop in the market that contains new clothes for children and adults and a few pairs of shoes. She has been in this business for 4 years. Annualite’s husband sells second-hand clothes in the market. With this loan, she wishes to buy more new clothes to sell. She hopes that the profits of the business will enable her to buy a piece of land on which she could build a house. 

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La Sra. L. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas y caballeros done tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este oficio el que le ha permitido salir adelante con su esposo e hija y con el que están haciendo el esfuerzo de construir su pequeña casa de habitación. Tiene cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado ocho créditos para invertirlo en su negocio y en la compra de un predio donde están empezando a construir su casa de habitación. El crédito fue solicitado para la compra de ladrillos, zinc, cemento y arena con el fin de terminar de construir su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricruz L. is originally from the town of El Sauce. Her business involves selling new clothing for women and men. Maricruz has been in this business for six years and it has allowed her and family to get ahead. She and her husband are making the effort to build a small house.

Maricruz has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and she has received eight loans that were used for her business and to purchase property on which she can begin the construction of her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bricks, zinc, cement, and sand in order to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, zinc, cement, and sand

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22500FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their first seasonal loan. With this new loan, Fatoumata C. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to plow about one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvest will be sold in Fana and Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and hire help

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children who all go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She rents and lives in a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.
Jalia owns a stall in Owino market selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for eight years and works six days a week. She sells, both retail and wholesale, to all categories of people. Jalia buys clothes from the very market where she works and so doesn’t pay transportation costs. Her main business challenge is seasonality because when it rains she has few customers. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow larger and start importing clothes herself. She also wants to buy her own plot of land. Jalia decided to join Kiva partner, MCDT, because she wanted additional capital. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. In addition to her clothing business, she also earns money from a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Awaou

texts.en: Madame Awaou I. is 39 years old and works selling charcoal and firewood from her home in Lome, Togo. She's been engaged in this activity since 2002. She is 39 years old, married to a chauffeur, and they have 2 children. Madame I. has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more charcoal and firewood. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES. The profits she earns from her sales will allow her to better care for her children and her family.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé, D. Agnès est mariée à LAÏFA Norbert, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis trois ans à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins des enfants. Agnès n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Agnès prépare et vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) accompagné de poissons frits à son domicile. Agnès s'approvisionne en maïs et poissons frais à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Agnès exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter le volume de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Agnès sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Dangbo in the Ouémé department, Agnès D. is married to Norbert Laïfa, a driver. They have three children under their care, of whom two are their own. All the children attend (or have attended) school. Three years ago the family settled in PK10, in the Sèmè-Podji district of Benin. The couple shares responsibility for handling the children’s various needs. Agnès has never been to school. To meet her needs she prepares and sells “akassa” (a local food preparation based on cornstarch) served with fried fish, from her home. Agnès gets her supplies of corn and fresh fish from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Agnès has been running her business for the past nine years and has already been granted two loans that were fully reimbursed. Wishing to increase her turnover and improve customer satisfaction, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, fish, peanut oil and bundles of wood.

loans.name: Miriam Fátima

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Miriam es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta por la ayuda que siempre ha recibido.

Tiene 31 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 15 años y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja con aluminio y vidrio (elabora puertas y ventanas).

Ella tiene un local de comida rápida  en La Pradera en Manta, donde vende salchichas, asados y otros ricos platos que se preparan con la carne de cerdo. También compra chanchos a los cuales los faena en su casa y luego los traslada a su local donde vende la carne y todo los productos que salen del chancho, este trabajo lo realiza con su esposo tres  días a la semana pero su negocio de comida es todos los días desde 14h00 hasta las 19h00.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mesas y sillas para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y que sea reconocido en todo Manta y porque no en el país.
texts.en:
The village bank "Familiar" (Family) meets every 15 days in a town called Colorado, which is a few minutes from Montecristi. In this place, most of the residents have different businesses such as making buttons from tagua (the very hard seed of a palm tree), craftwork, and general business. La señora Miriam is a founding member of the village bank and is pleased with the help she has always received. She is 31 years old. She has been in a common-law marriage for 15 years and has three children. Her husband works with aluminum and glass (making doors and windows). She has a fast food site in La Pradera in Manta where she sells sausages, barbequed meat, and other delicious dishes prepared from pork. She also buys pork which she cuts up at home and then takes to her site to sell the meat and all the products which come from the pork. She does this work with her husband three days a week, but her food site is open every day from 2 p.m. to 7 p.m. This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs and threreby provide more convenience for her customers. Her dream is to expand her business and be recognized throughout Manta and perhaps through all of Ecuador.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Kanyegaramire Tukwatanise, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Sam N. of Kanyegaramire Tukwatanise, Kihihi, is a hardworking and ever-optimistic 29-year-old married father of one child. He operates a business growing and selling agricultural products, especially rice, in Kanyegaramire, Kihihi.
 
With a business longevity span of four years, Sam has managed to significantly sustain and improve on his family’s welfare. To all appearances, his future business prospects are promising, with 300,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly out of his business. He envisions an even greater profit margin as he gets this loan, anticipating being in a position to buy more rice for the business. This will enable him to expand the business by opening up more stores and also being able to earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: Stock of rice for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora X. is forty years old and is married with a husband who is a builder. She has six children, three of whom go to school.

Flora is currently in the business of selling onions and is requesting a loan for more onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

loans.use: Buy more onions to sell

loans.name: Davis

texts.en: Davis, age 21, wants a loan to pay labor costs for workers on his plantations and to buy Irish potato seeds for planting this season. He is a young man who depends on agriculture to make a living. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He dreams of expanding his plantations to increase his income and to be in a position to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To pay labour costs for workers on his plantations and buy Irish potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. is a fishmonger at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been a fishmonger for five years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Darwin Stalin

texts.es:
Darwin Stalin C. G. tiene 23 años. Es soltero  vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Darwin se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta salir a bailar.
texts.en:
Darwin Stalin C. G. is 23 years old. He is single and lives with parents in the territory of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He does not have children.

The members of V.R.C. El LA UNION are located in the district of Aguas Frías, belonging to the territory Ventanas.  This counter is committed to farming of short-cycle planting of corn and rice and beans.  They have been doing this for many years.  

Darwin has devoted his time to farming, especially the planting of corn, rice and beans for three years.  He purchases his products in Ventanas and sells them at the fair in Ventanas and in the same district.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies and fertilizer for crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the changing weather. His dream is to purchase land.  He enjoys dancing.

loans.use: insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Solomon K.. He is married and has 4 children ages 4, 6, 10, and 13. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps with his education.  

In 2000, Solomon K. established his essential drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to increase his income and become self-employed. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month. 

Solomon would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more essential drugs for his store. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to open a larger drug store, open a laboratory, and hire staff. He wants to his educate children to university level and construct a home for his  family. Solomon is hard working and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add  more drugs to his pharmacy shop

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge I. es moto taxista, trabaja hace 3 años, tiene una parada que tiene a su nombre, trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Es un joven muy luchador que esta invirtiendo su dinero para mantener su motocicleta para darle mas buenos servicios a sus clientes.  
Es un ejemplo de joven humilde trabajador  y emprendedor. Valora mucho el apoyo que la institución  le  ha ofrecido con este préstamo y asegura que sera siempre un buen cliente. 
Solita el prestamo para la compra de repuestos y acceorios para la moto.
texts.en:
Jorge I. provides taxi services with his motorbike.  He has been doing this job for 3 years.  He has his own stand and works from 5.00am to 8.00pm.  He is a very hard-working young man who is investing his money in maintaining his motorbike so that he can provide his customers with a better service.

Jorge is the very model of a hard-working and enterprising young man.  He greatly values the support that our institution has offered him with this loan and he assures us that he will always be a good client.  He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married to Joshua and together they have one child aged four years old. They live in a place called Mukuyuni in Makueni town.This is a rural town set up. 

Mercy operates a beauty hair salon. She has been in this business for five years now. With this loan, she plans to buy some hair and beauty products so as to stock her salon. 

With the profits she will get from this loan, Mercy plans to expand her services by opening another hair saloon in a nearby center.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon with seats for Kshs 15,000, hair products for Ksh 15,000, and other accessories for Kshs 20,000

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has 8 dependants. She has not received any form of education. Nana sells food items such as maize and gari at Elmina. She has been selling gari and maize for 4 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Nana uses her income to pay part of the utilities and maintanance of the house. 

Nana will use the loan to purchase more food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to add the sale of food items to her business. The picture shows Nana scooping out some amount of gari.

loans.use: Nana will use the loan to purchase more food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos (04 dependientes y 01 independientes), la señora solo estudió educación primaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta D. prendas D. vestir.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar casacas, chompas, mantas,  seis juegos D. polleras y otros. Lucila  trabaja sola, su esposo es músico 
Su sueño para el futuro es crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the communal bank, "Inka Wasi" located in the district of Puno, a Puno province in the Puno section.  She is 56 years old and is married with 5 children (4 are dependent on her and 1 is independent).  Lucila only completed elementary education and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 4 years.  Her first loan was of 300.00 neuvos soles, money which she invested in her clothing business.  She is soliciting a new loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles, money she will be using to purchase: jackets, sweaters, blankets, 6 sets of skirts and other things. Lucila works alone, her husband is a musician.
Her future dreams are to grow the business and improve her earnings.
What she likes about her communal bank is the punctuality and what she gains from the savings.

loans.use: Purchase jackets, sweaters, blankets, and 6 sets of skirts, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her fish vending

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es: Balbino, de 56 años es un hombre responsable. Junto a su esposa Adela y sus 2 hijos, vive en armonía familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. El trabajo al que se dedica esté laborioso hombre, es la agricultura. Ya tiene 40 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, por lo que manifiesta que seguirá trabajando en esta actividad, ya que le ha generado ganancias que le ha ayudado sostener a su familia. Su trabajo requiere de un constante cuidado, fertilizarlos, de eso depende para su comercialización. Por otro lado y adicional al trabajo que tiene, también se dedica al traslado de productos hacia el mercado central de Tarma y con la ayuda de su camioneta. Por ahora ha sembrado papa, en la variedad, yungay, única y pericholi, sobre 7 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, y por lo que espera seguir ampliando sus cultivos para que pueda cosechar en cantidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo contante que recibió. Balbino, dentro de muy pronto cosechará varios sacos de papa de todas las variedades, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Balbino, 56, is a responsible man.  Together with his wife, Adela, and two children he lives in family harmony in his own house located in La Libertad’s San Juan hamlet.  The work this hard working man does is farming.  He has 40 years experience planting potato in all its varieties so he intends to continue in this line of work since it has generated profits that helped him support his family.

His work requires constant care and fertilizing; this is what his sales depend on.  On the other hand, in addition to the work he does, he also works hauling products to Tarma’s Central Market with his truck.  For now, he’s planted potatoes of the Yungay, Unica and Pericholi varieties on seven hectares of farmland.  He expects to continue to expand his plantings in order to harvest large amounts.

He is a member of the “Capital Semillera” (Seed Capital) communal bank and this is the seventh loan with MFP where he appreciates the constant help he gets.  Balbino will be harvesting several sacks of potatoes of all varieties soon so is thinking of using the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Kiribedda Savings And Credit Farmers Group-Mityana

texts.en: B. Said is 63 years old and is now 2 years down the road in his charcoal sales business in Bujeeru-Mityana. He says he began this business after moral support from one of his closest friends. Before that Said, who is married with 12 kids, was a farmer. Weekly, this business brings in 40,000 UGX profits and he says with this loan he is going to purchase more firewood to burn and make more charcoal. Said belongs to Kiribedda Savings and Credit Farmers Group-Mityana.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to make more charcoal

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 38 years old and married with three children.  He runs a boutique so as to earn a living.  It's five years since he started the business.  He has employed one person in his business.  He also does dairy farming so as to supplement his family’s income.  

Harrison hopes to succeed in his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Merly Jacquelina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Girasoles, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Merly, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido se dedica a la  albañilería.

Ella es una ama de casa que se dedica a  la venta de ropa y a la  elaboración y venta de bolos (helados de hielo en funda), tiene su negocio en su casa donde  produce y vende bolos de distintos sabores, trabaja tres días a la semana en las ventas ropa y esto lo hace por las mañanas y en las tardes y el resto de la semana se  dedica a preparar sus deliciosos  bolos de distintos sabores que son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 7 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios que le da la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Girasoles (Sunflowers) meets every fifteen days in the El Progreso district of the city of Portoviejo. This is a heavily populated district on the edge of the city. It is known as the jail district, since the women's jail of Portoviejo is in this sector. 

Here we meet Señora Merly. She is 30 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage that has produced two children, ages 8 and 3. The older child is in school. Her husband works as a mason.

She is a housewife who sells clothing and also prepares and sells "bolos" (frozen treats sold in a wrapper). She runs her business from her home, where she produces and sells bolos of different flavors. She works three days a week selling clothing in the morning and in the afternoon, and the rest of the week she works preparing her delicious bolos of different flavors, which are greatly requested by her customers.
