This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other clothing items. She has been a member of her communal bank for seven loan cycles, and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and other clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Adolyn

texts.en:
Adolyn O. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Adolyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Adolyn owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice, cheese & cassava cakes in the local community. Adolyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Adolyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs & milk. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Adolyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of thrm accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs & milk

loans.name: Fuerza Total (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Fuerza Total. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señorita Sindy, tiene 21años de edad, está soltera y por sus estudios vive en casa de unos familiares. Ella estudia auditoria en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, está en octavo semestre de esta carrera.

Ella es una gran estudiante que para poder obtener recursos para continuar con sus estudios se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque también trabaja a base de pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, nos cuenta que tiene varios clientes que siempre le piden su  mercadería ya que lo que ella ofrece es un producto muy bueno y además  les da facilidades de pago, trabaja todos los  días por las mañanas, recorre los lugares donde tiene  sus clientes y en las noches ella  vende  a sus compañeras de clases, sus productos los va a comprar cada vez que puede y necesita a Colombia. Lleva tres anos que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para ir a Colombia y comprar ropa de todo tipo como: blusas, pantalones, camisetas, ropa de niños, etc. Este es su primer ciclo en  el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los  créditos.
 
Su sueño es realizarse como profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "Fuerza Total", meaning "Total Force" meet in the city of Portoviejo every two weeks. They have diverse business activities, including commerce in general, service, and others. They grouped their efforts to be able to access the benefits granted by Fundacion Espoir. It is their first loan cycle with the communal bank and they plan on proceeding successfully to keep moving forward with the institution.

Here we meet Sindy. She is 21 years old, single and during her studies she lives with her family. She is studying to be an Auditor at the Universidad Tecnica de Manabi. She is on her eighth semester of her career.

She is a great student and to be able to continue with her studies she works as a merchant. She sells clothing of all types. She sells door to door although she also works by taking orders from her clients. She says that she has various clients who always request merchandise from her, given that she always has very good products and for her payment plants. She works every day in the mornings, traveling to the locations where her clients are and in the evenings she sells to her school colleagues. She goes to purchase her products whenever she can or needs to, in Colombia. She has three years in the business and it has gone very well.

This loan will be used to go to Colombia to buy clothing of all types, such as: blouses, pants, t-shirts, children's clothing, etc. This is her first loan cycle with the communal bank and she is the president of the group. She appreciates the easy loan process.

Her dream is to establish herself as a professional.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, t-shirts, and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 45 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad con los cuales vive en un caserío llamado Los Peches a 10 minutos del distrito de Mochumi, Héctor cuenta con casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios  básicos  

Héctor se dedica a la  comercialización de ganado vacuno, caprino y  ovino, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla en desde sus domicilio en ocasiones distribuye sus animales en caseríos cercanos al distrito de Mochumi.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 9 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio.

Héctor está solicitando un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para el engorde de su ganado vacuno, con el préstamo comprara alimento para dicho ganado, medicina y adecuará corrales para tal fin.

Héctor es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, el desea poder crecer como empresario y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Héctor is 45 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  He lives with his family in a small village called Los Peches, which is located 10 minutes from Mochumi district.  Héctor owns his own home which is connected to basic services.

Héctor sells cattle, goats and sheep which he raises in pens that are located outside his home.  He runs his business from home and sometimes sells his animals in nearby villages in Mochumi district.  Héctor has been in this business for nine years.  He has gained experience in this field and also regular customers.

Héctor is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to fatten his cattle.  He will use his loan to buy feed and medicine for his cattle.  He will also carry out some work on their pens.

Héctor is an entrepreneurial and responsible person who would like to be able to grow as a businessman and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Villa Concepción Group

texts.es:
El comité Villa Concepción, con 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La mayoría de sus integrantes realiza actividades productivas. Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso, entre otras.
La Sra Silvia, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, muy temprano, todos los días, se dirige a su local para poder elaborar y`posteriormente vender los alimentos que prepra. Ella, al igual que las miembros, anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación, y asi otorgarles un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, aguas, jugos e insumos para la elaboración de alimentos.
texts.en:
The Villa Concepción Communal Bank started three years ago.  The communal bank has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya for three years.  Most of the members are engaged in productive activities.  Among their business activities is the sale of handmade food like meat empenadas, chicken empenadas, and ham and cheese empanadas, among others.

Silvia is a tenacious and hard-working woman.  Every day she leaves very early to go to her place of business to be able to make, and later sell, the food that she prepares.  Silvia, the same as the other members, yearns for a better future for her children.  That is why they double their efforts in order to provide the materials for their children's development and education.  This way they will give the children a better future.

She is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks, beer, water, juice, and supplies for making food.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, water, juice, and supplies for making food.

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Eveling Del Carmen tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, ella tiene 54 años y es casada. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Eveling trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes y tratamientos. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eveling Del Carmen’s business is selling Cosmetics.  She is 54 years old and married.  She does her domestic chores every day before going out to sell her various products.  Eveling works from 8am until 8pm because she’s always looking for ways to improve her income.

She’s asking for the loan to buy powder, cream, perfume and treatments.  She commits to make her installment payments according to the established payment plan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a hard-working farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  He is married and has 9 children.  He tills his own land where he grows rice and vegetables.  Dionesio sells his harvest in nearby towns.

Dionesio plans to use his loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor of the farmers he hired to help tills his land.  In the future, Dionesio hopes to manage a bigger farm and have enough money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her products in her restaurant business.

Maria has been in this business for 36 years. Maria earns additional income from another business, a sari-sari  (general) store.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Agnes has run a poultry farm. She is a member of BRAC’s, small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.
 	
Agnes is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase chickens to sell. With the help of her loan, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Agnes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло разведенная женщина и любящая мать 4 детей. Она продает женскую и подростковую одежду на рынке более 10 лет. Шахло просит займ в размере $2800 долларов США на приобретение дополнительных товаров. Она хочет расширить ассортимент своих продаваемых товаров. Шахло стремится расширить свой бизнес, поскольку это единственный источник дохода для ее семьи. Она считает, что этот займ будет очень полезно для дальнейшего роста своего бизнеса.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Shahlo is a divorced woman and the loving mother of four children. She  has been selling women’s and teens' clothing at a market for over 10 years. Ludmila is requesting a loan for $2800 in order to buy additional stock. She would like to expand her selection of goods. Ludmila’s goal is to grow her business as this is the only source of income for her family. She believes that this loan will be very beneficial for the growth of her business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 58 años, es un hombre dichoso, pues convive con Olivia, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos mayores e independientes. Ahora viven solos su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). La fuerza y seriedad que proyecta, son los pilares para su progreso. Pues desde muy joven comenzó a forjarse un destino para él y su familia. Es por eso que todas las mañanas desde hace 22 años, el restaurante del señor Pedro; ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, en un lugar céntrico. Abre sus puertas para deleitarnos con los ricos platos criollos y típicos del lugar, pues según afirma, su esposa; la señora Olivia, tiene una exquisita sazón. La dedicación por sus hijos lo motivó a salir adelante y continuar trabajando con mucho ahínco.  Aunque ya no los tiene a su lado, él está orgulloso de verlos salir adelante y ser independientes, por todo ello está planeando invertir en el negocio de arrendamiento de cuartos; con ello espera seguir trabajando para mantenerse activo y vivir por muchos años, en compañía de sus hijos y nietos, que es su principal incentivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Capelo” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y muy cumplida, pues es secretario de su banco comunal. Pedro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de calaminas que mejorarán la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro, 58, is a cheerful man who lives with his wife, Olivia.  They have two adult children who live independently.  The couple lives in their own house in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central forest).  The strength and seriousness that he projects are the pillars of his progress.  From a very early age he began carving out his and his family's future.  Every day for 22 years Pedro's restaurant, which is located in the city market, has opened its doors to offer delicious creole and typical local dishes.  According to his wife, Olivia, they have a wonderful flavor.  

His dedication to his children is what encouraged him to get ahead and continue working so hard.  Even though they are no longer living with him, he is very proud to see how they have progressed and become independent.  Therefore he is planning to invest in a room rental business.  He hopes to be able to continue working to stay active and live a long time with his children and grandchildren, his main incentive. He belongs to the communal bank "Pioneros de Capelo" and this is his tenth loan through MFP.  He is known there as a very responsible, committed person and acts as secretary of the communal bank.  Pedro plans to use the loan to buy corrugated iron to improve his businesses infrastructure.

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron for his food stall.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. Shirly also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells various items like vinegar, detergent, soap, and soy sauce.

Shirly requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is from the village of Gogasheni, South Georgia. He is 35 years old, married, and lives with his family: wife Nino, 9-year-old son, 7-year-old daughter, and mother (retired). His children go to school. Nino works as a teacher in the village. Revaz is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. They have six milk cows. Revaz and Nino produce and sell on average 120 kg of cheese per month. It is sold locally to the dairy-products retailers. They also have 7.5 hectares of land, where they grow potatoes, barley, and wheat. They sell harvested vegetables and corn locally to the greengrocery retailers. The family's average monthly income is 1100 GEL, including Revaz's mother's pension. 

Revaz requested credit to purchase a tractor. He will provide tilling services to neighborhood farms to earn additional income. He will also significantly reduce the cost of cultivating his own lands by using his own tractor. Revaz plans to use the additional income for further development of his farm. The additional income will also allow the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59, married and has four adult children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they aim to uplift their status of living and give their children a better future. She aims to strengthen her variety store to earn a higher income and satisfy their necessities. 

To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital of P7,000 to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell. She hopes that this loan will help a lot to improve her variety store. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos independientes.  Estudió solo la primaria (incompleto).
	
Jacinta trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas.

Su nuevo préstamo será de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles con lo que comprará cuatro cajas de tuna (fruta) para su respectiva venta. Nos cuenta que ella se ayuda económicamente lavando ropa ajena y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de ladrillos.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar cada vez sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the 'Las Amigas' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are independent.  Jacinta only studied at elementary school and did not complete her studies there.

Jacinta has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos loans for five years.  She invested her previous loan for 200 soles in her fruit-selling business.

Jacinta will use her new loan for 200 soles to buy four boxes of prickly pear (a fruit) to sell.  She tells us that she makes additional money washing other people's clothes and her husband works for a brick company.

Jacinta would like to continue in her business and continue improving her income.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of prickly pear

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom, a 59 year-old married mother of two children, is a very hardworking farmer who grows rice crops in the rainy season of the year. She also takes some time besides farming to buy and resell her bamboo baskets in various places together with her husband. Through those businesses, she can generate a profit of $2.5 per day. 

Saom is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a few plots of farmland.  She will be able to grow more rice crops and make more profit for her family. 
In the future, she will greatly expand her basket-selling business if she has a good market place.

loans.use: to purchase a few plots of farmland.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Alusine, a small businessman in Makeni city. 

Alusine is asking for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to invest in his business. The 35 year old is a native of Kambia town. He is married to a businesswoman and has four children. Alusine sells provisions including milk, sardines, luncheon meat, drinks, biscuits, and bottled water. He has been in business for four years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shop, including milk, sardines, luncheon meat, drinks, biscuits, and bottled water.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 29-year-old single man who owns a house without electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Joshua has operated a bread-selling business for the past year. He sells his bread to the local villagers and to retail shop owners. He faces a major challenge of transportation. 

With a loan of KES 20,000, he wants to purchase more bread for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business, which is his dream.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en: Rawya is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They both work to be able to fulfill their needs and demands.  She opened her own mini market in 2008. She also sells gifts in addition to some artisan products.  As for her husband, he’s benefiting from his retirement compensation. In parallel, he’s working as a farmer and has 21 years of experience in this domain. Today she’s requesting to borrow $1900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu wants a loan to buy cows for slaughtering. He is a butcher living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by working for his father and now has his own business. His desire is to educate his children and save for a wedding. He is 32 years old and is married with four children. In the future, he intends to move the business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman who has three children. Anecita is 35 years old and resides in Tinago, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Anecita owns & operates boarding house services to local community member to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to invest in renovating her boarding house. 

In 2011, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Anecita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to invest in renovating her boarding house

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 54 years old and married with five children. Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, school supplies and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Twiyiteho Group

texts.en:
Berancile is 56 years old and married to a businessman. They both have six children who all go to school. Berancille is a group leader of “TWIYITEHO,” meaning “Work for our own” in English. She sells different items in her boutique, which she has been running for 20 years. 

She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, maize, and bananas for sale. She would like to use the profits for building up savings. Berancille in the picture holds a blue book as an identification as the group leader.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale such as beans, maize, and bananas.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old married man that describes himself as determined.  For 3 years he has operated a transport business transporting customers using his motorcycle.  His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents.

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow for dairy farming. This will enable him earn extra income through the sell of milk. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will serve his customers well.  

This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to invest more in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in Hoima, Uganda.  She is married with three children; all of them attend school. She owns a produce business selling rice, beans, nuts and maize, and makes extra income from rentals. She started her business to take care of her family.  Her major challenge is competition.  She is hardworking and will use the loan to buy more rice, beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Rodha

texts.en:
Rodah, 33, is a smallholder poultry farmer who lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This mother of 4 has been farming poultry for 2 years now. Besides poultry, she also keeps dairy cows and grows tea, among other crops. 

Rodah is seeking a loan investment of KES 15,000 to buy more poultry. More hens will lay more eggs which means Rodah will have more chicks and eggs for sale. The aged and less productive hens will be sold for meat and feathers. 

The additional income from the investment will go to her children's education which currently is Rodah's highest monthly expense. She believes that through education, her children will lead an improved quality of life in future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Dogbo Pierrette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Ibrahim . Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Dogbo Pierrette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Dogbo Pierrette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Dogbo Pierrette vend depuis trois ans des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. De façon secondaire, Dogbo Pierrette  vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Dogbo Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Dogbo Pierrette et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase energy-saving charcoal stocks for her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Ángela has been working with her business for one year and a half. "I have my business in my home, so the space is very small and I would like to expand a little, now that everything has been set up well. That way I can buy more merchandise and have a place for to fit it in." I am requesting $1000.00 to expand my business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Ángela tiene 1 año y medio con su negocio “Mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa así es que el espacio es muy pequeño y me gustaría ampliarme un poco ya que tengo todo muy amontonado y así poder compras más mercancía y tener donde acomodarla”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar mi negocio.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es:
Juan Filiberto is from Pedro Escobedo in the state of Queretaro. He is the oldest out of 3 brothers. His father, who was always irresponsible, abandoned his family when Juan was very young and his brothers were very small. In order to provide for his mother and two younger brothers, Juan started his own business by selling seasonal fruit. With the motivation to improve his family's living conditions, he worked very hard and everyday he would go to the nearby communities to sell his products. Currently, Juan is married and has children of his own. He wants to provide for his children like a good father should, and he struggles each day to make sure his family is well-taken care of. His sales have increase due to his extensive experience.

In order to satisfy his customer demand and to cover a wider selling range, Juan is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he will use to purchase more fruit. He will repay this amount within 6 months. Help Juan with his growing business. Juan and his family greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Filiberto es originario de Pedro Ecobedo en el estado de Querétaro, él es el mayor de tres hermanos, su padre siempre fue irresponsable y abandonó a su familia, Juan era muy joven y sus hermanos pequeños, para poder sacar adelante a su madre y hermanos inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas de temporada, el deseo de mejorar las condiciones en las que vivía su familia lo impulsaban a trabajar arduamente, todos los días salía a las comunidades cercanas a ofrecer sus productos. Ahora Juan tiene su esposa e hijos y quiere poder darles lo mejor como padre, por lo que se esfuerza mucho hoy en día, la amplia experiencia que tiene en su negocio le ha ayudado mucho a incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar su zona de ventas, Juan solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Juan a dar el siguiente paso en su negocio, él y su familia agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal fruit

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng S. N. is 28 years old. She is married with 1 child and was born in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To cover her family’s expenses, she sells Khmer traditional cakes and different kinds of biscuits in her community, earning around $2 each day of profit, while her husband generates on average $4 each day from working as a soldier. Mrs Seng S. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase more biscuits for her inventory. She would also like to build a fence around her house to keep her family safe

loans.use: To  purchase more biscuits for her inventory and build a fence around her house

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan was born in the city of Baku. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He rents a shop in Lokbatan settlement and trades (sells) food stuff. His business is new; only a year ago he started this business. He invested a lot into his business in the beginning. Now he has few of his own funds to keep up the variety and assortment of goods. He applied to Normicro Baku branch for a loan in amount of 900 AZN (about $1075 USD) to invest in his business and increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital to improve the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase turnover and the amount of goods for sale

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Emiliana’s business is located at Bolognesi Square in the city of Juliaca. She is next to its small “ carretita” stand selling with much joy caramels, chocolates, cakes, drinks etc. Emiliana sells its merchandise from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day of the week. The greater wish of this laborious mother is to see how her four smaller children turn out to be excellent professionals. This is her motivation and the reason to work and put all her effort each day. She is the only person who provides for her family.

The desire of this charming mother is to extend her stand, so she can increase the amount and variety of merchandise. In order to be able to do this she is asking for a loan of $ 525 and is committed to return it in a lapse of six months. With your generous contribution you will be able to support Mrs. Emiliana.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

En la Plaza Bolognesi, D. la ciudad D. Juliaca encontramos a doña Emiliana al lado D. su pequeña carretita vendiendo con mucha alegría caramelos, chocolates, galletas, bebidas etc. Emiliana oferta su mercadería desD. las 8:00 D. la mañana hasta las 8:00 D. la noche durante todos los días D. la semana, el deseo más granD. que tiene esta laboriosa madre es ver convertidos en unos excelentes profesionales a sus cuatro hijos menores, con ese fin trabaja y se esfuerza día a día, puesto que es la única persona que vela por el bienestar D. su familia. El deseo D. esta encantadora madre es ampliar su carretita para aumentar la cantidad y variedad D. mercadería, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo D. dinero que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. Con tu generoso aporte podrás apoyar a la señora Emiliana.

loans.use:
To  extend its small space of sales to offer greater amount and variety of articles.
Ampliación de su pequeño espacio de ventas para ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos.

loans.name: Alizaman

texts.en:
Mr. Alizaman has little income. He is 53, married with 4 children, and lives in the town of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. For 4 years, Alizaman has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar in Saatli. The business is stable because Alizaman has many repeat customers.

But he doesn't have enough profit to purchase and sell a greater variety of goods, and thus increase his income so he can provide all the necessities of life for his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral for loans, but Alizaman has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500. This loan would let him to buy and sell more goods and so develop his .business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells to increase his business

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
The kitchen is a place where women are in the majority, but few are able to turn this activity into a business like Neri. More than four years ago she opened in her community and tourist center of the Central jungle a cozy restaurant in which she offers typical dishes from the jungle: juanes, tacacho and other delicious dishes. This business has helped her buy a small plot of land and a little house where she now runs her restaurant. Despite the restaurant’s great success, Neri needs a loan to acquire utensils and other items to decorate and run her business. We hope your cooperation and understanding is immediate and beneficial for Neri.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La cocina es un lugar donde la mayoría de mujeres está presente, pero pocas son las que pueden hacer de esta actividad un negocio como Neri, que desde hace más de 4 años abrió en su comunidad y centro turístico de la selva Central un acogedor restaurante de platos típicos de la selva en los que ofrece: juanes, tacacho y demás platillos deliciosos.Este negocio de venta de comida la ha ayudado a comprarse un pequeño terreno y casita en el que ahora está implementado su restaurante.Pese a la gran acogida Neri requiere de un préstamo con los que desea adquirir utensilios y demás cosas para decorar e implementar su negocio esperamos que su colaboración y comprensión sea inmediata y beneficiosa para Neri.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and other items.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.es:
Sofía, Angélica and Victoria have belonged to the Ccori Soncco Communal Bank ("Heart of Gold") for one, one and two years respectively.

Sofía is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She travels to the regional fairs once a week to sell fruits and purchase grains and potatoes to sell at the local market.

Angélica is 34 years old, married and has three children. She travels to the fairs to sell fruits and vegetables, and to purchase grains to sell at the local market.

Victoria is 35 years old, married and has four children. She sells vegetables at retail in the local market.

Sofía, Angélica and Victoria need loans of 600 soles ($350 approx.), 800 soles ($500), and 600 soles, respectively, which they will use to purchase bananas, oranges, grains, rice, sugar, oil, salt, cilantro and spinach.

The dreams of Sofía, Angélica and Victoria are to build a home, enlarge their business and for their children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sofía, Angélica y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón D. Oro” hace 1, 1, 2 años respectivamente.

Sofía es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Sofía viaja a L. feria una vez por semana donD. venD. frutas y D. L. feria compra cereales, papa, productos que venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Por otro lado Angélica es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Angélica viaja a las ferias donD. venD. verduras, frutas y en las ferias compra cereales que venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Victoria es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Victoria venD. verduras por menor en el mercado Nery García.

Sofía, Angélica y Victoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. plátano, naranja, cereales, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, culantro y espinaca.

Los sueños D. Sofía, Angélica y Victoria son construir su casa, tener negocios más grandes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, grains, rice, sugar, oil, salt, cilantro and spinach / Sofía, Angélica y Victoria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano, naranja, cereales, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, culantro y espinaca.

loans.name: Sauda Nakumiza`s Group

texts.en:
Sauda is the leader of a group of five members. She is 30 years old and married with four children aged 11, 8, 6, and 3 years, all of whom are in school. The community she lives in is semi-urban. Sauda makes samosas, pancakes and chapattis, which she supplies to the nearby shops. Proceeds are collected in the evenings to purchase ingredients for the following day’s work, and there is a ready market for her goods. One of the challenges Sauda faces is the rising price of wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients she uses to make her products.

Her business has enabled her to pay school fees, increase stock, and contribute to the running of the home. The family has moved out of the low-lying area where they were renting to their newly-built house in a better environment. Sauda has paid back more than five loans, and with this latest one she plans to increase her stock and buy saucepans, plates, chairs, a charcoal stove and other implements for the new eating-place she intends to open.

loans.use: She plans to increase her stock and buy saucepans, plates, chairs, a charcoal stove and other implements for the new eating-place she intends to open.

loans.name: Thi Thuy

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Thúy (MS: 050029), 43 years old, has two school aged children. She, with her group, already had one loan which successfully paid off. Her family’s income is 100,000VND a day. She said she liked loan that has weekly payment plan. She is applying for a loan of 2,242,000VND to fund her pork stand at the open market. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lê Thị Hoàn (MS: 050030) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Ninh (MS: 050031) applies for a loan to fund her pork stand.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mỳ (MS: 050032) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thục (MS: 050034) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Dung (MS: 050035) applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Đặng Thị Chinh (MS: 050050) applies for a loan to fund her pork stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Trần Thị Thúy (MS: 050029), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô có hai con còn đang đi học. Cô cung với cả nhóm đã vay được 1 chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả xong. Mức thu nhập của gia đình cô là 100.000/ngày. Cô rất thích trả dần hàng tuần. Cô vay 2.242.000 để lấy vốn buôn bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Chị Lê Thị Hoàn (MS: 050030), vay 2.242.000 VND lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ninh (MS: 050031), vay 2.242.000 VND đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỳ (MS: 050032), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Thục (MS: 050034), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Nguyễn Thị Dung (MS: 050035), vay 2.242.000 VND chăn nuôi lợn Chị Đặng Thị Chinh (MS: 050050), vay 2.006.000 VND đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn

loans.use: to invest in businesses

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Señor Dionicio is 54 years old. He is married to Jorgelina Bejarano, age 54, who works as a employee to help him with the expenses of the house and the studies of their children. They have four children, of which two are grown and professional and two are studying in college.

Dionicio is a plumber. He began at an early age helping his uncle from whom he learned the trade of plumbing. After eight years he became independent, working for his own account. Already he has worked more than 25 years. Nowadays he counts on a clientele drawn by the quality of his work. He is valued by his clients fpor the great sacrifice that he performs, since he lives up to his responsibilities in spite of the cold and the rain. Nowadays he works with a nephew to whom he teaches the profession.

He needs the loan for the purchase of a case of tools for plumbing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionicio tiene 54 años, está casado con Jorgelina Bejarano de 54 años de edad quien trabaja como empleada para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa y estudio de sus hijos. Tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores y profesionales y dos están estudiando en la Facultad.

Dionicio es plomero, él empezó desde temprana edad ayudando a su tío de quien aprendió el oficio de plomería y del cual luego de ocho años se independizó para trabajar por su propia cuenta hace ya más de 25 años. Hoy día cuenta con clientela formada por la calidad de su trabajo y valorado por sus clientes por el gran sacrificio que realiza, ya que cumple con su responsabilidad a pesar del frío y la lluvia. Hoy en día trabaja con él un sobrino a quien le enseña la profesión.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de un maletín de herramientas para plomería.

loans.use: To buy a case of tools for plumbing

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) Group

texts.es:
The New Hope group was formed thanks to Mrs. Gladys Rosso, a former member of another group of borrowers, who contacted her friends and neighbors to form the current group. Sara Rosso, as well as the majority of the other group members, has a small shop in the Abasto market.

The group consists of 17 women from different neighborhoods. They are engaged in various activities such as the sale of clothing, garlic, cafeterias, etc. and also work cleaning houses and offices in order to obtain a fixed weekly or monthly income.

The women are seeking loans of ~$225 per person. They need the loans in order to purchase clothing, consumer goods, food, etc. to sell. This group has already benefited from one loan from Kiva which they invested in each of their businesses to improve their incomes and grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité fue la señora Gladys Rosso, ex integrante de otro comité la que inicio el contacto con las demás integrantes. La señora contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité. Sara Rosso tiene un pequeño copetín dentro del Mercado de Abasto, como así también la mayoría de las integrantes tienen su local de venta dentro del Mercado de Abasto.

El comité esta constituido por 17 señoras de diferentes zonas. Las señoras tienen actividades diversas como venta de ropas, ajo, comedores, despensas y también realizan trabajo como limpieza de casas y oficinas con lo que logran obtener un ingreso semanal o mensual fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito en promedio de 900.000 guaraníes cada una. Ellas solicitan el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículos de primera necesidad, y otros. Para su posterior venta. Este grupo ya fue beneficiado por un préstamo a través de Kiva, el cual habían invertido en sus respectivas actividades logrando grandes beneficios y crecimiento en sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, fabric, tobacco, flour, sugar, garlic, noodles, soft drinks, cosmetics, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S., 60, and his wife, Mrs. Loeung Nget, 58, live in a small village off of National Road Two about eighteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Four children are garment factory workers, and the other two children study in a local school.

Soeun has been a motorbike repairer for fifteen years. He runs his business from his shop in the village, while his wife raises pigs at home. Everyday many customers come to his shop, and he needs to buy more spare parts to serve them, but lacks the money. Therefore, Soeun is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for his business and to buy piglets for his wife to raise at home.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for resale and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 42 años, enviudó hace 1 año nada más y vive con dos de sus hijos ya que tuvo cuatro en total. Las otras dos hijas ya son mayores e independientes y se encuentran trabajando en España. Desde allí le envían dinero todos los meses.

Provenía de una familia muy humilde, por tal motivo solo pudo terminar la primaria.

Ana María posee una despensa muy bien surtida que funciona en su casa hace 3 años, aunque se dedica al comercio desde hace mucho tiempo, prácticamente toda la vida.

Recuerda que sus inicios como comerciante fueron muy duros y que con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacerse de capital para montar su propio negocio.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada y prácticamente no tiene competencia debido a que su despensa es la única del barrio.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para surtir mejor su negocio con la compra de mercaderías varias como: arroz, azúcar, harina, fideos, panificados, etc.
texts.en:
Ana María is 42 years old, widowed for 1 year and she lives with two of her four children. The other two daughters are now grown and independent, working in Spain. From there they send money to Ana María every month. She comes from a humble family and could only finish primary school. Ana María has owned a well-stocked convenience store in her home for 3 years, although she has been in sales for much longer, practically her whole life. She remembers her beginnings as a businesswoman were very hard and that with great effort she was able to earn money to start her own business. Today she has a well established customer base and practically no competition as her store is the only one in the neighborhood. Now she needs a loan to better stock her business with the purchase of various merchandise such as: rice, sugar, flour, noodles, baked goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Damaris Azucena

texts.es: La señora Damaris Azucena tiene la edad de 34 años habita en San Antonio Sur, es casada, su marido le ayuda con los gastos de la casa ya que tienen a su cargo 3 hijos, la señora Damaris trabaja como conserje en sporting club desde hace dos años, su sueños es tener mejor condición de vida  ya que viven en cuarto muy pequeños y quieren agrandarlo un poco, por lo cual ella nos solicita un C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Ms. Damaris Azucena C. is 34 years old and lives in San Antonio Sur. She is married, and her husband helps her with the household expenses because they have to look after 3 children. Ms. Damaris has been working as a receptionist in a sporting club for three years. She dreams of having better living conditions because she and her family live in a very small room, and they want to expand it a little, which is why she is requesting C$ 6,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas in order to purchase construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for room improvements

loans.name: Boun

texts.en:
Mrs. Boun D. is 28 years old and operates her business by collecting hair around her commune, and wholesales to hairdressers for a daily income. She is the mother of one young child. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Srey, 29, is a motorcycle taxi driver who provides his service to passengers around his commune and currently earns $2.64 a day.

Boun hopes to enlarge her investment and she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more hair to store and resell. The borrowers live in Chroneang Commune, Kompong Tom Province. (Mrs. Boun's husband is pictured, because she was not available that time).

loans.use: To buy more hair to store and resale

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat S. is married and has three children. She lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is engaged in the family business of raising livestock. Mrs. S. Inobat is skilled in the livestock business, having done this for 10 years. She takes care of a milk cow and also sells the milk to the collective farm and makes yogurt products. 

Mrs. S. Inobat dreams of having sheep to make yarn. Now Mrs. Inobat S. asks KIVA for business support of a loan of 2000 STJ over six months for the purchase of special dairy-making equipment that permits her to increase the production and sale of yogurt products.

loans.use: Purchase of special yogurt making equipment

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Marlene Esperanza A. G. tiene 48 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que dejo de ejercer cuando se caso, tiene 02 hijos que ya no dependen económicamente de ella.
Marlene se dedica a la venta de chocolates, bijouteri y sandalias, negocio que inicio ayudando a su esposo en la confección de sandalias, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro material para la fabricación de chocolate y luego también para bijouteri, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de sandalias.
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de materiales para sandalias y bijouteri para su negocio.
Marlene sueña con tener una empresa de calzado y le gustaría conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Ms. Marlene Esperanza A. G. is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She earned an Executive Secretarial certificate, but she stopped practicing her profession when she got married. She has 2 independent children.

Marlene sells chocolate, costume jewelry and sandals for a living, a business which she started by helping her husband make sandals. With the profits she earned, she purchased ingredients to make chocolate, and later also materials to make costume jewelry. She runs her business from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Palmeras”—in purchasing materials to make sandals.

She will invest this 400.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, in purchasing materials to make sandals and costume jewelry for her business.

Marlene dreams of having her own shoe company and of traveling to the Cuzco region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for sandal and costume jewelry production

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is thirty one year old she is married and mother of two children. All her kids are in school. She lives at Abofour a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She was formerly in the next two towns from Abofour but relocated as a result of her husband and the market where she trades. Abofour is a busy farming community. 

She has been selling food for the past 7 years in taking care of her family. She sells gari and beans with ripe plantain in the community market at Abofour. Gari and beans is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it contains lots of protein and it is also affordable to buy.

Elizabeth business is doing well due to human relation and the tasty meal she sells. The market day for the community is every Thursday so after the said day business begins to slow down. Her major challenge has to do with funds to make business progress.

Elizabeth wants the loan to buy food stuffs like gari, plantain, beans, charcoal etc. to restock her inventory. It has also being her dream to save more from her business proceeds in taking care of the children in school. Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food stuffs like gari, plantains and beans etc.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod O., born in 1960 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, is married and has a large family. Engaged in the livestock business for 20 years, he works with his wife producing and selling milk products. Murod is now requesting a loan of 1500 STJ for six months to purchase equipment to facilitate the production of milk. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To purchase milking equipment.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
S. is 57 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of seven children: the oldest two are married and live separately, the second two are single and work with Saroun in her business, and the last three are students. She is married to Aiy, 73, who earns a living fishing along the Mekong river.

S. gets up early every morning to gather the fish from her husband and other fisherman in bulk and then hurries them to the market. She has many customers because her store is located in the busy market. The family has a big piece of land from which they raise chickens and ducks to earn more income for the family. Recently, to make the family more healthy, S. has decided to request a loan of $ 500 to buy ducks for the family to raise and to renovate her house. The loan will help the family upgrade their standard of living. She dreams of her children having a degree.

loans.use: To buy ducks for the family to raise and to renovate her house

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 63 years old and widowed with six children. All of her children are adults, though her two youngest still live at home with her. Cristina sells tools and hardware items at a stand at the market in the town of Anta, located about forty minutes outside of Cusco. She has been in this line of work for about ten years. Cristina works seven days a week from 6am to 8pm, and sells about 120-150 soles’ worth of merchandise per day.

Cristina is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in her business to buy hammers, nails, screws, and other tools. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Cristina’s dream is to continue working for many more years. She is pictured below with her two-year-old granddaughter, who accompanied her to her loan disbursal meeting.

loans.use: Buy hammers, nails and other hardware items.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana O. is a 34 year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with four children. Two of her children are in school and the others are working. Diana is very supportive of her family and committed to the service of her maker. In her restaurant she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup.  Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup.Diana has been in business for the past 7 years.  Diana says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Diana belongs to a village bank called ‘Bisa Nyame’ which literally means "Ask God".

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Rose Nantale ‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 4 member group. She is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 18 years old. All of her children go to school. She resides and owns a three-roomed house, where she lives with seven people. (Rose takes care of additional family members.) They have electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Rose resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She runs a tailoring shop in Bukoto. She sells to an average of 4 people a day and she has many different types of customers. Rose works six days a week. She buys clothing materials in Kampala City and pays for her own transport costs. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and electricity. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Rose's main challenges are thieves and the seasonality of shopping.

Rose has been with MCDT for over six years. This will be her 12th loan. She has been working with the same group-mates for all six years. Rose wants to use this loan to buy more cloth materials. One day, she aspires to have her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more cloth material

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Frola owns a food vendor store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Kilimahewa 1 Group  (Group code 2020).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  $430. Every day she works at her store for 12 hours.  

Frola is 40 years old, married, and has six  children: the ages of her first five children are 25, 23, 22, 18  and 7, and she has a sixth younger child.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add to her current stock.  She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add her current stock, to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel E. sells foodstuffs retail to her customers. She is married with 5 children and she is 38 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Mabel says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Начмудинов Сафарбек проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 58 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сафарбек более 18 лет работал по специальности, "адвокатом". В данный момент, он более 8 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Safarbek N. lives in the Rumy district. He is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. Safarbek spent over 18 years working in his field, as a lawyer. At the moment, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He feeds and sells cattle. Our client is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
M. MADINA
ID:11967700001702056
KIGALI BRANCH(VFC FIELD OFFICE)
CREDIT OFFICER: NYIRAMARIRO SPECIOSE

Greetings from Kigali,

M. Madina is 42 years old, married to one husband, and has six children (24, 23, 19, 15, 12, and 9 years old).She is experienced for six years in selling clothes for children and dishes at Kigali-Nyarugenge with a profit of 200,000RWF each month. Now she is applying for her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda for 500,000 Rwandan Francs. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business by buying more clothes for children and dishes for selling in order to get more profits than before. At this time, she is selling as a retailer because of poor investment but she hopes that once she gets the loan, it will permit her to sell as a retailer and wholesaler at the same time. By doing both operations, obviously she will get more profits than before. And with the increased profits, she expects to send her children to beautiful schools for higher education and get more food for her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes for children and dishes

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
la sra Fermina V. J. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como ser naranjas, toronjas, chiles, yuca, cebolla, papas etc. 
Fermina tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, nos comento que en estos momentos esta pasando una situacion dificil ya que no tiene capital para comprar las frutas y verduras que ella vende, solo compra poco con lo que vende a diario, ella necesita el credito para poder hacer crecer su negocio.
Fermina tiene un espiritu de trabajo y superacion muy grande.
su meta es poder tener un local solo para tener su producto y tambien le gustaria tener vehiculos para transportar sus verduras y frutas.

loans.use: compra de naranjas, toronjas, repollos, tomates, chiles, yuca, cebolla, melones, sandias, papas.

loans.name: Mukhlisa

texts.en:
For 25 years, Mukhlisa has had a small business which sells women’s underwear. She is married with three children. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. Mukhlisa is asking for a loan to help renew her clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors and this loan will help Mukhlisa purchase a good supply so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing

loans.name: My Children Business Group

texts.en:
Ruth L. B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called My Children Business. She is 34 years old and a college student. Ruth is a single mother of three children aged 12-18 years old and their educational levels are 9th grade to 1st year university. She also cares for four siblings. She lives at and sells on the VOA Road, Brewerville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Ruth's business is food preparation and she sells to the residents of VOA Road. She has been running this business for four years and is grateful to the business for taking care of herself and her children. Ruth's difficulty she faces with her business is when her business money gets stolen.

Preparing her food is the best way that Ruth attracts her customers. She needs this loan in order to purchase more food and ingredients to grow her business. Becoming an international businesswoman is Ruth's dream, so as to give herself and her children a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more food and ingredients to grow her business

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.en: S. Mirzo was born in 1969 in the Kumsangir district, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has six children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Mirzo owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of $2,800 to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. The money he is requesting will help guarantee a high-quality harvest for which Mirzo and his entire family are very thankful. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Apprentices Group

texts.es: Grupo muy responsable y solidario en sus pagos, se conocen bien, no cuentan con muchas necesidades por ejemplo D. alcantarillados, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "PRINCIPIANTES", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 3º Ciclo, se dividio del BE "San Andres" la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Maria Laura, ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 3 hijos es casada su esposo y ella trabajan con panaderia. Como tesorera esta el socio Ivan  quien es muy responsable y conocedor del manejo del efectivo no tiene hijos es estudiante y trabaja con taxi trufi (taxi D. ruta fija), el credito lo utiliza para ayudar a su familia. Como secretario esta el socio Luis Carlos es soltero no tiene hijos trabaja D. taxi trufi, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su movilidad.
texts.en:
The Apprentices Group is a Communal Bank that is starting its third loan cycle. The group was previously part of the San Andres Communal Bank, but split off to form its own entity. The members are very responsible and supportive of one another with their payments. They do not have many needs other than the basic necessities such as sewage services, clean drinking water, etc.

The group leaders are as follows:

Sra. Maria Laura is the group president and a very responsible leader. She is married, has 3 children, and works in a bakery.

Sr. Ivan is the group treasurer and is very responsible and knowledgeable with his handling of cash. He does not have any children and works as a driver of a “trufi” taxi (a taxi that operates on a fixed route). His loan will enable him to support his family.

Sr. Luis Carlos is the group secretary. He is single, has no children, and also works as a “trufi” taxi driver. He will use his loan to pay for maintenance to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: A. Célestine est née en 1967 et réside au quartier Sètovi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis neuf ans. Célestine est mariée à AKPOLI Moïse, un revendeur. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Seul le conjoint supporte les charges de la famille. Célestine n'a jamais fréquenté. Il y a de cela sept ans que Célestine mène comme activité la vente de divers articles (pâtes alimentaires, savons, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, haricot, maïs, farine de manioc, piles, huile végétale, etc.)à son domicile. Célestine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Célestine a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit de ALIdé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son étalage, Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Célestine was born in 1967 and has been residing in the Sètovi district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nine years. She is married to AKPOLI Moïse, a retailer. The couple has four children in school to support. Three of the children are theirs. The husband is the only one covering family expenses. Célestine has never attended school. For seven years since then, she has been running a business selling a variety of goods (pasta, soaps, canned foods, milk mayonnaise, beans, corn, cassava flour, batteries, vegetable oil, etc.) out of her home. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid. With the aim of increasing her capital and bolstering her display of goods, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of bean, corn, cassava flour, pasta

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, padre de 7 hijos ya independizados y vive junto a su esposa en el caserío Quemazón, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que tenía 20 años de edad empezó a criar animales para venderlos. Usualmente compra ganado caprino, ovino, porcino y aves de corral para criarlos y luego ir a venderlos dos veces por mes a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es el único ingreso permanente con el que cuenta ya que también se dedica a la agricultura pero esta actividad sólo le brinda ingresos por temporadas.

Gracias al negocio de la venta de animales ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. José desea ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales.

José desea seguir trabajando e invertir las ganancias en el mejoramiento de su hogar ya que las fuertes lluvias de los años anteriores han mermado las estructuras y estas no soportarían otra temporada de lluvias. El es muy resposable y entregado a su familia. Ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, married, and the father of 7 children who now live independently. He and his wife live in the village of Quemazón, Mórrope District, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

When he was 20 years old, José started raising animals to sell. He usually buys goats, sheep, pigs, and chickens to raise. Twice a month, he travels to Chiclayo to sell animals. This business is his only steady source of income. José also engages in farming, but the income from his crop harvests is on a seasonal basis.

Thanks to his business of buying and selling animals, José was able to support his children. He wants to expand his business, but he does not have enough available capital. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can purchase more animals.

José wants to continue working so that he can invest his profits in making home improvements. Heavy rains over the years have eroded the infrastructure of his house, making it incapable of withstanding another rainy season. He is very responsible and extremely devoted to his family. José has worked with our Institution previously and has demonstrated that he is a responsible client when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina S., tiene 40 años, vive en  el Barrio de la  Francia, es casada y su esposo es Contador Público y ayuda con los gastos de la casa, ellos tiene 4 hijos entre las edades de 23, 18, 13 y 4 años, la hija mayor es casada y los otros hijos actualmente se encuentran estudiando, ellos se dedican al cultivo de piña, siendo este su mayor ingreso, tienen 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y uno de los problemas a los cuales le han hecho frente, ha sido la escases de agua potable, debido a la zona donde habitan, no les llega el agua con frecuencia, ellos planifican que estarían diversificando sus cultivos con la ayuda de este préstamo, pues lo desean para poder comprar fertilizantes y poder darle mejor mantenimiento al cultivo, que a largo plazo significaría la multiplicidad de los cultivos y un mayor ingreso económico que ayudaría en gran medida a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
