Sra. Rosa Argentina S. is 40 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Francia. Her husband is a Certified Public Accountant and helps with the household expenses. They have four children ages 23, 18, 13, and 4. The oldest daughter is married and the other children currently attend school.

Rosa grows pineapple as her main source of income and has 16 years of experience in this activity. One of the problems she faces is the lack of potable water since it does not reach her area very often. Rosa plans to diversify her crops with the help of this loan. She wants to buy fertilizers so that she can improve the maintenance of her crops. In the long term, she would like to raise a variety of crops so that she can increase her income and improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es: Victoriana  tiene 31 años y vive con Miguel de 45 años, con quien desea tener un hijo pronto, por lo que buscan estabilizarse económicamente, habitan en una casa que es alquilada.Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la cocina ; trabaja en un restaurante en una zona comercial y en ese lugar  aprendió  todos los secretos para atender a los mas exigentes comensales, considera que la venta de comida es bastante rentable; Victoriana no gana lo suficiente, pero si le alcanza para su manutención, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien se dedica a realizar servicio de transporte en un motocarro en la ciudad, se ha dado cuenta que el negocio de comida  es bastante rentable, por lo que desea aperturar un restaurante de comidas típicas de la selva del Perú, además de comprar un motocarro , y brindarlo en alquiler ; también tiene planeado comprar un inmueble en la ciudad, en una zona céntrica y construir su casa para instalar ahí en el negocio de venta de comida.Es el primer préstamo que  tiene con MFP y sabe que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas porque es muy responsable.El dinero del préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de un motocarro  y brindarlo en alquiler para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Victoriana is 31 years old and lives with Miguel, who is 45, and with whom she would like to have a child soon. This is why they are seeking to become financially stable. They live in a rented house. For a year and a half now, she works cooking; she works at a restaurant in a commercial zone and in that place she learned all the secrets to tend to the most demanding customers. She considers selling food fairly profitable. Victoriana does not make enough, but she can support herself and in addition she can count on the financial support of her husband who offers the service of transportation in motocar in the city. She has realized that the food business is fairly profitable so she wants to open a restaurant of food traditional to the jungle of Peru, in addition to buying a motorcar and offer it for rent. She also has planned to buy a property in the city, down town, and build her house to set up her food selling business there. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows she will make the payments punctually because she is very responsible. She will invest the money from the loan in buying a motorcar to offer it for rent and obtain greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motocar to expand her own business

loans.name: Ismi

texts.en:
Ismi I. is a 39-year-old poultry breeder who lives in the small village of Agsu. He is married and has three children.

Ismi started his business in 2003 with five turkeys but, step by step, he gained clients, mainly restaurant owners, and now the demand for turkey has increased by five times.

Now, Ismi requests 960 AZN to purchase more turkeys, to build a small place to keep them, and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase more turkeys, fodder, and to build a shed

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 32 year old married man with two daughters who are both attending school. He has been running “Vangulo”, his salon and barber shop, for the past four years. His other source of income is from renting houses.

With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase a blow dryer and a shaving machine. He hopes to own his own plot of land someday and to open more salons and barber shops in Kingstone. Douglas describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and a shaving machine

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda Z. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro C. C., tiene la edad de 58 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la pareja y un hijo de 16 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos que ofrece en su pulpería. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Alvaro C. C. is 58 years old and lives with his common-law wife and a 16 year old son. He wants a loan in order to buy inventory for his business. He desires to have a greater amount and variety of products to offer in his grocery store. He began this business many years ago and he has very good customers, and he sees that he needs to offer a greater variety of products. He also wants to bring more money into the home. It is not the first time he has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very thankful for the help they have been in his life. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability, and also to keep growing as a businessman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Marta Estebana

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este Cliente es de Telica y tiene 20 años de dar clase y durante este tiempo ella ha buscado como superar y crear buenas condiciones para su núcleo familiar. 
A raíz que ella está trabajando y con los préstamo que ha tenido ha logrado construir un cuarto para estar más cómoda y crearle mejores condiciones al hogar.
texts.en:
This client is from Telica and she has been giving classes for the past 20 years. During this time, she has searched for a way to succeed and create good conditions for her nuclear family.

As a result, she is working and with the loans that she has had, she has been able to build a more comfortable room and create better housing conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing repairs

loans.name: Makiese Plus Group

texts.en:
Pitshou, single and aged 33, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Makiese Plus”, which is composed of thirty-three members. They are united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the micro-finance institute HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Pitshou started his business in 2005 with $25 as initial capital. He manages his business in the northeastern part of Kinshasa. He has already received four different loans from HOPE DRC and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to purchase two 10 kilogram cartons of fish, one 10 kilogram cartons of sardines and two 15 kilogram cartons of soap for resale with the aim of increasing his profits.

Each week, Pitshou’s business brings in a profit of $102. His ambition is to open a store in his area. He is determined to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Kibimbiri Development Group B

texts.en:
For the last eight years, N. Abdul, aged 35 years, has been selling cows and goats to earn a living in the Kihihi area in western Uganda. Abdul deals with farmers directly to purchase their livestock and then finds a ready market for them. His main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices of cattle and low capital input.

With determined resolve and efficient customer-care skills, Abdul has managed to keep his business going. In a month, he says, he makes profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings.

Abdul’s future plans are to fully expand his transactions, which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s educational requirements. With this loan, he anticipates great strides in achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to match the demand

loans.name: Gagne Group

texts.fr:
GAGNE, est un groupe de solidarité composé de 07 membres tous issus du même village BAMBATO dans la région de Kolda et distant d'environs de 100 kilomètre de la capitale régionale de Ziguinchor. Elles sont toutes des femmes mariées exceptée Madame Jacqueline N. qui observe encore un veuvage. Elles sont des femmes âgées en moyenne de 45 ans et toutes mères d'au moins de 05 enfants.

Elles font partie d'un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO. Elles forment un groupe très solidaire et très actif dans les activités de leur Banc Villageois. Ces membres évoluent dans le même secteur d'activité commerciale et fréquentent les mêmes marchés qu'elles maîtrisent bien. 

Ce nouveau prêt leur permettra d'acheter de l'huile de palme des arachides du poisson frais et du "nététou" afin de mieux développer leur activité commerciale au niveau des marchés de leur localité. Le "nététou" est un produit alimentaire locale transformé à partir de fruits d'arbre. 

La présidente du groupe de solidarité, Madame Béatrice M. est âgée de 47 ans et mère de 8 enfants en charge et des 02 enfants de sa co-épouse décédée. Elle fait principalement la transformation de nététou qu'elle vend à Dakar, capitale du Sénégal. Par ce prêt elle espère accroître sa capacité de production et augmenter ses revenus financiers afin de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
GAGNE is a solidarity group composed of seven members, all from the same village of BAMBATO in the region of Kolda and about 100 km from the regional capital of Ziguinchor.  The group members are all married women, except Ms. Jacqueline N. continuing to live a widow's life. These women, averaging 45 years of age, are all mothers who have at least five children who make up one of the solidarity groups that form the Banc Villageois de BAMBATO.  GAGNE is a tight-knit and very active group in the activities of their Banc Villageois.  These members are involved in the same sector of commerce and frequent the same markets that they are mastering well.  This new loan will enable them to buy palm oil, peanut oil, fresh fish, and nététou in order to develop further their business at the markets of their town.  Nététou is a local food made from tree fruit.  The solidarity group's president, Ms. Béatrice M., is 47 years old and the mother of eight children to support plus two children of her deceased co-wife.  Béatrice mainly makes nététou and sells it in Dakar (capital of Senegal).  With this loan, she hopes grow her production capacity and to increase her revenues in order do more to support her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and advancing their businesses in the solidarity group

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old. He is married and has five children, ages 3-12. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for six years. He has employed four people from the community to help in his farm. His main products are jaggery (unrefined sugar) and maize, which he sells to retail shops. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to Kenya Tea Development Authority. 

His major challenges in farming are the changes in climatic conditions (especially floods that hamper transportation of his goods) and the middlemen who take advantage of farmers by buying products at a low price.

He has requested a loan of KES 35,000 from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Through this loan, he will be able to acquire a high quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and for sale. The extra income from this loan will help him educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaila Samaké est homme marié de 45 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni.
Monsieur Soumaila Samaké a abandonné l’école dés son jeune âge. Il  tenta pendant des années, différentes activités sans succès. Alors il décida d’apprendre les activités de collage et de soudure auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de 4 ans Monsieur Soumaila maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement indispensable à la bonne marche de ses activités , il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 15 douzaines de baguettes, 3 pneus et  20 chambres à air.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) Son atelier est situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso. Sa clientèle est  diverse et variée.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise pour bien attirer la clientèle.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaila Samaké is married and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the North Hérémakono borough of Bougouni. Mr. Soumaila Samaké left school at an early age. He tried his hand at different activities without success. He then decided to learn from his uncle the business of glueing and welding. After four years’ experience he has mastered this activity. To acquire the working capital necessary for the proper running of his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where he is requesting a first loan. We will use the loan to buy 15 dozen welding rods, three tires and 20 inner tubes. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His workshop is located on the road linking Bougouni to Sikasso. His customers are diverse and varied. He is expecting to attain monthly earnings of 65,000 FCFA he will use to improve his business and attract more customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Siline

texts.en:
Siline V. is 51 and married with 7 children (ages 3 - 21).  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Siline has 3 years of experience in this business.  Siline needs a loan of WST$1750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Siline joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Siline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Koguilan 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Koguilan 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MATOU F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioîla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 27500FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Koguilan 6 group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children. They live, mostly in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Matou F. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to plow about one hectare of peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Fana and Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 27,500 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Subita

texts.en:
Mrs. Subita L. lives in Chetrapati which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores.

Mrs. L. lives with her husband, who works in a government office, and two children. She has one son and one daughter: her daughter is studying in grade 5 and her son is in grade 4.

Mrs. L. is engaged in her own small restaurant which she opened four years ago. She sells different types of food items in her restaurant, especially Nepali food. She also serves tea and coffee.

Now, Mrs. L. is requesting an Rs 20,000 loan to purchase necessary food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su pareja Juan de 43 años y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores son independientes. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, arveja, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado. Durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, en donde carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen de la ciudad. Además le gusta mucho este trabajo ya que lo desempeña desde muy joven, y en la actualidad le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también prepara y comercializa comida en la feria de la ciudad. Como mujer emprendedora que es, tiene planeado en adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando. Basilia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Basilia, 45, lives in her own house alongside her partner Juan, 43, and 5 of their 7 children (the oldest 2 are independent). This hard-working lady works in agriculture together with her husband, sowing potatoes, peas, maize and gladioli flowers. She affirms that you must be very dedicated to your work. Each day they patiently patrol their plots of land, waiting for the harvest and for the time to arrive to gather the production and reap the reward for all their hard work. Basilia and her family load the heavy sacks with products which she sells at regular prices to the wholesalers who come to the city. Basilia likes her work very much and has been doing it since she was very young. It allows her to give her family a good quality of life. Basilia also prepares and sells food in a market in the city. Being an entrepreneurial woman, in the future she plans to sow a greater quantity of crops to improve her earnings. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She is very thankful to everyone who made the loan possible, allowing her to continue to progress. Basilia plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fertilisers that she needs to improve the productivity of her crops, and continue progressing this way.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana B. is from the village of Cabisera II. She is 37 years old. Feliciana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Feliciana has been engaged in her business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Feliciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Feliciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy G.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of San Vicente. Rudy has been in his business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rudy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Rudy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora una mujer entusiasta de 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Sus días las pasa cuidando a sus hijos y trabajando en su terreno donde siembra papa y verduras que después los vende en el mercado de su ciudad; como mujer Nora administra muy bien su dinero y cada vez tiene mayor capital, su meta es sembrar mayor cantidad de verduras para poder ofrecerlas en la capital, pero sabe que necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de hectáreas de cultivo por eso en estos meses esta sembrará una parcela más de papa, afirma que con la ayuda de su banco comunal y de su esposo lo logrará. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece la ayuda que le ofrece su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas, abono y remedio para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Nora, an enthusiastic 41 year old, lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home, located in the town of Llanco. Her days are spent taking care of her children and working in her plot of land where she plants potatoes and vegetables that will later be sold in the market of her town. As a woman, Nora manages her money very well and has more and more capital. Her goal is to plant a greater amount of vegetables to be able to offer in the capital, but she knows that she will need to invest in more farm land. This is why for the next few months she will plant another parcel of potato; she is sure that with the help from her communal bank and her husband she will make it. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the help she receives from the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting she will buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, 26 years old and single, is a member of Funga Leso Group under Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she has learned how to save her money for future use.  For a living, Grace runs a cereal shop with one employee but hopes to expand her business in the future and open a retail shop.  She is now requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions, tomatoes and fruits for her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Narnaa

texts.en: Narnaa N. is a 31-year-old, hardworking woman who lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. They live in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her two older children attend a local secondary school and the youngest goes to kindergarten. Narnaa has been running a farm-animal trading business since 2006 with her husband. They purchase sheep and goats in the spring at 30.000 to 35.000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and resell them in the fall to be slaughtered. The couple has about 350 heads of herd kept nearby for a relative to look after. Her husband Lhagvajav began a transportation business with their micro-bus in 2009. He runs between Ulaanbaatar and his hometown transporting passengers once or twice a month and earns about 400,000 MNT as a profit. Narnaa wants to get their own plot of land from her business profit. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep and goats to slaughter.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and goats

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a single man who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport costs.

He has operated a hawking business, selling charcoal stoves for over two years door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Kennedy faces the major challenge of theft because of a lack of security in his area of operation. He hopes to establish a retail shop to sell his products in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a mkokoteni (hand cart) and the Kenyan ceramic jiko (stove) for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it offers affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a mkokoteni (hand cart ) and the Kenyan ceramic jiko (stove) for resale.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Louise is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 2 (Love and Faith 2), a group of Haitian emigrants. She is a divorced mom and makes her home here in a simple structure with a child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard and return to Haiti, where her family lives. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and sharing with friends.

Louise is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She has been operating her business for more than 5 years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying flour, butter, oil, charcoal and other items. She will use the profits to save and plan her future, while she dreams to return to Haiti.

This Esperanza associate began with us because of the opportunity to get loans, even as a foreigner. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
N. Beatrice lives in the Kasaato Zone of the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of a grandchild.  Beatrice runs a kiosk.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Beatrice sells her products at retail prices.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and mineral water, bread, cakes and doughnuts. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Beatrice include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked kiosk and pay school fees.  She lives in a home that she owns and where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and mineral water, bread, cakes and doughnuts to resell

loans.name: Wilson Richard

texts.es: El señor Wilson dedicado a la compra y venta de repuestos para vehículo esta actividad lo realiza ya hace 3 años atrás siendo este su ingreso para mantener a sus pequeños y a su querida esposa la que en algunas oportunidades ayuda a la economía de la familia, dedicándose a  la venta de refrescos y otras bebidas, este crédito ayudara mucho a esta familia para agrandar su negocio ya que el Sr. Wilson desea comprar repuestos de vehículo por cantidad para así surtir su negocio es un apersona joven y muy trabajadora esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Wilson is dedicated to buying and selling replacement parts for vehicles, an activity he has been involved in for 3 years.  This is the means by which he supports his children and his beloved wife, who also tries to help the family financially when able by selling refreshments and other beverages.

The loan will help this family a great deal, by allowing him to expand his enterprise.  Wilson would like to buy replacement parts in bulk to supply his business.  He is a very hard-working young man, and gives thanks to the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: Working capital to buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Bintihari

texts.en:
Bintiheri is a married woman with six children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated an open air food selling business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bintiheri faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season it becomes a challenge to sell when there is a low turn out of clients. She hopes to open a cafe in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. sells smoked fish at Breman near Elmina. Ama has not received any form of education. She is a widow, taking care of 4 children. Ama has been selling fish for 30 years. She is responsible for paying school fees and other expenses of the children. 

Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish from the shore and then process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish from the shore and then process for sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, estudió educación superior. 
Con su primer préstamo solicitado, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para niños.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Con éste crédito de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, dinero comprará prendas de vestir.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y tener una tienda de ropa de toda clase.	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Las Collabinas" communal bank which is located in the province of El Collao in the department of Puno.  She is 29 years old, single and has a high school education.

She invested her first 300 PEN loan in her children's clothing business.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year now.

She plans to use the new 100 PEN loan to buy more clothing.  Her dream is to grow her business and have her own clothing store one day.

She likes the communal bank because it is punctual and dependable and helps her earn more with her savings.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing and mat-making materials, e.g., needles and a saw

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en: Ombeni J., who is in his early twenties, is single. He has been running a secondhand clothes business for one year. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Ombeni's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase his business. His dream is to have a good stock of clothes. Ombeni will share this loan with his loan group, Jasiri, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Ombeni is the man in front in a white shirt.

loans.use: To increase his business

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du bétail, des condiments et de l’arachide.                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
 DJENEBA T. compte acheter des chèvres et des moutons avec les peuls du village et les environnants, destinés pour être revendus aux clients venus d’ailleurs, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de bétail.
texts.en: The women of the Sinignessigui group, all married, are 43 years old and have 4 children on average, and all live in expanded traditional families in the Wakoro village, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell livestock, spices and peanuts.  The women of the Sinignessigui group are on their first group loan.  Djeneba T. plans to buy goats and sheep from the shepherds of the village and the surrounding areas, which she intends to resell to clients from elsewhere, for cash and credit, to a customer base composed mainly of men.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to make loan payments and contributions to social ceremonies, while the rest will be reinvested in her livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years old and married, with two children 3 and 13 years old. Joy has owned her business for six years. It is a large and clean shop where she sells items such as toilet paper, water, tomato sauce, body lotion, etc. Joy is a hard worker who employs one other person to help her. Her store is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Joy has requested a loan in order to purchase more tomato sauce, toilet paper and toothpaste to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Yeanoh S.. She is divorced and has 4 children, aged 21, 18, 15 and 11 years. She has 3 additional dependents who live with her  -- they are her elder brother’s children.  In 2008, Yeanoh established a business selling cooked rice. She began her business because it is the only means of taking care of her family. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business.

Yeanoh S. would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy rice, palm oil, pepper and other materials that she uses for cooking. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. In the future, Yeanoh plans to build a house and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice and other cooking materials for her business

loans.name: Juviline

texts.en:
Juviline M., 34, is married and has four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Juviline has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Juviline has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and equipment for her fishing business.

In the future, Juviline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos (independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudio.
Flora trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace nueve años,  su  primer préstamo fue D.  S/.  300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su antiguo negocio, ella se dedicaba a la venta D. animales caseros, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. muebles y realiza algunos bordados.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/.  400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar 30 maderas para la fabricación D. sus muebles, ella fabrica mesas, sillas, roperos.  Trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.  Ella nos cuenta que los muebles  los venD. en la localidad D. Desaguadero.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la reunión donD. las capacitan y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the communal lender “Nuevo Amanecer”, in Juli, Chucuito, Puno.  She is 55, married and has 5 children who live independently.  She has not had the opportunity to study.  For the past 9 years, Flora has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, where her first loan was for  S/.  300.00 soles, which she invested in a business to sell domestic animals.  Currently she works selling furniture and sewing.
With this credit of S/.  400.00 soles, she will buy 30 wooden planks to make several pieces of furniture such as tables, chairs and chests of drawers.  Flora works together with her family and sells the furnishings in the town of Desaguadero.  She hopes to grow her business and increase her earnings.
She enjoys her activities with her communal lending association immensely.

loans.use: to buy 30 wooden planks

loans.name: Nelfe

texts.en:
Nelfe, from the village of Taboc, Norte, Oroq. City, is 30 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nelfe owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nelfe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 20000 PHP to invest in expanding the business by purchasing more fishing nets, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by purchasing additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Joesita has a shop that sells snacks, eggs, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

Joesita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joesita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es: El señor Custodio nació en Mairana Provincia Florida del departamento de Santa Cruz,  casado con la Sra. Benita tienen 7 hijos algunos todavía se encuentran en edad escolar, trabajan en la Pampa el Cosal a 30 km de San Luis, donde tiene su parcela y su casa el trabaja agricultura siembra maíz, sandia, poroto pero más se dedica a la ganadería, también tiene su Huerta de cítricos como ser Naranja y Mandarina, sus hijos le ayudan el lo que es la siembra y su esposa en comercializar los productos en el mercado de la zona, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de motocicleta ya que necesita para transportarse, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Custodio lives in Mairana Province, Florida, Santa Cruz, and is married to Benita; they have 7 school-age children.  They work in Pampa el Cosal, 30 km from San Luis, where they have an agricultural plot and plant corn, watermelon, citrus, mandarin oranges and other crops.  They also raise cattle, and with the help of their children they harvest and market their crops in local markets.  They plan to use this loan to buy a motorcycle, to more efficiently transport their products.  Custodio is a hard worker and is grateful for this credit.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 28-year-old married woman with four daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a truck driver.
For the past nine years, Loan has been making an income to support her family by selling socks, accessories, masks and shoes for women. She would like to take a loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses, especially education fees for her daughters. Loan hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy socks, accessories, masks and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: To support the family in prosperity and happiness like others, Mrs. Pheap and her husband try to find a suitable way to support their children .Presently, she is a vermicelli seller in one market near her community. As for her husband, he selects and sets the wedding date for couples. Both of them earn about $8 per day. They have given birth to two kids. One of the children is married and lives separately from the parents. To help the family live comfortably and honorably in her community, she would like a loan of $1,200 to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Sseguya

texts.en:
Sseguya is 39 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is divorced and has 3 children. All of his children are currently in school. Sseguya has a business of a bar, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Sseguya has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sodas and beer for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sseguya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Sseguya hopes to expand his business. Sseguya is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее сын находится в России. Сама она занимается животноводством. Она в основном разводит скот у себя дома. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Fotima lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 49 years old, married and has five children.  Her son is in Russia.  Fotima is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily breeds livestock at home.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  Fotima has been involved in this business for twenty years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 36 años es una mujer luchadora; hace tan solo 3 años que se separó de su esposo; pero como una madre responsable cuida de sus 2 hijos: Kainer y Rocío. Desde entonces se convirtieron en una familia muy unida, que viven en casa de su madre, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Cuando vivía, con su esposo ella tenía un pequeño puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma; ahí vendía verduras a los pobladores que visitaban el mercado; pero como la inestabilidad económica llegó a su hogar, producto de su separación. Ella decide dedicarse a la agricultura; es así que con el apoyo de su madre, se establece en el pueblo, donde comienza a sembrar papa y maíz, sus productos son muy buenos y en cada cosecha que obtiene, puede ver sus esfuerzos plasmados. Además viaja constantemente a la capital del país, donde negocia su producción a buen precio. Pero como trabajadora incansable, ella vende hamburguesa, en la esquina de su casa los sábados y domingos por la noche. Así cada día agradece a Dios por el apoyo que le brinda y desea seguir sembrando, para ganar más experiencia. Pues su principal meta es sacar a sus hijos adelante y a pesar que tiene una enfermedad en el ojo; no se desanima. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores de casacoto” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está  feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que las personas son emprendedoras, que triunfan a pesar de las dificultades. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Maribel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “canchan” y “única”. Asimismo surtirá su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
36-year-old Maribel is a tenacious woman.  Just three years ago she separated from her husband but she is a responsible mother and still cares for her two children: Kainer and Rocío.  Since the separation, they have become a very united family.  They live in her mother's house which is located in the town of Casacoto.  When she lived with her husband, Maribel had a small stall in Tarma central market.  There she sold vegetables to the local people who visited the market.  However, financial instability reached her household as a result of her separation and Maribel decided to start working in agriculture.  With the support of her mother, she set herself up in the village and started growing potatoes and corn.  Her produce is very good quality and, with every harvest that she obtains, she can see her efforts rewarded.  Maribel travels constantly to the capital city where she negotiates the sale of her produce for a good price.  

As the tireless hard worker that she is, Maribel also sells hamburgers on the corner outside her home on Saturday and Sunday evenings.  Every day she thanks God for the support that he gives her.  She would like to continue growing crops in order to gain more experience.  Her main goal is to get her children ahead in life and, in spite of the fact that she has an illness in her eye, she does not lose heart.

Maribel is a member of the 'Miraflores de Casacoto' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She is happy to be a member of her community bank because the people are entrepreneurs and they succeed in spite of difficulties.  Maribel pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over her potato crops (she grows 'canchan' and 'única' varieties).  She will also stock her food store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and supplies for making food

loans.name: Infiliatah

texts.en: Infiliatah is a hardworking business lady aged 48. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last nine years she has sold clothes to make a living. She has retained her business because of her good customer care. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. Her dream is to buy a piece of land. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary inició su negocio, despues de trabajar como empleada en empresas cuando sintió la necesidad  de continuar apoyando su hogar desde muy cerca y con ingresos para lograr con su esposo el bienestar de  sus 2 hijos hoy de 13 y 17 años.  Ella se dedica a la comercialización de calzado femenino, masculino e infantil, a través de guias especializadas de productos y le ha ido muy bien, su clientela crece y cada dia requiere de mayor capital de trabajo para lograr aumentar sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará calzado que le han encargado y que la revista propone con descuentos especiales y le proporciona un márgen de utilidad importante, pues estaá enfocada en la línea deportiva que es de muy buena rotación y esto es justamente el éxito de esta inversión. En su negocio los inventarios rotan cada 20 dias y maneja una rentabilidad promedi de 38%. Sueña con una educación de calidad para sus hijos por eso se esmera y ellos son su fuente de inspiración para su duro trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Mary started her business after having worked as an employee in different companies.  She felt the need to continue supporting her household from very close by and to make income which, along with that of her husband, would ensure the well-being of their two children who are now 13 and 17 years old.

Mary sells women's, men's and children's footwear through specialized product catalogs.  Her business has done very well.  Her customer base is growing and every day she needs more working capital in order to increase her sales and thereby her income.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use the money to buy footwear which people have ordered from her and which the catalog is offering with special discounts which will give her a good profit margin.  Mary is focused on sports shoes which have a very good turnover and this is precisely why this investment will be a success.  In her business, Mary's stock turnover period is 20 days and she makes an average return of 38%.  She dreams of providing her children with a good-quality education and this is why she works very hard.  Her children are the source of inspiration behind all her hard daily work.

loans.use: to buy footwear that people have ordered from her and which the catalog is offering with special discounts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is happily married, and has been blessed with three children. She is 47 years old and has been running her furniture shop for three years. She is grateful because her business is growing. Gloria would like to buy additional woods and varnish due to many orders, but her funds are not enough, so she is asking for financial support in the amount of P5,000. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to make her dreams come true and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase woods and varnish for her furniture shop business.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
Betzabe de 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Betzabe desde hace unos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Betzabe es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante por si sola para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Betzabe, 24, is single and lives in her parents' house, which has water and electricity, located in the district of Bambamarca in the department of Cajamarca.  The people in this area work in agriculture and livestock.

Betzabe has been raising and selling yard animals (pigs and chickens) for several years.  Her corrals, located behind her house, are appropriate and spacious.  She feeds her animals balanced feed and natural grains so they will have optimum growth.  In this way she will be able to sell them in the different markets in the area and make a good profit to pay her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With the profits she makes from the sale of her animals she will be able to cover her loan as well as have a better quality of life.

Betzabe is a woman who with effort and great determination has known how to get ahead by herself to continue helping her parents economically.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 57-year-old married man with six children living in a semi permanent house in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been farming cocoa and also trading in it for the last 20 years. He intends to use this money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Bircaqiz

texts.en:
Bircaqiz is married and has one son and one daughter. She is a 50-year-old woman who sells various merchandise. She has 7 years of experience in this field. Her monthly income from the business is 280 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN).

Bircaqiz would like to expand her business, purchase more items, and open a new store in one of the central streets of Agsu. For this purpose she requested a loan of 1000 AZN. This is her second loan, and after she repays it she plans to apply for more loans to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Ndéye Ndoumbour

texts.fr:
Madame Ndéye Ndoumbour est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de 3 enfants .Elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2009 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Malick.
Ndéye fait du petit commerce dans la vente de céréales ( mil et arachide).Avec son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs Cfa elle va acheter 10 tonnes de mil 40 sacs d arachides.
A l aide de ses bénéfices Ndéye va Aider mari dans la gestion de besoins scolaires des enfants et payer de la nourriture a ces derniers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndéye Ndoumbour is a 53-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 9 January 2009 and is part of the sope Malick solidarity group.

Ndéye is a small retail merchant trading in cereals (millet and peanuts). With her new loan of 500,000 CFA francs she will buy 10 tons of millet and 40 bags of peanuts.

With her profits Ndéye will help her husband manage the educational and food requirements of their children.

loans.use: buy millet and peanuts

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Clemencia is married and has three grown-up children.

To make a living, Clemencia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Clemencia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for making suman. Suman are Filipino rice cakes steamed in banana leaves.

Recently Clemencia joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as additional investment for her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be saved for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make suman (rice cakes).

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 41-year-old Iraqi mother of two. In addition of being a wife and a mother she is also eager to work and help secure an additional income for her family. 

In her modest home she has a small, warm working space of some 2 square-meters where she creates beautiful, colorful dresses for women. She would like to manage her own working time, however this is rather difficult as the electricity in the city is often interrupted, at times the black-out is for hours. 

Bayan took a loan of 1200 USD from Relief International-Iraq in order to purchase a new sewing machine and a small generator to ensure a continuous source of power allowing her to manage her own time and work on making beautiful dresses.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж работает строителем. Чтобы помогать мужу для содержания семьи она начала заниматься торговлей 12 лет назад и имеет богатый опыт. Она продает игрушки на местном рынке. Раньше её мать занималась этим, и она помогала, а затем открыла свою точку. Этот бизнес является прибыльным, много потребителей. С прибылью она купила 4 голов мелкого рогатого скота и откармливает их дома. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки новых товаров, особенно Новогодних игрушек.
texts.en: Gulnora is a married, loving mother of four children. Her husband works in construction. To help her husband support their family, she went into the retail business 12 years ago and has extensive experience. She sells toys at the local market. In the past Gulnora helped her mother when she was involved in the same business, and then she opened up her own retail outlet. This business is profitable, and has a large clientele. With the profits, Gulnora bought 4 heads of small horned livestock and is raising them for future resale at home. She would like a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy new merchandise, especially toys for New Year's.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Sicelia

texts.en:
Sicelia is a 40-year-old married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Her husband Boniface, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. 

Sicelia has operated a retail shop for the past 4 years selling a variety of items, along with vegetables and fruits. Her clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, bananas, sugar and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, bananas, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Gisèle (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 51 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gisèle est mariée à un certain Jules. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gisèle vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Gisèle prépare de la nourriture qu'elle à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'années. Gisèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Gisèle ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz et des condiments.
